Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great room”
Reviews.Author: Amanda2410
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in April and wished we had booked for our full 4 nights there. We are a family of 5, we had a 2 BR suite. The master was huge with a king bed, TV and full ensuite. We did not have a room with a view of the Bellagio fountains, which we had asked for, but we could see the Bellagio out of the windows and on the roof of the hotel there are cameras that stream live footage of the fountains and the strip straight to the big TV in the room. That was the next best thing and we appreciated that. The second BR had a Queen bed and there was a fold out queen in the lounge room. It had a full kitchen, but we were hardly there so we didnt use it. It was very clean and smoke free, the advantage of not staying in a casino. The location could not be better, it is nestled between the Bellagio and the Cosmopolitan, across the road from Paris and Planet Hollywood, and the Miracle Mile shopping complex where we spent a fair bit of time! The pool is no good, small and gets no sun but you have access to the Cosmopolitan pool (you have to ask about that, it wasnt offered but we knew about it from here!). The Cosmo pool is lovely and has a bar and bikini clad waitresses. Its a nice place to take a rest from the antics of the strip. It is a time share hotel and you will get invited/offered to attend their meetings, we were on to that (again, from trip advisor reviews!), and stopped them in their tracks barely before they got a few words out! We didnt find it a problem. I would highly recommend the Jockey Club, especially for a family with kids. We really couldnt fault it.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: breakbeat
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2 bed suite (with additional pull out sofa bed), as there was a group of 5 of us visiting Vegas for my wedding. It was excellent value for money, and if travelling again in a similar sized group would stay here again. We rented our room through an apartment agency recommended by an American friend and we did not have to sit through any time share presentations, although we walked past a few. Each bedroom was large with flat screen tv, comfy beds and extra pillows. The closet was enormous - larger than some hotel bathrooms I've used before now! We had a full working kitchen with oven, microwave, fridge, freezer (ice already stocked) & dishwasher - this was a godsend as we didn't fancy eating out for every single meal. The pool is small and probably get most sun in the morning - but nice and quiet and if you've checked out the website you'll know the story behind the Jockey Club & Cosmopolitan but we couldn't be bothered to check out the cosmopolitan's pool etc. The staff at the jockey club were all really pleasant and helpful, and there is free parking. It really is right on strip, but blink and you'll miss the entrance sandwiched between the Bellagio & Cosmopolitan. Alternatively, there is a lift on one side of the building that leads straight into the Comso casino floor. After staying at one of the bigger Casino/Hotels on the strip we preferred the quietness and much more tranquil atmosphere of the Jockey Club - nice to get away from the bustle now and then.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: ak_gypsy949
Reviews.Content: Unless you really want to suffer a time share presentation, just say no. Otherwise, it is a great place, a little bit older but right next to the Bellagio and very convenient to everything. I didn't have a view of anything but another building but that was fine with me. The apartments are well furnished and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, helpful staff & free parking-we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: JDRCapeCod
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Jockey Club. Here is what you need to know: -Excellent location on the Strip. Easy access to the highway and all of the attractions -Two bedroom suite was great. One room had two beds and the other had a single. Two bathrooms (one with a full sized shower, the other with a tub). Large living room, full kitchen, three TVs, stereo...it was great! -Not all rooms have a view. The Cosmopolitan was built after the Jockey Club. All of the rooms on one size of the building have a view of a cement wall. We were on the other side and had a great view. -The pool is small, private and heated (open 24 hours). There is a gym, hot tub and sauna. You can use the Bamboo pool at the Cosmoplitian if you show them your room card. Here are a few tips: -When arriving park in the 15 minute area, check in to get your parking pass and then you can self park on floor B3 of the garage. This saves you paying for a valet -Just check in and get your room key. Don't listen to the people that are going to offer you "welcoming gifts", raffles, etc. I did not get hit up for time share at all by just avoiding these folks. They are directly across from the check in area. We really enjoyed our stay at the Jockey Club and we plan on returning. I have stayed in Vegas several times and this was my favorite location. The Polo Towers are also excellent-I would check availability and prices of both and go with the better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: NMDesertSailor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jockey Club through a time share exchange. The Building is a relatively small one wedged into the space between the Cosmopolitan and the Bellagio. Our room was a one bedroom with two queens and a sleeper sofa in the living room. Overall clean attractive and quiet. It was nice to not have to go through a casino every time and it is in the middle of the strip convenient if that's where you want to be. My biggest complaint was figuring out ow to find the parking garage which is shared with the Cosmopolitan. Signage is minimal and when you get to level B3 youhaveto beluckyto figureoutthat the JC elevator is a nondescript set of doors with a tiny sign. Main entrance is off Las Vegas blvd headed south, just before the Cosmo. Watch out for pedestrians especially at night. You can enter through the Cosmo entrance once you know where you are going. Stayed in room 400 which is a handicapped accessible. The only complaint being close to the elevator which had an annoying squeak. Also, the shower did not get as hot as I like, but that may have been ahandicapped safety feature. Let it run and it eventually was ok. Housekeeping made beds daily, unusual for a timeshare and washed dishes once. Pool is fairly small and looked cloudy. It is overshadowed by the larger buildings around and not much good for sunning, however, the shade may be welcome in hotter weather.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - but beware the timeshare people”
Reviews.Author: poker
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Jockey Club from March 1 thru March 31. The location is excellent - according to their website the hotel is "snuggled between the Cosmopolitan and the Bellagion" The hotel has been renovated - but the fact remains that it is one of the older buildings on the Strip. While I was on the 4th floor, facing noirth, and had a view of the Bellagio fountains, I also was able to hear noise from outside (something you don't hear in the newer hotels) There were noisy guests on my floor on a couple of weekends but otherwise it was relatively quiet. There is a full kitchen, and a large living room and bedroom. The bathroon, however, is very small. Big enough for me, but not for two or more people. And, because the bathroom is in the bedroom, it would be rather awkward if there was another couple occupying the sofabed in the living room. There is a shuttle that goes to the grocery store (Smiths) three times a week. There is also a shuttle that goes to both outlet malls once a week. Very handy for those who do not have a car. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping every day is included. The only warning I have is to watch out for the timeshare people. They did not bother me because I am female and was by myself, but they were hauling in naive tourists from the Strip with promises of free dinner and show tickets and I overheard some of the hardcore "closers" discussing their tactics to sell to the vulnerabl. All in all, it is not a bad place to stay. However, I have stayed at the Signature with the high-end furnishings and finishes, so I had a difficult time not comparing the two places. But, then, the price I paid (through VRBO) was $649 a week and I paid $1300 a week for the unit at the Signature.

Reviews.Title: “If I'm lied to and treated poorly before my stay, it can only be worst once I'm there?”
Reviews.Author: Deedee210
Reviews.Content: I purchased a resort stay and cancelled the next day.When I recived my confirmation, it did not state the items the agent gave me over the phone. Also she lied about her name and the telephone number she gave is for another company. After I paid for the stay, the agent hurried and ended the call and referred me to the confirmation dept. to finalize my purchase. The next day, I called the reservations dept. their jobs is to clear up the misquoted items, and inform you what you really purchased. Th female went on asthough I shouldn't expect to get the items quoted, and it is unreasonable to think I can have a 1 bedroom suite unless it's available. This didn't make since to me either. If the manager allows this, it shows me he/she does not value me at all.

Reviews.Title: “Jockey Club - 7 nights with 6 people”
Reviews.Author: Sidekicknicholas
Reviews.Content: This place is great!!!! I loved everything about it (4 stars due to it being a bit dated). Our Trip: Six friends spending 8 days/7nights in Vegas for three reasons - 1st - I was going to CES, 2nd - My Fiance' was previous Miss Wisconsin contestant and wanted to go watch her friend (Miss Wisconsin - now Miss America) compete, 3rd (most importantly) - I wanted to party my a$$ off. I booked through VRBO months in advance (before CES showed up on the radar) so I was able to get a 2bed/2bath unit with the Bellagio Fountain view, 7 nights for $1100 including taxes. Amazing deal. Our group: Two sets of couples -my fiance' and I and my old college roomie and his girlfriend... the other two were single guys. We split up the sleeping situation with my roomie and his girlfriend in bedroom2 with a single queen bed. Myself, my fiance had a queen bed in bedroom1 which had anothor queen bed where one of the single guys slept. The other guy used a roll-away or the pullout couch in the living room.... we never felt cramped. The huge walk in closet was great for keep everyone's stuff off the floor and out of the way, very nice feature. The Actual Stay: Amazing. Wednesday of CES check in was a breeze (only one person ahead of us in line), other hotels seemed to have 60 min+ waits. The room was ready about 2 hours ahead of time so we went up and loaded our things... then took a limo off the strip to get some food/booze/supplies... the nice thing is the Cosmo valet/limo pickup is about a 60 second walk from the JC entry. Very nice. 7 days worth of food and booze felt easily in the kitchen (which was fully stocked) and had nice newer appliances. The best part of the kitchen was the ability to keep all of our drinks cold between the fridge/freezer; the second best part was coming home from a night out we would always have the drunk munchies so being able to cook a cheap frozen pizza on a whim saved soooo much money compared to a 3am slice somehwere on the strip... and being able to take leftovers back was a nice perk. Since our trip would mostly consist of going out/partying the room was perfect. We had plenty of room for the girls to get ready and the guys could still shower/etc... not having to share a bathroom was great. Also before going out we were all able to sit around a table and drink/pre-game/etc before we left the room... honestly we spent more time than I would have liked in the room because it was so big/nice. The location of the JC cannot be beat - at all. Its amazing how in hotels with a casino it takes 15/20 mins to actually get onto the strip, with the Jockey Club we could go from our 7th floor room to walking down the strip in about 60 seconds. No other hotel can offer that. Also if you wanted to gamble you could take the direct elevator to the Cosmo casino floor in about 60 seconds as well... I doubt Cosmo guests could get there that quickly... and to be to the Bellagio casino floor it was about a 3 minute walk (most of that was on their moving sidewalks). Honestly you cannot beat the location and proximity to the strip itself. The ammenities of the hotel are pretty darn good too. They have a ton of dvds for rent (we didn't use this at all though), TVs in the living room and both bedrooms. A stereo that we were able to hook up Ipods/laptops for music (we brought our own cords though - not provided). The pool, fitness center, and hot tub were open 24/7. The pool area is really cool at night, and the pool was heated although outdoors, we were able to swim (usually drunk) in January, and the hot tub was indoors. There was a small store in the building but the prices were high enough to make walking to an ABC/Walgreens a much better option. The staff was all very friendly, from cleaning, to valet, front desk.... everyone. In our week there we did not get bugged about a timeshare even once. Once or twice we did get a knock on the door about our noise level, but they were very nice and polite - we would quiet down or go out and never had to have them come back. I have two more Vegas trips in the works for this next year, both I will be staying at the Jockey club... my new favorite strip property to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!! Could be just our unit...but don't know for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy2213
Reviews.Content: This was one of the disgusting and filthy places I have ever stayed. The carpet and flooring had several stains and was very dirty. The furniture was so gross nobody even wanted to sit on it. I have never wanted to get out of a room so bad in my life. The common areas had popcorn and other debris all over the floor and wasn't cleaned up for two days during our stay. I was concerned about even opening my luggage. When I tried telling someone about my concerns. I was routed to two different people. I was finally told to call Zimy, the person I made the reservation through, which I did on Monday morning as soon as I returned and as of today, still have not heard back from her. This is terrible customer service! You as a rental agency would be horrified if you saw the condition of this property! I can't imagine being remotely proud to even advertise this unit (#1050). I think you get my point. I would clearly like some sort of response back and would like to talk about either some sort of refund based on this experience. Thank you for the opportunity to share this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Mx_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in exchange from Interval International. In Vegas you are used to walk a lot to get to the Strip, last time we stayed at the Caesars and it took us 15 min to get out of the hotel from our room, this time took us 3 min. The hotel is located at the heart of the Strip, it´s in a small street between the Cosmo and the Bellagio. The rooms are nice and the kitchen has every thing you need, we asked in advance for a room facing the fountains but they told us that could not be done until we checked in. Fortunately we did get one. Overall we loved the place and would stay here agian.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a group!”
Reviews.Author: TheInternationalLine
Reviews.Content: We booked two 2-bedroom condos at the Jockey Club from Las Vegas Tourist Bureau. We were there for a bachelor party, and we wanted to have a place for everyone to hang out without being in individual hotel rooms. Both of our condos were great -- not five star, mind you, but recently renovated with comfy beds, fully stocked kitchens, two full bathrooms with huge warm showers, and lots of living area to hang out with the group. A few things that really set Jockey Club apart from other accommodations: 1. Location - right in the middle of the southern strip, attached to the Cosmo and next door to the Bellagio. 2. Price - two bedroom condos for the price of a hotel room at the Cosmo. 3. Cosmo Amenities - direct access to the Cosmo casino through the "secret" Jockey Club elevators, plus access to all of their incredible pools just by flashing our key cards. Plus, reserved spots in their garage, access to tennis courts, etc. 4. JC Amenities - 24 hour pool, hot tub, and exercise room. Gas grills and picnic tables out by the pool. 5. Friendly Staff - Everyone we encountered was polite and laid back. The front desk staff went out of their way to help us out, give directions, etc. Finally, here are some tips if you decide to stay at the Jockey Club: 1. Ask for a room with a view. One of our rooms looked out over the Bellagio fountains and the strip. The other looked out at a concrete wall. The Jockey Club is either feast or famine when it comes to views. 2. Rent a car and use the Harmon Ave. entrance to the Cosmo. You'll skip all the traffic on the strip, and get a reserved spot in the self park garage. Simply drive into the Cosmo valet area, proceeding down the ramp that says "Self Park". Then take two quick left turns and you'll be on level B2. Take four more quick left turns and you'll be down to level B3. Proceed about half way through the parking garage until you see a digital "space meter" on the ceiling showing the number of spaces left in the garage. Look to your left and you should see a set of discrete double doors and a (very!) small sign that you can't read. Park your car, and you'll notice the small sign says "Jockey Club Elevators". 3. Make use the "secret" elevators. See directions in step 2 for how to access the elevators from the parking garage. The elevators go to three other places -- the first floor of the Jockey Club with a confusing walkway to the lobby, the first floor of the Cosmopolitan Casino (remember the location of the doors so you can find your way back), and the second floor of the Jockey Club, right beside the Jockey Club Pool. The second floor stop is the best way to access your room in either tower -- just walk past the pool and to the appropriate "tower" elevator. Needless to say, these elevators make it very easy to access the amenities at the Cosmo without walking outside. 4. Book through a reseller (such as Las Vegas Tourist Bureau). You'll avoid the timeshare presentations completely -- we were never even asked -- and the agents will help you out with getting a room with a view, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jucogjct
Reviews.Content: We traded a week from another timeshare so that we could stay in Vegas during March Madness weekend without paying a fortune. Check in was easy. We asked for a view, but there were none. We had a 1 bedroom on the 7th floor. The room was very nice and clean. The bed was comfy. Huge closet...small bathroom. The kitchen was well equipped although we didn't use anything but the Coffee Maker and coffee cups. There is easy access to the Cosmopolitan Hotel and Casino. Just ask for directions. We were able to use their pool, but be prepared to arrive before 10 if you want a lounger. We did not do a timeshare presentation as we don't want another. So many people are pulled in by the "FREEBIES" . Going to a timeshare presentation is not part of my Vegas plans. Just say NO...then walk away.

Reviews.Title: “WORST Time share experience EVER!”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun444
Reviews.Content: This was the biggest scam! We were promised a stay at the Jockey Club if we sat through a 90 minute PRESSURE FREE time share presentation. We were pressured beyond belief for 2 hours and NEVER got to see any rooms... we walked out to the pool area which was surrounded by OTHER tall hotels on each side. NO views......at the end of it all when we went to claim our free stay at the jockey club and they said they would send our information to us through the mail. I got a call a week later saying that I could upgrade for 99.00 and go TWICE in two years and be reimbursed my 99.00 on my second trip. I thought WHY NOT... I love Vegas and I am SURE to go back a minimum of two times in the next two years. Well..... I tried to cancel when we decided it wouldn't be worth sitting through the same timeshare TWO MORE TIMES on both visits. Really?? They wouldn't refund our 99.00! And that is how they want people to remember them. They would rather take someones 99.00 and risk "word of mouth" reviews where they are potentially losing way more than the 99.00 they could have given back.My review has a "terrible" rating only because It didn't go any lower. They claimed to be such a GREAT timeshare and there are only "a handfull of timeshares left for their wonderful hotel" .... then why are they stooping so low for 99.00??

Reviews.Title: “Don't be a victim of the timeshare presentation!”
Reviews.Author: sdr3302
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were walking through Planet Hollywood, when we got stopped by someone who wouldn't let us walk away. I figured I'd hear their deal and then turn them down. But, every time I said "no thank you," the lady came back with a even better offer. We got promised discounted tickets to Zumanities, a buy one steak dinner get the other free, breakfast AND casino chips on $200. We were scheduled to meet for the timeshare presentation at 11:30am, and it was only supposed to last 90 minutes. We arrived at 11:30 on the dot, and sat and waited until 12:30pm for someone to take us back to the presenation room. The sales lady appeared to be very nice. Explained that she wasn't a presure salewoman and that it would be a simple "yes" or "no" at the end of the presentation. We watched the video, listened to their speech and filled out some questions regarding our vacation history and how much we usually spend. We went on a tour of the building--there was a funny burnt smell in the hallways, and no views from the rooms. The jockey club is behind other buildings and is small, so don't expect grand views. The walls were beat up, the carpet was old and their pool was the size of a bath tub. We returned to the presenation room and the saleslady went over a "cost plan" for us. Once we told her "no," she went and got "the closer" who was a large black man. He was a fast talker and straight to the point. We told him "no" and he left, only to return 10 minutes with all of our information filled out on a paper, and said "all you have to do is sign." When we told him "no" again, he asked my boyfriend "are you going to be a man...or a boy? Men buy timeshares." My jaw dropped. We again said "no" that it just wasn't in our budget. We literally told these people "no" for over an hour. Finally the saleslady directed us to get our gifts, where we again got offered a discounted rate. To make this story AWESOME, we didn't get everything we were promised either. STAY AWAY FROM THESE PEOPLE! We literally arrived at 11:30am and didn't get out until 4:00pm. What a waste of my vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price, but view leaves something to be desired...”
Reviews.Author: redwing471
Reviews.Content: The Jockey club is located right in the heart of the strip next to the Bellagio and the Cosmopolitan Casino and across from the Miracle Mile of shops and two theaters which are a part of the Planet Hollywood complex. Great location in the middle of all the top places to see on the strip. We rented a car and drove there the night we arrived. Boy what a debacle getting to the place. Great location if you know how to find the place. We drove around for 45 minutes before we were able to get into the alley way that took us to the entrance. We accidentally turned into the Bellagio parking deck the first time which is just before the correct street. Well we caught a show exiting the Bellagio and were probably in traffic for 20-25+ minutes... We did not go for any of the Timeshare sales crap. We didn't want anything to do with it, since we booked this with a vacation club we belonged to. I think this is an average place to stay at best. Great location though if you take a cab... :)

Reviews.Title: “Spacious units in top location”
Reviews.Author: tallsamoan
Reviews.Content: This is one of the "can't beat the value" moments. I booked a 1br unit through vrbo.com, privately through a time-share owner. Transaction went very smooth, Mark (the owner) was extremely helpful with do's and dont's. The Jockey club has one of the best locations on the strip, right next door to Bellagio and Cosmopolitan. The major draw is that you're on the strip in less than 2 minutes! There is no large lobby or Casino to cross, and the building itself is rather unspectacular. It faces southbound smack onto the Cosmopolitan which does not make for pleasant views, and the JC pool area is in perma-shade. We were lucky to get a partial view on the Bellagio, nothing spectacular, but at least we had occasional sunlight. The unit was clean and just renovated, inviting and spacious. For less than a hundred bucks a steal! Kitchen is fully equipped, the convenience store downstairs has everything you need for a basic, quick meal. The store is not cheap, but its pretty much the only one around so choices are limited. Door staff/ valets were very helpful and friendly, front desk ok. I guess we were lucky as no one from the time share mafia ever bothered us, although tours were on all day long. The JC had some renovations still in progress, but it was fairly quiet and did not disturb us at all. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat, again for the price it's a steal...and no resort fees btw. If you want the casino glitz or plan to spend a lot of time IN your room you may want to look for a swankier place, like MGM Signature. For a comfy, spacious place in prime location, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Bad, I mean NO View or natural light. Bad Time Share experience”
Reviews.Author: K G
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Jockey Club and opened the curtains and stared 30 feet into a concrete wall of the Cosmopolitan, this is after I was told that the room i would get would overlook the Belagio, while trying to get me to go to a time share presentation. The time share presentation started out good with a real nice guy and good salesperson. After telling him we would think about it, the price dropped $10K . We still told him we needed to think about it, so we could get out of there, when the "closer'" came in. He was a No-neck ex- Football player that couldn't sell himself out of a box without bullying his customer. The No-neck finally, after offering all kinds of incentaves ripped up the paperwork and huffed off. We then went to get our "Free'" gifts, where we went through two more, closers, trying the soft sell. The freebies were not as presented in the intitial phone call sale to get you to Vegas. The only thing I would give the Jockey Club good marks on, was the Free popcorn and the fantastic location however, i would pay more and stay somewhere else nearby the next time in Vegas. Also, absolutly NO SUN at the pool, in which looked dirty. Rating service and Value poor because of the 3 hour Time Share Experience. All else was very Average .

Reviews.Title: “Don't count on a great view..”
Reviews.Author: kellykk
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here now 3 times, twice for a presentation and the 3rd time for a week on a timeshare exchange. After 3 tries we finally got a partial few of the strip if you really turned your head to the right, you could see the Paris Balloon . The other 2 times we had a view of a wall, with loud fans attached to it. The location is great, between The Bellagio and The Cosmopolitan. We had a 2 bedroom our last stay in July of 2011. The decor is outdated, but they were in the process of changing all the furniture when we were there. There is a connection to the Cosmopolitan through the Jockey Club so that you have access to their casino. And apparently we are allowed to use there pool but that would mean walking through the casino in your pool gear.\ The pool at the Jockey Club is small and due to the shadow from the tall building next to it, pretty much is in the shade all day. There is a full kitchen in each suite and free internet which is nice if you are there for a week.\ We always rent a car when in Vegas for a week and know where to go grocery shopping, but the Jockey club does have a shuttle that goes once a week for guests to go get groceries. Check in is great. Did not get bothered for a timeshare presentation, they are at a desk across from checkin. The little minimart is handy, but would suggest going to Von's for groceries. Parking was a bit of a hassle as there was renovations going on, so we were parked in a small section of the parking lot that was also parking for The Cosmopolitan. But always found a spot. They have free movie rentals on the main floor, as well as free coffee, hot chocolate and popcorn. And sometimes pastries in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - great location - no hassle”
Reviews.Author: Blushift
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jockey Club during CES week. I was treated very politely at check-in. For my six night stay, I was not approached once about timeshare opportunities. Maybe because I was alone? I stayed in room 384. I could see the Paris hotel to the right out the window, but the vista was mostly only the Bellagio parking structure. The room was almost directly above the West entrance to Jockey Club and only 100 ft away from the bus/taxi area for Cosmopolitan. Very convenient! Didn't hear much noise, but there are lots of vehicles that travel below outside the room. This room has a small kitchen which allowed for making my own breakfasts each morning. Every utensil and appliance I could possibly need were available. The bus stop on LV Blvd allows for taking the Deuce (early) or Express down to a stop right in front of Whole Foods at Town Square for groceries. Needed to use the Mini Market next to the hotel reception a couple times, but avoided as much as possible due to cost. Some renovation evidence in the walk between the towers as the carpet was covered with plastic protection film. Was able to use the hotel computers near reception to print off my boarding pass at no charge. I would like to stay here again and try for a fountain view room, but it's not necessary since the hotel location itself is more important to me. See my photos for more details.

Reviews.Title: “only adequate - beware the time share sellers”
Reviews.Author: shadowlakemayor
Reviews.Content: The Jockey club is located right in the heart of the strip next to the Bellagio and the Cosmopolitan Casino and across from the Miracle Mile of shops and two theaters which are a part of the Planet Hollywood complex. The best way to get there is to go outside the airport and buy a round trip shuttle ticket for $12 and call them a day ahead to go back. Our exchange condo was furnished to a factory minimum with Home Depot cabinets and inexpensive furnishings. There was no dish drainer, no frying pan and no e-z chairs but my wife and I made do. The place is noisy due to thin walls and the dishwasher sounded like it was on the airstrip getting ready to take off. At check in, the clerk will hand you a ticket for a $1000 Visa giveaway that you are to give to the "concierge" across from the main desk. Do not, unless you don't value your time, fall for this as we did. The odds, first of all , are astronomical and the premise is deceiving because it is all a ruse to go to a timeshare presentation. Our 90 minute presentation lasted 3 hours and they went from $27000 down to $3999 at the end. They do give you "free" shows (Warning: Absolutely nothing is free in Vegas!) but you can get these anywhere on the strip. If you are a member of RCI, they are promoting properties that are already there so you don't need them. The employees are very cordial and wiling to help in any way. We will not go back because the city, itself, is seedy with a plethora of bottom feeders wanting to separate you from your money (you can get a free drink inside any casino so what's the point?).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, desperate need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: LesliSLC_Utah
Reviews.Content: The jockey club is a timeshare, however, rooms are available to rent on a nightly basis. I rented mine through the Las Vegas tourist bureau which offered a good rate. The location is awesome, right across the street from Planet Hollywood and Miracle Mile shops which has numerous retail shops, restaurants and several show theatres. Next door is the Bellagio which has the fountains that shoot off at various times, really neat to see. You will really not need a car if you stay here. The rooms are rather dark, dated but very clean. The small bathroom doesn't accomodate more than 1 person, however, has nice bathtowels which was a surprise. Bed was comfy. The kitchen is small. If there had been 4 people staying in the room it would have been tight. Old velvety sofa turns into a bed which i was happy I wasnt sleeping on. Rooms were rather noisy, could hear people coming & going in neighboring rooms. They have a nice little convenience store on site. Check-in and check-out was friendly and efficient. To enter the hotel you have to go down a service alley which feels a little uncomfortable. I was glad I wasn't staying out late and walking down there by myself late at night. There is a way to get to the strip through the Cosmopolitan, however, you then have to walk through a parking garage which isn't much better. I am a timeshare lover because I like having the kitchen ameneties, however, probably would look at other possibilities first. If you have a nice timeshare that you are exchanging for this property you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location right on the strip for less”
Reviews.Author: Jodky
Reviews.Content: We are an Australian family of three adults and two children who travelled to Las Vegas in November 2011 and stayed 7 nights in a two bedroom suite at The Jockey Club.....We loved it!!! you could not beat the location, right beside the Cosmopolitan (there is a lift right into the Cosmopolitan and access to the pool) opposite Planet Hollywood, beside the Bellagio. Right out the front is the bus stop. The rooms were huge and lovely. Very Clean. The sofa was a fold out bed and then two very big bedrooms with nice big comfortable beds. Fully recomend this especially for the price under $1000 for the week. We never had a problem with time share, someone started to ask and we said we were not interested so they walked away

Reviews.Title: “Beware of false promises...TS presentation nightmare”
Reviews.Author: scm1982
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were approached by a person on the Las Vegas strip offering comps for attending a time share presentation tour of the Jockey Club. Having attended other company's tours in the past, we knew what to expect and were immediately turned off towards the idea. The man stepped it up a bit and offered a bit more, again and again until we finally agreed. The perks promised to us were tickets to 2 major production shows, $400 in gambling money in the casino and a $50 VISA card that could be spent same as cash anywhere. Although the Jockey Club looked like a nice place to stay, we attended the tour and came out without buying anything. Here's where the problem is: The comps offered to us were all completely worthless with the exception of the $50 VISA card. They gave us tickets to a show that was already offered for free in a coupon book that we had picked up earlier at our hotel. The other tickets given to us were not for a major production show and actually required a purchase to get in "free". The $400 gambling money was only good at the Casino Royale and only good on their "promotional" slot machines with no possibility of winning any actual money. In other words it was like playing "Monopoly" money to win "Monopoly" money. They also gave us a 3 day/2 night stay which required another time share presentation. The only thing we walked out with that had any value was the $50 VISA card. Moral of the story: Get everything in writing and down to the finest detail before you waste 2 hours of your valuable time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and without a casino!”
Reviews.Author: Jmacewen
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Jockey Club for a week and were very fortunate to have a room on the 8th floor overlooking the fountains at the Bellagio. (We had requested it after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, but were afraid we might get one facing the wall of the Cosmopolitan.) As many other reviewers have said, it's in a perfect location. We found it very relaxing to go back to our room through a small reception area with no casino to plow our way through. It was so quiet! Our room was very tastefully renovated so the furniture, carpets, linens, kitchen set up (including dishwasher!) were all new. For the price range one wouldn't expect a walk in closet and the spaciousness and convenience of a suite. We had a one bedroom suite which would be fine for a family with two or three children using the pull out sofa and the other sofa in the living room for the children. However, it wouldn't be as good for two couples since the bathroom is in the bedroom off of the living room. We loved the space and the well equipped kitchen so that we could make breakfast and lunch to take with us. I have given it an excellent rating because it surpassed very good. However, I should mention that when we arrived the picture window and two windows attached to it were very dirty and unpleasant to look through so I went to the desk to ask to have them cleaned. They said housekeeping couldn't clean them because it was a different company that cleaned them. We were lucky to have two walking sticks with us so we attached a wet face cloth to one using plastic from a bag to hold it on and to the other we attached a dry cloth. We were able to get our arms out the windows enough to wash and dry the windows. It made a huge difference to our enjoyment of the room! Also we went to the timeshare presentation as we were told we would be given $200. to use in slots but as usual in those types of things, there was a catch. We went to the Casino Royale where we were to use the coupons and were told that we could only cash out winnings if we hit the jackpot. At one point we had $768. but couldn't cash it in because it wasn't the jackpot. So be cautious, as others have said about going to the presentation - we didn't use anything else they gave us, and we spent at least two and a half hours fending off the offers of deals. Despite the above small complaints we had a wonderful time exploring from our delightful accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure / Whisper Quiet!”
Reviews.Author: J_CVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jockey Club for a full week and were very pleasantly surprised. It has an odd entrance down a side lane from the strip, located between the Bellagio and the Cosmopolitan. Check staff were very pleasant, and the suite assigned seemed recently renovated and in very good condition. It was spacious and comfortable, and unusually QUIET for being so close to one of the busiest parts of the strip. House keeping staff was also very good. If you are looking for a decent, roomy, comfortable, clean, perfectly located place to stay, check out the Jockey Club.

Reviews.Title: “The Hidden Gem of The Strip”
Reviews.Author: FillMyPlate
Reviews.Content: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION - Snuggled UNDER/BEHIND the Cosmopolitan (they built the cosmopolitan around the Jockey Club because they couldn't get the timeshare owners to sell), right next door to the Bellagio. You might even have a view of the fountains going off every night if you get lucky. There is a pool (that's always in the shade of bigger hotels), nice lobby, dedicated parking on the 3rd level of the Cosmopolitan parking garage, valet if you want to pay. You are 100 yards from the sidewalk of the strip, with about half of that in a nice landscaped walkway, and about half along the alley/access to the hotel and back side of cosmopolitan. The units themselves have all been recently updated, nicely. Flat screen TV's in main rooms and bedrooms. Fairly comfortable beds. My 2 bedroom was very spacious, with full kitchen, six person dining table, giant U shaped couch, two full bathrooms. Bathrooms are fine. It isn't all marble, and it isn't as nice probably as the Bellagio or Cosmopolitan, of course, but it's nice enough. Across the street is a shopping mall with lots of dining options, including PF Changs. Sugar Factory is place to be seen and great for desserts (giant $10 sundaes). No one even knows the Jockey Club exists. But you are in the heart of it all. This timeshare would NOT have been built today. It would have been removed for more hotel rooms if the quirk of the timshare association laws made it impossible, basically. But that's your gain... stay here and be happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: speeeeeee
Reviews.Content: This was my 10th trip to vegas, first at a condo type place. I was really surprised and impressed. Sure the place is older but the 2 bedroom condo we had was awesome, we get to use the pool on site and the cosmo pool which is really nice. Steps from bellagio and the center of the strip and for a great price

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse suite w/ absolutely no view (Unit 1176)”
Reviews.Author: jomerb
Reviews.Content: I rented a 2 bedroom/2 bath penthouse suite at the Jockey Club 6 months in advance of our stay for New Years Eve. We were excited that we would be center strip and be able to see the New Years Eve celebrations from our suite without being on the strip. However, upon arriving at our suite (#1176), the only view was the cement wall of the buildings next to us. We couldn't event tell if the sun was out or if it was cloudy outside. Additionally, the only lamps in the suite were 4 torchiere type lamps in the entire unit, and 2 bedside student desk lamps (only one of which worked). The overhead kitchen light fixture did not work due to an electrical problem so we had no lighting in the kitchen other than the light over the stove top. It was dark enough in that unit that you could not read in the evening. The furniture was dark colored, and all of the bedding was brown/black including the sheets and towels which only added to the darkness of the unit. The mattresses were comfortable but the mattress covers must have been made out of bubble wrap from the way they sounded whenever anyone sat on or turned over in the bed. It was loud enough to wake other occupants. Although the unit is advertised as having a "full kitchen", it does not have an oven or a dishwasher. Luckily, a friend rented a unit on the 5th floor with a "full kitchen" that did have an oven and dishwasher so we could have our New Years Eve dinner in her unit. Additionally, she actually had a view of the Bellagio fountains and the Strip from her 2 bedroom/2 bath unit. I paid almost twice as much to have no view, no dishwasher, no oven, poor lighting, and a dirty kitchen/dining floor. Bare feet and white socks were filthy at the end of each day from walking on the kitchen/dining room floor. I am glad that other travellers had better experiences with their units than I did. My recommendation to other people considering the Jockey Club is to avoid unit 1176 if you want to get the view and amenities that you are paying for by renting a penthouse unit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but spotty wifi and poor guest services”
Reviews.Author: VicLS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week of Christmas 2011 and we were not informed that some units were being renovated. Nice surprise to wake up to hammers banging at 8 am. No mention of construction at Jockey Club's website nor any of the booking websites so call the property directly and ask if construction is still ongoing. When we complained at the front desk, we were told it was our responsibility to ask. There were no other rooms available to move into. This property is perfectly central on the strip adjacent to Miracle Mile Shops, Bellagio, the new City Center and shares a parking garage with Cosmopolitan Hotel. It also has the most expensive restaurants so if you're a family on a budget, plan to shop at a supermarket outside the strip after check-in. The 1 BR suite we got was a good size, had 2 TVs, large living room couch, and amply stocked kitchen. If you are expecting wifi access, don't count on it. We called their help desk # but there was no access over the weekend. We got a return call after 4 days just as we checked out. We only had wifi for one night over a 5 day stay. It is surprising that the LV businesses on the strip don't have consolidated wifi access. Every major city in this day and age should have one. Tip: If you self-park in level B3, it will be difficult to find the elevator for Jockey Club. I suggest you unload in their valet ($5/day) parking the first day and get your bearings then self-park succeeding days. You have to transfer elevators at the pool level to the Jockey Club elevator banks.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort at a great location”
Reviews.Author: AlphaRomeoTBi
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in 2BR/2BATH suite. Suite is very good, impeccably clean and very well maintained, with full kitchens, refrigerators, flat screen TVs. The building is quite historical and was a top notch hotel where many famous people owned the suites decades ago. It has very wide hallways, good gym with jacuzzi inside, heated all year round swimming pool. Shuttle to grocery stores operates few times a week. Every Thursday evening there is a movie night at the club room downstairs. On the down side: there are no washers/dryers in the rooms, only shared ones on the floors. Minor inconvenience. Resort is located right between Bellagio and Aria hotels with elevator shared with Aria giving the direct access to Aria casino. Aria parking lot is used by Jockey Club guests. Half of the rooms has great view of Bellagio/Paris casinos. And another half has a very up close wall view of the Aria hotel, not great at all. Another important note about this hotel: Few years ago hotel made a deal with the timeshare company GeoHoliday and since then they invite people to their office in Jockey Club hotel (sometimes people also invited to stay in Jockey Club for free) for timeshare presentations with aggressive and pushy sales tactics. By any means, under any circumstances don't buy membership in GeoHoliday. You will regret it dearly. Do your due diligence, their membership goes for $1 on ebay and they sell it for ~$15000+ way over market at their office. Same is true for pretty much any timeshare company.

Reviews.Title: “The location is tops and the rooms are above average ....”
Reviews.Author: topssuite
Reviews.Content: The Jockey Club has been remodeled with very nice room upgrades. If you are going for 3+ days, you will really like that the facility has a kitchen. The location can not be beat. You are right next door to the Bellagio right on the strip. Location location location ...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: WalterSobchak949
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip last minute and the Jockey Club was the only suite hotel available. A suite or two bedroom arrangement was essential as our party included two adult children. We arrived around 11:00 in the morning and our room was ready, allowing us to ditch our bags. The room was clean and although we were not staying long enough for it to matter it included a full kitchen. Despite its location the room was dead silent. The hotel is across the street from the mall attached to Planet Hollywood where there are ample affordable restaurants. Presumably those on the North side of the building can see the Bellagio fountains. The only issue was taxi and shuttle drivers couldn't quite figure out how to get there. You can also expect a timeshare sales pitch but it seems you will get that anywhere these days.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: anya348
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about staying here after reading some of the reviews but it turned out to be OK. Our 2 br suite was newly renovated, very clean. The rest of the hotel is a little on the shabbier side but looks like things are in the middle of being redone. The location was amazing though, right between the Cosmopolitan and the Bellagio. Set back from the Strip a little which helped to keep things quiet. Definitely would recommend for those looking to be close to the action for a cheaper price. Just be careful of getting sucked into the timeshare presentation at the reservations desk! We got some free tix but not worth our time.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: combiner
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 night stay in a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite here. It was very nice! We initially had a time finding our way around the place but gave the bellhop a tip and he jumped in the car with us and gave us a tour of the parking garage, nearest elevators, and quickest route to our suite. Located in a good place with all amenities within walking distance. So nice to have the kitchen, fridge, coffeemaker, walk-in closet, two bathrooms, 3 flat screens, new furniture, etc. We would definitely look at staying here again. We booked our stay through a property company on VRBO/Homeaway and got an excellent deal on the stay. We were even warned to avoid the pushy time-share salemen.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms OK”
Reviews.Author: helpuican
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a group of friends in a2 room suite. They have kept up the place with new flat screens and decent furniture. Its clean and rather large (apx 1100 I think?) It's just so weird how its jammed between Cosmo and Bellagio. Location is awesome, because if you're in Vegas to be right on the strip, its got that for sure. I would recommend staying here if you are on a budget and get a good deal. I've stayed in a lot of other hotels in Vegas which is why I say that.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: km4life
Reviews.Content: Well my husband and I went and stayed on a timeshare presentation we were referred by friends. We did have trouble finding the location at first,and we advised its behind the COSMO. So we finally find the location. Front desk help was great. We went in March for our annivesary,and the Jocky was under rennovation. So once we arrived to our room it was nice. Clean, kitchenette was nice. The only thing that lacked was the bed ,lumpy and actually felt like I was being bitten on my legs...ugh!!! Other then that, the timeshar presentation wasn't that bad,and did concider purchasing. The best part is the location on the strip across the street from Paris casino. Which is great since Jockey has no casino. And you can actually use COSMOS pool being a Jockey guest. So I would give Jockey another visit once rennovation is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Haven from the rush and bustle”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week. Initial impression on arrival was that we were going down a back alley to get to some non-descript accommodation. We arrived early and had to store our bags until 4pm and hit the street. We understood, but felt it could have been handled better. When we later saw our apartment, any concerns disappeared - we loved it, excellent layout (1 bedroom, lounge, kitchen, full bathroom) and top quality (recently renovated). The Jockey Club turned out to be a haven from the madness that is Vegas! Yes it has now been built out and overshadowed by the Cosmopolitan but don't let that worry you. We had a very enjoyable stay there in the back building of the two, on the 10th floor with a wonderful view over the Bellagio Fountain and the Strip. A very brief walk and you are right on the Strip, in the middle of all the action. The pool was a disappointment with no sun, but it was restful - we used it for a swim, read and rest after serious action on the Strip and before heading out again. Much preferred the small personal Jockey Club over the huge anonymous big name hotels. We would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, rooms are great.”
Reviews.Author: Ben0844
Reviews.Content: It was our 5th time in Vegas (stayed before at Hilton, Hooters, NYNY, Harrah's). It was the first time we rented with a kitchen because we planned to be out of the city during the day so the Buffet Deal was not useful to us on this trip. Wow! We simply loved staying at the Jockey Club Resort. The young lady at the desk was very nice and helpful. The place look good and clean (I was expecting an older and more basic look). The room was big (separate bedroom from living room) and nicely decorated. We had a very quiet stay (3 nights). The location for the price can't be beat. Rooms have full kitchen and It can be great to be able to cook your own meals depending on what you plan to do in or around Vegas. The pool is heated and it's a good thing because do not expect to take a sun bath there, you are surrounded by the Cosmo. You have access to gas BBQ on the pool deck and can even eat there if you wish. On the last day, because our flight was at 11h30PM, we ask if, after checking out, we could leave the car in the garage to keep enjoying Vegas and even use the pool, and they told us it was fine. Great place, great service service, great price !

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: g230
Reviews.Content: Had a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom apartment all windows faced the Bellagio fountains which was fantastic. One bedroom had 2 queen beds the other had king bed . There was a sofa bed in lounge but we did not need to use it . Kitchen has full size American fridge and cooker. Also had micro wave kettle coffee maker and toaster. You could not ask for more in Las Vegas – so much space The beds and towels were spotless. The property is being re modelled and on the forth floor we were the only room in use as all others had been stripped for new carpets and furnishings . While ours was a little dated and worn it was still fantastic. Brilliant position between Bellagio and Cosmopolitan and across road from Planet Hollywood Tip - if you need a taxi walk up the path towards the back of the hotel and it opens up into the Cosmopolitan transportation centre where there is a taxi line.

Reviews.Title: “this place is great”
Reviews.Author: transform29
Reviews.Content: really researched the 3 stars, this place was amazing, it's a secret 5 star inside the room, and you walk out and you're in the centre of everything, we had the best time, we would walk across the street to a great mile long mall, right in the entrace is Earl of Sandwich, great meals when you want something quick

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Barrym68
Reviews.Content: The Jockey Club in Las Vegas is very central on the strip between Bellagio and Cosmopolitain. We stayed in a 1 bedroom condo in April 2011 for 2 weeks. It was well equipped with a large kitchen, living room , full bath , walk in closet and king bed in a bedroom with views of the Bellagio fountain. The hotel provides a shuttle to the grocery store several times a week which can save you a lot of money instead of eating out every day. The Miricle Mile shops are just across the road, take a shortcut into the Cosmopolitan up the escalator to the walkway across to Crystal out the other side and across another walkway and you are near New York/New York saves walking through the crowds and some stairs and if it's windy it saves you getting blown around.

Reviews.Title: “Little hotel surrounded by giants”
Reviews.Author: lin925
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Jockey Club in Las Vegas from September 17th thru September 23rd. We obtained the reservations from our travel club Global Discovery Vacations. When we arrived, I was clearly distressed at the site of the place. It is a little hotel surrounded by the Belagio and Cosmopolitan. The first floor lobby and "concierge" service had a terrible smell that caused you to gag. We had explained that we had stayed at a hotel on Fremont Street the previous night and needed to check in as soon as possible. They didn't have our rooms ready, so they stored our luggage and told us we could check in at the normal time of 4:00pm. We called several times between 4:00pm and 5:30pm when both of our rooms were finally ready and they kept telling us only one room was ready. The rooms were okay. They seemed clean enough and the housekeeping staff was very friendly. The ceilings in the entire place are very low, maybe 7 or 8 feet max and it made it seem cramped and congestive. The elevator from the lobby had a cheap dirty curtain around the interior with a gaping hole in the corner. We had to take that to the second floor and walk down a long hallway, down stairs and take another elevator to our room on the 9th floor. On the first night, our room key wouldn't work when we went back to our room. We called the front desk from our daughter and son-in-law's room and were told we had to speak to security. They refused to let us back into our room without our seeing our ID. I explained that our ID's were in the room and I would be happy to show them if they could let me in. After arguing with them for better than 20 minutes and going down to the office, we were finally let in an issued a key that worked. The guy working the "concierge" desk was dirty, smelled and was pretty rude. He was offering free tickets to nothing of any value. The pool doesn't get any sun and is covered with some kind of net with a bunch of light bulbs attached to it. It was fine at night, but if you're looking to get a tan go somewhere else. We were told we could use the pool on the 14th floor of the Cosmopolitan, but when we went up there, it was closed for the season and the security guard made us leave. The day we left we went to the front desk and asked if they could call us a cab. We were told we had to ask the valet. He said it would be a long wait if he called and told us we could get a cab faster if we went to the Cosmopolitan. I told him I wasn't dragging five pieces of luggage over there. My husband ended up running up there and came back with a cab in less than 5 minutes. If you don't mind staying in a sub standard hotel, the rooms aren't bad. However, when people asked us where we were staying, it was embarrassing to tell them. We would never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Great Rates”
Reviews.Author: Chal112
Reviews.Content: The days of cheap places in Vegas are over, but the non-gaming Jockey Club is a great value. We stayed in a renovated suite with a separate bedroom, kitchen and living room. The kitchen was fully furnished so we could eat in and save some money. The hotel provides a shuttle to the grocery store several times a week and also to the outlet malls. It's right on the Strip, next door to the Cosmopolitan and Bellagio. The Cosmo is brand new and if you want some gambling, it's right there. It's also across the street from the Million Mile Mall for fantastic shopping, and also Planet Hollywood. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. I called for extra towels, and they were delivered within 10 minutes. I will warn you that some of the rooms face a blank wall of the hotel next door. Because the Cosmo casts a shadow on the Jockey Club's pool, JC guests are allow to use the pool and spa at the Cosmo for free. Our room did face the wall, but we didn't care since we out seeing the sights most of the time. Nice place, I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “if u don't mind wearing slippers throughout your stay...”
Reviews.Author: vlkt
Reviews.Content: location was great (between cosmopolitan and bellagio), but it is in desperate need of renovations. the hotel room's carpet is very old and absolutely filthy. our feet were dirt black after walking around barefoot. everything just felt dirty. even with it's cheap rates, we won't be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: lucky8lady
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Jockey Club In August 2011. It is located on the strip, a quiet oasis amongst the hustle and bustle of the larger hotels with their loud, ringing casinos. The Jockey Club is next to the Bellagio and Cosmopolitan and right across the street from the Mile shopping center and right next to the City Center. When you walk into the Jockey Club off the noisey strip, its atmosphere is serene and comfortable. We had a two bedroom unit that was fresh, clean and nicely furnished. The kitchenette had everything we needed to cook and eat in our room if we chose. There was a nice dining table. The bathrooms were clean, modern and had basket goodies for the bath and shower. We had three flat screen tvs. One in each bedroom and one in the living room. Our bedrooms were quiet and the beds were very comfortable. There was a small grocery type store off the lobby that had a nice variety of foods, drinks and neccesities. We ordered tickets to a show on their computers, although they do have a concierge that can assist. The front desk personel were courteous and friendly. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Jockey Club and would not hesitate to book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Bachelor Party Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bgib21
Reviews.Content: We had about 8 guys on this Bachelor Party weekend, and the Jockey Club was perfect. We got two rooms, that had 6 total beds, and a kitchen in each for cheep. It's not the nicest, but it worked great for our crew. It is in the heart of Vegas, so you are close to everything. Also, the shop by the check in desk has very good prices on food an drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Be the smartest traveler on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: lawgirlvt
Reviews.Content: Thanks in large part to the reviews we'd read on Trip Advisor, we recently stayed at the Jockey Club on a trip with friends to Las Vegas. We wanted to stay on the Strip but didn't want to pay the exorbitant prices at the really posh places. We also had three adults and two small children and wanted to get a room that could accommodate everyone. Enter the Jockey Club. We got a two bedroom, two bath suite with kitchen (including a dishwasher, microwave, and stove), dining area, and living room, for less than half the cost of a room at most of the other places. The Jockey Club doesn't have a casino - I think it's a bunch of timeshares - but it feels just like a hotel, complete with (very friendly) housekeepers who come every day (if you want them to; otherwise just put out the "do not disturb" sign) and valet parking (if you want it). Our suite was very nicely decorated and quite comfortable. There were a couple of pamphlets in the room on timeshares, but other than that there was nothing in the way of a sales pitch whatsoever. I had read some reviews of how confusing the layout is, and while I would agree that's fairly true when you first get there, after you ask for directions once it's pretty easy to get to the same places again, be it the parking garage or the Cosmopolitan. I had also read some reviews of how terrible the views can be, and maybe it's because I was forewarned, but it didn't bother me. All of our windows had a view of the side of the Cosmo, which actually made it very private! (that part of the Cosmo doesn't have windows) Our friends who had a lovely room at the Bellagio had a view of the parking lot there, so sometimes you just don't get a good view. That certainly wasn't our main reason for coming to Vegas, and didn't bother me in the least. Speaking of the Cosmo, we got full use of their Bamboo Pool. I don't know if we could have used the others, but we had a small child with us and they said that was their most family-friendly. The pool was amazing - a great place for lounging for hours and with a bar on two ends. It was also very convenient to go to the Cosmo for dinner - we did that twice - and the casino, and the Jockey Club is also next door to the Bellagio and across the street from Planet Hollywood and its Miracle Mile of shopping. I felt like we were the smartest travelers on the Strip because we got a great room for a really great price (my friend who booked it found that the price available directly through the Jockey Club's website was about half of that on the so-called discount sites, so be sure to check the official website), while still getting to use the amenities of the surrounding high-end resorts. Great buy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: LYNNIE72
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple nights and enjoyed the stay. The property is in a good location along the strip, although rather set back from the strip and is hard to spot sitting amongst the over towering Cosmopolitan casino and hotel directly next door (literally next door...only a few feet separate the 2 properties). The room I stayed in was a one bedroom suite and included a full size refrigerator, kitchen with stove, sink, dishwasher, oven, microwave, and a full set of utensils for cooking and eating. The bedroom and bathroom in this suite unit were sectioned off from the rest of the room, so not a standard hotel room by any means. There was a tv in the living room (another in the bedroom) along with a boom box for the music lovers. Outside of the decor of the room (horse motifs and the dark colors and patterns on the living room furniture....just not my personal style) I was satisfied with the overall quality of the room. The bed was a lot less firm than what I am used to, but it served its purpose and above all else, it was clean. This location is a time share property and although for my stay I was not required to do a tour or sit through a presentation, you may see others getting the sales pitch depending on where your room is located. My room just happened to be on the second floor and right down the hall from where the presentations and tours take place. Having access to The Cosmopolitan right next door is a big plus. The only real negative comment I have relates to the walkway pedestrians have to use to enter and exit the Jockey Club. It is better than no walkway at all, but it would be nice if somehow there could be a walkway built to connect the Jockey Club with the Cosmopolitan for easier access to both the strip and taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Glad We Went Back a Second Time”
Reviews.Author: Retiredbarnqueen_10
Reviews.Content: We are the type of couple who like to vacation and spend time at a resort. We like to relax and lounge around the pool etc, So, the first time we went to the Jockey Club in Vegas was about 5 years ago. We got a pretty nice room-fully equipped kitchen, dining room, living room, bedroom and bath. But we weren't totally impressed with the pool etc. We were hoping for a resort stay. This really isn't the place for that. That said, LOCATION is the biggest asset to the Jockey Club: located on Las Vegas Blvd between the Bellagio and the (new) Cosmopolitan, and across the street from Planet Hollywood and Paris--the Jockey Club is PERFECT for those who want to explore Vegas. Aside from getting from the airport (a shuttle gets your a roundtrip for under $20 per person) you can walk, take the bus, or ride the monorail almost anyplace you want to go for very little money. The Jockey Club is 11 stories high, and until they built the Cosmopolitan, your room had a pretty nice view of the strip. The Cosmpolitan is 57 stories high, and the Bellagio isn't much less than that too. You will have NO VIEW whatsoever, if that is important to you. The units are being redecorated, and ours was one of the newly done ones--and I really liked it. We were comfortable there. It had everything you needed, including 2 flat screen tv's--one in the living room and the other in the bedroom. I am pretty sure all the units are the same--2 queen beds in the big bedroom and a bathroom off the bedroom. I don't think the couch makes out into a bed, but you could ask. The maids come for a daily pick up of your towels, dispose of your trash, and will make your bed. They do a mid-week cleaning, which you can schedule. They freshen up the room and put new linens on the bed.We appreciated that a lot. Bed is comfortable, maid service good, all requests we had were taken care of quickly, and all communications we had with the desk etc. were courteous and fast. BIGGEST DOWNSIDE: before the Cosmopolitan was built, you could see the Jockey Club from the street--you parked in the parking lot and walked in. Now there's really no outside entrance. It's basically engulfed by the Cosmpolitan and unless you know it's there, you won't see it. They've made access to the place and parking very hard until you've done it a couple of times. They have given the B3 level for Jockey Club members. You have to figure our which elevators go to the Jockey Club. If not, you wander around the Cosmopolitan with your suitcases until someone takes pity on you and steers you to the correct elevators . For those who are driving, you can only turn in to the Jockey Club going southbound on Las Vegas Blvd (next right after the Bellagio parking entrance). It looks like an alley, Go about 200 feet and turn left into the parking structure and go to B3. The reason I mention this is that Las Vegas Blvd, is insane, especially at night. You will have to go past the Jockey Club, turn left onto Flamingo and do an illegal u-turn (people do it) to get back onto Las Vegas Blvd. in order to turn into the Jockey Club. Make sure you are not in the right-most lane, as that's a Bellagio-turn only lane. So, if you want to "do Vegas" and want location---Jockey Club is great. The unit itself is great. Staff is great. Pool is ok., No restaurant, but there is a mini-market onsite. They do have shuttles to take you to the store etc . Initially finding it and then figuring out parking and getting to the correct elevator for the first couple of times is the worst. If you do exchange, they always seem to have weeks available. No problems with getting the time you need.. We had a car and spent most of our time outside of the strip area and we enjoyed our trip to Vegas. Maybe we'll go again in five years!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: OldWandererAz
Reviews.Content: The Jockey club is located between the Belagio and The Cosmopolitan. This is a great location for exploring the strip. The One bedroom condo that we had faced the fountains at the Belagio, giving us a great view of the strip. The rooms were very nice with a full kitchen. The pool at the Jockey Club has been sun blocked by the new Cosmopolitan tower next door, so the visitors to the Jockey Club were allowed to use the facilities at the Cosmopolitan. This agreement between the properties gave us a great pool and lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of your expectations”
Reviews.Author: viajer0mx
Reviews.Content: Service was okay, I didn’t have any problems with my reservation. I arrived at 2 pm and my room wasn’t ready, I just had to come back at 4 pm which is the offical check in time. The location is perfect, between the Bellagio and the Cosmopolitan and the strip bus stop is right there. The Jockey Club doesn’t have a casino, but there’s an elevator by the pool that takes you to the Cosmopolitan casino. It’s like a secret passage that takes you to a whole different world. I have read mixed reviews for this hotel and wasn’t sure what to expect. It was a long walk from the front desk to my room. I had to go up to the second floor, walk through a large corridor and get on a different set of elevators. There’s and old vibe through the corridor because of the old carpet and the facilities in general. So I get to my room. The good side is that it was spacious, it had an equiped kitchen and, fortunately, the room was clean. The downside, the furniture in the living room was really old. The armchair had a filthy look, I think it would be better if they just took it out from there. I’ve read about rooms facing the concrete wall. When I read those reviews I thought, how bad could it really be? Well, it is bad. The concrete wall means no daylight. Entering the bedroom was just depressing. The concrete wall, the old carpet, the old TV, the bad lighting. It’s really not the feeling you want on a holiday. I don’t recommend this hotel, there are plenty of choices in Vegas, but if you are still considering staying here I would highly recommend to secure a renovated room with view to the Bellagio. I don’t know if that’s possible, but it’s the only way I think staying here would be worthed.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Strip location and kitchen, too!”
Reviews.Author: Gregman1
Reviews.Content: The Jockey Club time share was built in the 70s, before the Bellagio, the City Center, New York New York and a lot more. The layout reflects this, but many recent renovations and services more than make up for it. First, the rooms have full kitchens so you can plan accordingly and save lots of cash by eating meals at "home". Its nice to come back to your room and have access to a full size fridge for your drinks, snacks and even leftovers from your restaurants. There is a dishwasher, utensils, oven and pots and pans and dishes. Each floor has a coin operated clothes washer and dryer, too. There's even a small grocery store on site (hit the local Wal Mart or Albertson's for lower prices before you arrive) If your room is on the north side, you may have a great view of the Bellagio fountains (next door). The Paris Eiffel Tower is right there, too. If you are on the south side it is a different matter. The gargantuan Cosmopolitan tower dwarfs the JC and your view is a wall of windows. This effects the JC pool, too. No sun there! But the Jockey Club made great deals with the City Center. First, free parking is a short, indoor walk. Second, FREE access to two of the Cosmo's pools - the Bamboo and Boulevard. A short walk behind the JC, through an elevator door and, BAM, you are in the Cosmopolitan. One more elevator and you are in a gorgeous pool. Third, most of the renovations are being paid for by the City Center and the JC is getting a great spruce up. It is mainly a time share that rents rooms. The staff is very helpful and, yes, you may be asked to enjoy a time share presentation, but a "no thanks" will be gladly accepted. The location of the Jockey is the best thing. In less than a five minute walk are the Bellagio, Planet Hollywood, Paris, Cosmopolitan, City Center Mall, Aira, the tram to the Monte Carlo. A short walk gets you to Ceasars, NY NY, MGM, ...Its in the middle of everything! I can't recommend the Jockey Club enough.

Reviews.Title: “Not the usual excellent but other aspects make it great!”
Reviews.Author: crisndeefromde
Reviews.Content: We visit here often and own several weeks here at the Jockey. Our last visit was the first week of April. Renovations are still going on but should be finished by the end of November according to our resort manager. Housekeeping was lacking this trip for our unit and we were not remodeled yet so much wear in our unit. We love the location. The units are spacious and we love having the kitchen to fix anything. The staff has anything you could need to fix dinner so just ask! Everyone is smiling and so so warm and personable. Parking is good in the cosmo as there is a reserved section in B3 just for us. Slept great as usual and never heard noise even with a big birthday party across the hall. Can't wait to come back. We had a great time except for our lack of communication with housekeeping,

Reviews.Title: “Hidden on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: PhxSol
Reviews.Content: My folks own a time share and were able to exchange for time at this hotel. Initially the layout seems a little awkward and unorganized but in the end, once I figured out all the little intricacies of the location, the hotel was actually a decent place. The parking for Jockey Club members is underneath the Cosmopolitan Casino which is the first of many things the Jockey Club and the Cosmo share. The entrance to the parking garage is right off the strip. If you're going North on the Strip you have to make a U-Turn right before Bellagio which can be a little tricky if you're not used to big city driving because immediately after the U-turn, get all the way over to pull into the driveway. The elevator in the garage from level B3 is not labeled well at all. That particular elevator is the key though because it is the link between the Jockey Club and the Cosmo. The Jockey Club has two towers where you can stay. We stayed in the "second" or "rear" tower which was farthest away from the strip. It took some meandering to get to the room which was on the 11 floor "penthouse". There were a few places where there were stairs you'd have to lift your luggage instead of rolling it along. But our penthouse room faced North and had floor to ceiling windows with a gorgeous view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains. The room is spacious with a sectional couch, two flat screens, a walk in closet and a full kitchen. Maid service is offered daily. The time share is a little older so it only had two elevators which got very busy on the weekend meaning long waits. So busy in fact that they both broke requiring us to use the service elevator. They were repaired within the day. The pool is very small but is open 24 hours. It was more like a pool you would see at a Best Western Hotel. But if you can navigate the twists and turns to the neighboring Cosmopolitan Casino through the elevator you can access the Cosmo pool which is decadent and luxurious. The Cosmo pool is the epitome of a vegas pool experience. It's above the Strip with amazing views and plenty of "scenery". They did ask for a hotel key card one time and I showed my Jockey Club hotel card and was let right in. The time share does not have the restaurants, or gambling. It's simply a place to stay. You'll have to rely on the Cosmo for everything casino. But they're very new so right about now the Cosmo is the place to be. The Jockey Club is in a great location on the strip with decent walking proximity to MGM and the Mirage. And if you're looking for breakfast, or even late night post bar food, I highly recommend Planet Dailies at Planet Hollywood across the street. Their food was fantastic and the serve breakfast 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. The Jockey Club is far from perfect but the pros far out weight the cons so I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: traveler1178
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 of the 2 bedroom condo for a large family gathering. We did not know what to expect but was very happy with our choice. The condo is spacious and clean and the staff are very friendly. The Master Bedroom and Closet is huge and having a kitchen is very nice. We used the grocery delivery service online which was very convenient. The price and location is great. You are walking distance to everything here. We had a great time and will be back. The Cons.. they are still remodeling so some of the floors are old, the pool is small and not much sunlight due to Cosmo building around it. One of the room had partial view of the Bellagio fountain the other room had view of concrete wall even though we requested far in advance for a room with a room and were one of the first to check in.
