One of our room was not ready for check-in till pass 6pm. The mini market there is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: cvictoriac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my 2 kids and my mom. Had a wonderful room. Location was superb! Awesome connection to the Costomopolitan --- and use of their very cool 4th floor pool (14th for adults only as well). Easy acess to their casion via the JC elevators (I even came out $60 ahead!!) The condo was nice and well appointed. Table was set when we got there that was a nice touch. Even the sofa bed was comfortable. Maid service very helpful. Great staff. Security was awesome. My 11 year daughter left the pool area to go to our room. She went to the wrong floor and got lost. They found her quickly and brought her to me. A little hard to find but here is a trick. Pull into Bellagio and then leave towards Las Veags Blvd. Turn right on Las Vegas Blvd. and the driveway is right there. WATCH CLOSE for the next driveway and a teeney tiny sign just before Cosmopolitan. Its like 2 feet by 1 feet black and white. Hard to see but this should help. Had to do a timeshare presentation to validate my stay and very low pressure.

Reviews.Title: “will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: travel_nuta
Reviews.Content: booked two premium rooms, based on the photo 's & reviews. When checking in, the staff was not very helpful. Had to navigate our way through multiple passages & elevactors. The place was under renovaion, but after the stripped the blue covers from the elevator walls, nothing looked new or cleaned! Our room faced the back wall / Cosomopolitan side, & got NO daylight! The bathroom mirror looked like someone had a chocolate syrup fight in there, & the kitchen floor had a sticky mess. The bed looked like someone had taken a quick nap on it. I changed rooms, was down graded to a smaller room with no refund! The concierge with regards to shows, purchasing tickets etc, was no help whatso ever!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, for the most part”
Reviews.Author: tjhfr
Reviews.Content: We just got back yesterday from a week long stay at the Jockey Club. While it was pretty good for the most part I did have a few complaints...1. Valet parking cost $5.00 a day because they sub out to a different company, and it only added up to $35.00 for the week it was kind of a pain when you expect free valet because everywhere else on the strip does it for free, and you would think that since you are paying for it you would get your car faster, but you would be wrong. Durring the week they only have one person working (one time it took over half an hour to get our car.). You may say well then why not self park? The answer to that is, Self parking is about half a block away and when it is 114 out and you have a 4 year old that can be a bit much. About half way through the week my mom and stepdad joined us and being the he is handicapped we figured they would have a better parking situation for him (he has disabled plates)....nope same 5 bucks for valet or self parking in the Cosmo's underground lot, so they parked in the lot and my husband drover to get them and bring them back. As for the new remodel they are doing, if I was in charge the contractor would have been fired...the bathroom counters hung halfway over the toilets in both bathrooms, and most of the doors did not fit right in the jams making them hard to open and close as well as loud (don't open these doors when others are trying to sleep) in our "room" (we had the 2 bedrooom) we had the master closet and master bathroom doors as well as the second bedroom door and the second or guest bathroom door...makes it hard to do anything quietly while others are sleeping. On the good side they did have free crafs for the kids from 1:30 to 5:30 and they have games and movies you can check out for free as well as free popcorn and coffee. The maid came in everyday and made the beds and changed the towels and added new shampoos and soaps as needed which you don't get in most time shares.

Reviews.Title: “Go here if looking for old and dingy!”
Reviews.Author: WATHI
Reviews.Content: The room was nothing like the pics... when we got into the taxi from the Airport, the guy actually laughed at us for staying there! there is no cab outside the hotel so you have to walk about 10 minutes to get one.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to believe: center of the strip for $80/night”
Reviews.Author: annieontheroad
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Jockey Club last minute, primarily because of the low rate (stayed 08-May to 14-May-2011). I was attending a trade show at the Convention center, but all the hotels closer to the convention center were either already booked or way beyond my budget. I figured that since I'd have a car and would be driving, commuting to/from the Jockey Club and LVCC wouldn't be that bad. Besides, the central strip location would come in handy after work. The Jockey Club is nestled between two major hotels. With a flood of pedestrians right after the fountain show at Bellagio, I nearly missed the turn in to the hotel premises. There was some construction going on, but nothing that impacted my being able to park while I checked in. Everything went smoothly at the check-in. I got a room upgrade for a colleague (to a view of the Bellagio fountains), the room keys, a plethora of literature about the property (it's part of a timeshare) and then the parking directions. The parking. The Jockey Club shares a garage with The Cosmopolitan and so there's a limited amount of parking spaces reserved for Jockey Club guests. The parking itself wasn't an issue--it was getting back into the Jockey Club through the proper elevators. The signage was dismal compared to the signs directing you to the Cosmo elevators. And when you finally get through the doors of the elevator to the Jockey Club, you're greeted with additional signs and barricades that kinda funnel you back to the front entry. To be fair: the walkways were always clean and I felt safe enough to walk back to the car at multiple points during the night/early morning. The room was all very standard, except for the Oreck vacuum in the walk-in closet--not sure if that was left by housekeeping. The full kitchen was a treat and it was nice to sit down to eat with actual utensils instead of plastic (cause food in Vegas can cost an arm & a leg!). And the central location Mid-Strip was fantastic for sightseeing! And while I had a car at my disposal, if you don't the Jockey Club offers a shuttle service to nearby convenience stores if you need to pick up groceries and the like. One comment: because I was in Vegas for business, I found it rather inconvenient that my wifi access was minimal (no wireless internet access) in the room. But the wifi improved when in common areas (lobby, entry) and there was also 2 computers available for use, not to mention the Timeshare Member's Area. I had a multipage document that I needed to print (12pgs) and when I mentioned this to the front desk, they said that it was okay. Not exactly the same 'business center' service that you'd get from other places, but still acceptable (and I procrastinated in the first place anyway). So all in all, the Jockey Club is a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “The little timeshare that could and did.”
Reviews.Author: form2
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed with my parents here over the Christmas holiday. I've stayed at the Jockey Club several times about a decade ago with college friends when there was nothing around the timeshare. I always wondered what would happen to the Jockey Club once the big players started sprouting up around it. This past Christmas, the new Cosmopolitan opened right next door, upping Jockey Club's location value. Of course, JC has had to undergo some renovations since the early 2000s due to the space the bigger hotels took up (or bought up) but the rooms have remained the same. JC has simple and dated rooms with box tvs and even a little stereo system. But the space is clean and has everything you need and expect from a timeshare. We stayed in a two bedroom unit, which I have stayed in before, that hadn't changed one bit with the exception of having a great view of the Bellagio water show. Since the kiddos were in tow, we borrowed a couple movies and games from the activity center and I was pleased with their updated titles. Maybe they have to make up for the dated rooms. The kiddos were also excited to get popcorn (and us a cup of coffee) whenever we came back from sight seeing. The service at the activity center was always friendly. The best thing (and why I gave it the extra star) about staying at the JC is certainly the location as in Bellagio and now Cosmopolitan are right outside your door. This was perfect for my husband and I since we were able to leave the kiddos with the grandparents for a bit to do some gambling without having the noise of a casino hotel. Still wondering what will happen to the JC in the next couple years but certainly impressed with its staying power.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Sycamoreasko
Reviews.Content: Have been to Vegas before, but health reasons now mean I have to prepare my own food and that limits places to stay on the Strip where all the action is. Husband and I decided to try the Jockey Club as the suites have cooking facilities. Our suite was completely redone and everything was spotless. There is a lounge, fully equiped kitchen, bedroom & king sized bed, bathroom and walk in closet with safe, lots of clothes hangers (don`t always get these at other hotels) and room for suitcase on a case table so basically plenty of room. There are 2 flat screen TVs and DVD / Cd players. We didn`t have much of a view, but since it was our 3rd time there we didn`t care and not every room at any of the big hotels has a view either. There is a free shuttle to the supermarket twice weekly, a gym and pool. Others have commented that the pool doesn`t get any sun, but that is not true. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The strip and bus stop are very close and actually closer than if you stayed in most of the big hotels. The Jockey club is very centrally located between the Bellagio and Cosmopolitan and across from Planet Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: djk6162
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Vegas and wanted to commend the Jockey Club for a great stay. We had a 2 BR 2 BA on the 10th floor with a view of the Bellagio, Paris and Flamingo. This place was amazing....very quiet at night but sooooo easy to get to the strip...and right in the middle of all the action. We did not use the pool, but we were able to use the Cosmopolitan's pool as guests of the JC and that was a huge added bonus. I also got a great rate on HomeAway.com. I would highly recommend staying here especially if you have a larger group and want to save money on meals, coffee, etc. Vegas is not cheap!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel right on the strip”
Reviews.Author: CavMcDs
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and I was travelling with my 3 children - all under 11. This hotel was fantastic. It was more like an apartment really than a hotel. We had 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a lounge, kitchen and dining room. From our windows we could see the fake Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio fountains. It's great value for what you get. The kids loved the pool. The only down side was trying to find it in the first place. We'd read reviews saying it was hard to find and it's true. First time round it is a little tricky. There's a small road/alleway leading off the strip next door to the Bellagio. May be best to get them to email you an accurate map before heading out, because when you've been on the plane for 11 hours you don't really want to be circling the streets of Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: Sue80NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Jockey Club as an RCI timeshare exchange during Easter break this April. Although we weren't given the room with a view that we requested, overall we're satisfied with our stay in Jockey Club. The location is perfect! Right on the strip where the action is. It's set back a little bit from the strip so you don't really hear any noise. Very quiet hotel. You could easily miss the entrance if you're not familiar with the area. The parking is a little tricky too. The best thing is, as you come out of the hotel , you're next to Bellagio, across the street is Paris and Planet Hollywood. To your right is going to New York, New york and to the left is Venetian. We could not ask for a better location. Just keep in mind that a lot of walking is needed in Vegas so wear comfortable shoes. We booked a 1 BR apartment and everything we needed was there. The kitchen helped a lot for most of our meals. Saved a lot of money eating out. We were assigned on the 1st tower which looked like an older building. Our room on the Penthouse floor unfortunately faces a wall. The room was big for the 2 of us. The furniture, TV's and decorations needs to be updated however. I'm not sure if the 2nd Tower is new. Haven't seen any of the rooms there. The big plus for us is their King size bed and pillows that are so soft and just heavenly comfortable. We slept soundly every night which was very refreshing. They have daily towel exchanges and housekeeping which was excellent. The room provided us with what we needed but it's far from luxury though. There's 2 computer in the lobby for use and we printed our boarding pass with no problem. This is a timeshare property but never bothered us for a sales pitch which we appreciated. The weather was perfect for April. Cool in the morning and rises up to 80's around noon time. There's a lot of people walking around and you tend to absorb the energy of the place. Las Vegas with it's neon lights at night is electric. Feels like Time Square in New York City. Vegas is fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: uniquenicole
Reviews.Content: I was suspicious of this locatin at first but had got the idea to rent a timeshare from a cowarker. She had gave me her timeshare book and I called almost all of the one with the location I liked. They were either booked or too high. After talking to someone at the Jockey Club and getting the great pricing a figured it should be ok. However, weeks before the trip i begin to do searches on google and saw a vast amount of reviews from terrible to excellent. It was to late to change so I was hoping for the best. When the taxi dropped me off I was really shocked about with how nice the entrance looked and was even more impressed with the room. Even though it was outdated it was very clean and in good condition. The bed was comfortable and we were able to see the Bellagio fountain. They also had a full kitchen with all kitchen items included. I am very picky were I stay during vacation and I must say I loved the Jockey club. The only bad thing was construction but you were forewarned...and all in all they did a good job controlling the noise, dust, and walkways. This is definitely a gem and I am booking my reservations there now for my next trip this June.

Reviews.Title: “UNIT 926 - April Review”
Reviews.Author: Coreen
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was a little worried after reading the previous review on this Unit and having never stayed at the Jockey Club did not know what to expect. Perfect location - next to the new city center and Cosmopolitan - across from PH, Paris and the Miracle Mile Mall - next to the beautiful Bellagio Fountains, with a bus stop right in front. The best part was leaving the craziness of the strip and walking in to a quiet lobby with no sounds of slot machines etc - it was a really nice retreat. The suite was very comfortable and most of all - it was clean. I am not sure exactly what the situation was for the last reviewer, but we were pleased with everything. There is a flat screen TV in the living room, and a TV in the master bedroom - however we were not there to watch TV. We are 3 ladies in our 40's and other then turning the living room TV on for some background noise once in a while and to check the weather - they mostly stayed off. We found the beds to be very comfortable and the suite very quiet - we slept well. We felt the kitchen was well stocked and we had everything we needed. We did have a problem with the room cards but that was quickly rectified. While walking through the hotel - we did see other suites from the hallway and they all looked pretty nice. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it. The owner was very easy to deal with, very helpful, and was very prompt on replying to any emails etc.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE, LOVE, LOVE the Jockey Club!”
Reviews.Author: BroncoJoe
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Jockey Club many times and I love coming back here. Even better, the experience keeps improving with every visit! The addition of the Cosmopolitan immediately attached to the Jockey Club is terrific. Granted, having a parking lot there was a nice feature, too, but that was a long time ago. We suffered through the construction but the construction is completed now. The underground parking is fantastic, with extremely easy access off of Harmon Avenue directly between the Cosmopolitan and City Center. The parking underground is on B3 and the Jockey Club elevator can be hard to find at first. Once you know where it is the parking is tremendous with easy access to the Jockey Club and to the Cosmopolitan. Literally, there is a private elevator entrance to the casino. One thing I have always enjoyed is the tremendous amount of space in the Jockey Club suites. It is liek having an apartment on the Strip! It is terrific to be able to bring leftovers home from restaurants and put them in the refrigerator, as well as being able to stop at the local grocery store and grab a case of water and some snacks. I have never really cooked a big meal in Vegas, but you could with the kitchen. There are grills available on the pool deck, too, if you want to barbeque. The suites are being renovated now and the newly renovated rooms include flat screen TVs and new room decor and lighting. There is brand new furniture and all the updates are terrific. I have been in some of the hotel rooms at some of the nicer hotels and cannot believe people pay more than I do for a room a quarter of the size with none of the amenities. The location simply cannot be beat. As I mentioned, there is a direct connection to the Cosmopolitan. The Bellagio is next door, Planet Hollywood and Paris are across the street, and all 3 are within a 5 minute walk. City Center and Mote Carlo are to the south of the Cosmo and Caesars, Bally's, and Flamingo are to the north, all about a 10 minute walk. MGM, Excalibur, New York New York, Mirage, and a number of other casinos are also within walking distance. There is the possibility of having a wall view when staying at the Jockey Club due to the Cosmopolitan being directly next door. I believe these are the last suites they staff fills. I had a wall view just last week when I was there. It can be an issue with some people, but you also have to remember the value that goes along with the price and features offered. If it is a huge concern, ask yourself how important the view really is for you and how much time you will spend in the room looking out the window. If it is still an issue, it is probably best to look somewhere else for a room. There are a few other features of staying at the Jockey Club: * They have computers downstairs for use by any guests. I used the computer to print my boarding pass last trip. WiFi is available throughout and in the suites. * There is a hospitality suite where there are books, games, and DVDs to check out at no charge. They even have a popcorn machine for a night in with a movie. I have (on longer trips) decided to spend a night in to recharge my batteries and the DVDs are a nice feature. * There is a pool, fitness room, sauna, and whirlpool. The pool is shadowed by the Cosmopolitan, but the whirlpool is indoors. The fitness center is pretty good with 8-10 machines and a few cardio machines. * A limited number of passes to the Cosmopolitan pool are available by request at the front desk. * There is a shuttle to the local grocery store, but I have never used it and I do not know the schedule. There is the potential for time share guys to make offers to you, but a firm but polite "no" usually does the trick. If you do not want to participate there is no reason you have to do so. I do nto believe Jockey Club suites are still being sold, although I could be wrong. Again, I just love staying at the Jockey Club when in Las Vegas, which is usually at least twice a year. For the value and amenities I will not stay anywhere else. I recommend it wholeheartedly to anyone traveling to Las Vegas and wanting comfortable and affordable accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: deb1954
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here and so enjoyed our stay. Everyone is so friendly and polite. We stayed in the first tower and had a beautiful view of the strip and the fountains at the Bellegio. This was our 3rd time staying here and we are planning on going back next year. This is so nice because if you want to go take a break from the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas you have a living room, kitchen and seperate bedroom to relax in. Not like staying in a hotel with just beds and a chair in a room. I would highly recommend staying here, and the price is right!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Recommend.”
Reviews.Author: FlagstaffMax
Reviews.Content: The general location of this place is great - getting in and out - the situation of the place - is awful. The rooms are suites or apartments - which is the ONLY plus side. To get to the hotel it's a trip down an alley type driveway full of construction equipment. The parking is in the Cosmopolitan's garage and getting to the elevator and to the exit is difficult at best. My biggest rant is that because the Cosmopolitan was built practically abutting the Jockey Club and our room faced the Cosmo - the "view" was of a wall. We couldn't even see the sky to see if it was cloudy or sunny. This all made the room very very dark and half the lamps didn't work. While we didn't have time to use the pool I don't believe it ever gets sun because of the buildings. Finally- beware of Mr. Timeshare Shark. We just ignored his offers of freebies.

Reviews.Title: “A gem right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Gerstel
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful find! We stayed in a one bedroom on the 8th floor (Out of 10) with an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains. The bed was comfortable and very clean. It has a HUGE walk in closet, a smaller bathroom but fine for the 2 of us. The living room/kitchen/eat in area is perfect. Microwave is weak but the oven and toaster make up for it and are very strong! Refrigerator is good size. Laundry was right down the hallway and a new front loader that held lots of clothes! Free parking that is always available. The hotel is that is is a little difficult to find, but we found it on the first try with warning from other reviews, and the signage isn't the best I have ever seen but by day 2 we new our way around. The only negative is that there is a lot of noise early in the morning with road construction and trucks dropping off product. But this is in a prime spot and we were able to walk to everything!!! Right across from Miracle Mile Mall and Planet Holleywood.

Reviews.Title: “Bad pool and whirlpool”
Reviews.Author: NDtravelmom
Reviews.Content: The pool and spa at the Jockey Club are a huge joke. On the first glance, the pool area was quite nice with nice seating and tables and three very clean grills. However, the sun never shines on the pool...who wants to go to Las Vegas and be in the shade all day?? When my husband politely asked at the front desk when was the best time to get sun at the pool, she got very defensive and about bit his head off. Also, no one under 18 is allowed in the whirlpool. We decided to ignore the sign and take our very well-behaved 11 year old into the whirlpool since we were the ONLY ONES in the entire pool/whirlpool area. In no time a security guard appeared and kicked us out and asked us our room number---Get real Jockey Club---your pool area sucks and was barely used by anyone during our entire stay. Would it really hurt for a well-behaved child to go in the whirlpool with her parents?? We made it clear from the very beginning that we were not interested in the time share and they pretty much left us alone about that for the rest of the stay. Room was fine; the suite with a kitchen was a great option for our family and the price was right. Room was clean and king-sized bed was comfortable although our daughters said the sofa bed was not so comfortable (but they're teenagers--they slept in everyday anyhow!). The hotel shuttle to the grocery store and to the outlet mall were great, totally free and on-time.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FiremanTraveler
Reviews.Content: If you're standards do not rise above that of a run down Holiday Inn this place would be fine. Unfortunately for the Jockey Club I have traveled quite extensively and stayed in some finer resorts and hotels. My exact words to describe this hotel I could not post. I am a timeshare owner and traded an ocean front unit at a five star gold crown resort in Cabo San Lucas into the Jockey Club and I recieved a second floor room with a view of the wall of the cosmopolitan and sewer pipes (along with the smell) coming from the first floor of the Jockey Club. I immediately contacted the front desk upon entering the room but was told there was nothing they could do for me. I spent two days trying to contact Lori Elie the "resort manager" but was consistenly told she was out of the office. I finally left a message for her along with my complaints, my room number and cell number but she never bothered to return my call. This place is a dump....the smell of the "mini market" took me back to a mom and pop corner store in Mexico (which I love...IN MEXICO!!) Unfortunately the prices (A six pack of budwieser was $13) were enough to shock me back to reality and realize I was just in a dump in Vegas. The "walkway to the srip"is about 100 yards of a dark smelly alleyway that is used for delivery trucks and apparently time share salesmen that are are ready and willing to take advantage of people leaving the Jockey club who they know are not happy with the place. We were approached in the alley by a guy that worked for another timeshare hotel, apparently the catch phrase is..."how do you like the jockey club" then when you begin to tell them how much it sucks they offer to put you up in their hotel for a mere "90 minute presentation" The concerige for the Jockey Club happened to walk out the door, noticed what was going on and a screaming and yelling match between the two insued, apparently they are well aware of the inferiorities of the Jockey Club (JC) and threatened by losing guests, we just walked away. We tried to go to the "spa" one day to try and maybe salvage something good from this place, we attempted to sit in the jacuzzi but the chlorine level was so high it immediately burned our eyes, we opened the door that encloses the jacuzzi to try to get some fresh air just so we could stay in the room but soon after getting in noticed our skin was either being bleached or chemically burned. (not sure which) We then went to the pool which was cold (mind you the JC is surrounded by tall buildings, or as they like to say "nestled" and barely see's the light of day. The liner of the pool was blue, but the bottom was brown, pretty sure it wasn't made that way, I have seen nicer pools at a holiday inn. The "view" of the Bellagio they tout is only obtained from the top floors on one side of course and I suspect only reserved for those who are most likely to purchase a timeshare from this dump, otherwise you're view is of a wall or the "walkway to the strip"...a dark alley. I'm guessing I got the room I got because I am already a timeshare owner and I declined to attended the "owners meeting" for those of you not familiar, thats where they try to get you to buy another timeshare or upgrade the one you have. The JC should have taken the offer from The Cosmoplitan so they could have been torn it down and made better use of the space.

Reviews.Title: “best place on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: blackthornsx9x
Reviews.Content: please dont let others past experience deter you from traveling here .I loved it it was beautiful and big ,and fun of fun and excitment right in the middle of everything :) i walked everywhere i kinda felt like a little kid again :) except this time i could drink and gamble hahah . plus there is a good site see's around there area im an out doors girl and man was i happy .

Reviews.Title: “Average price, older rooms, furnishings.Great location”
Reviews.Author: signeug1
Reviews.Content: Very good service, Lousy view except north facing rooms (Bellagio Fountains) New Cosmopolitan Casino next door Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location without the frills”
Reviews.Author: iluvsanfran
Reviews.Content: This is not your typical Vegas experience. With large flashy casino resort surrounding this hotel you could almost miss it (and we did -3x times). The sign on the street indicating the location is more like a post stamp and if we did not already know this proerty is in between Bellagio and Cosmopolitian we would never found it. The entrance and parking is shared with the Cosmopolitian hotel and again a scavenger hunt to locate the elevators for the hotel dispite very specific directions from the valet. Logistics aside, this is a very clean and recently remodeled time-share property with a home-y feel. We stayed in a one bedroom, King bed, Queen sofa sleeper and 1 bathroom. The unit had a dining area and full kitchen complete with utensils and dishes. Excellent service, we had called for extra items past 11pm and housekeeping arrived shortly after our request. Our room was refreshed daily which does not always happen in time share properties. Really quiet, we did not hear our neighbors come or go, and the main building offers free DVD movies to take back to your room as well as printing for boarding passes. The only thing I did not like was that guest of the property did not have to use their key card to enter the building, the main entrance has doors that open with motion sensors which I though was wierd because most properties make sure you area guest before you are allowed in the elevators to the guest rooms

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in an unlikely location”
Reviews.Author: bankietraveller
Reviews.Content: The Jockey Club has got to be by far the best place I stayed in when I was travelling around America. Tucked in behind some new shopping mall they are still constructing and right beside the Bellagio, this place is a hidden gem. Up until we got to Vegas the 4 people I was travelling with were sharing two double beds at each stop. This place however we managed to get a bed each. Within the hotel there are two bedrooms, one en suite. It has another shower and toilet facility a living room with two chair beds. Within the living room there is a kitchenette with all the utensils you need and a dining table. Each room had it's own television with independent cable channels. It was very spacious and very clean. It had it's own swimming pool and gym. It also had a mini mart on the ground floor. They had movie nights with free popcorn and in the mornings they had shuttle buses that went to the outlet malls and a bigger supermarket so you could pick up supplies. All this was included in the cost. The location as I mentioned before is second to none when you're travelling on a budget. You are practically in the center of all the big casinos and shopping districts. It was really inexpensive as well and exceptional value for money. I would recommend this location to anyone visiting Las Vegas either on a backpacking tour of the states or extended stay. Families and backpackers.

Reviews.Title: “Unit 926- Be careful of expectations”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyNavymom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at jockey club before so I knew about the wonderful location and the construction. Also, we have been traveling around the world for over 20 years and I have NEVER written a bad review before. As long as I get what I am expecting, I am fine, we have stayed on some places that were probably 1-2 stars at best. but wanted the location I rented this unit privately and it was not what we expected. When we 1st walked into the room i noticed something on the floor under the dining room table, it was a dirty pillowcase. I went to put the dirty pillowcase in the front closet where I had noticed a large laundry bag. Upon closer inspection, it was a bag of laundered towels, and the top 1/3 were still wet from the laundry and where going to sit there for a week and mildew for the next tenant. The flyer for the unit said washer/dryer, so we packed for 3 days. There was no washer/dryer IN the unit, it is in the building. The flyer also said tv, notice I said tv, not tv's. In a 2 bdr (self described luxury unit) unit there was 1 20-inch TV in the living room. It has been a very long time since we have been anywhere that didn't have tv in master suite. The unit was DIRTY. I picked up dish towel hanging on stove to dry my hands and on the backside was old food stuck to towel. All of the floors were dirty with actual pieces of trash in some corners. The master bath tub had the broken handle laying in the bottom of the dirty tub and the toilet was really bad! I used the 2nd bath and left this one to the hubby. One panel of the wall mirror in the dining room was so dirty with hand prints that I couldn't guess the last time it had been cleaned. The extra blanket in the 2nd bdr was laying on the floor of the closet in a heap. The kitchen was very poorly equipped. There is 1 supposedly sharp knife that wouldn't peel a cucumber or slice a tomato. We went to walmart and bought 2 knives so we could eat the steaks we were cooking for dinner. Very limited pans and bowls. The toaster was full of old crumbs and didn't work unless you held down the button the whole time. Another issue was that our keys would not stay activated. Everyday, sometimes 2x a day, our keys would stop working and we would have to go to security to request replacements. The replacements were not made immediatley so if you were going in and out, security had to take you up and let you in while you were waiting for keys. While I do love renting different places to stay the lesson learned here is to ask very specific questions and to not rent without reviews from other people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, centrally located accommodation”
Reviews.Author: JoyNelson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had seven nights staying at the Jockey Club and would definitely stay here again. It could not have been any more central to everything we required than where it was. In the middle of many hotels/casinos and straight across the road from the Miracle Mile shops. I could lie in bed and look at ' the Eiffel Tower '. The great benefit of this complex is is that there is no Casino on site which gave us a peaceful environment to relax in. ( no cigarette smoke to be found ). Can't believe they still allow smokers to light up inside buildings! We booked a one bedroom unit and it was spacious & clean. Woke up the 1st morning there and because of the blackout drapes did not realise what the time was. This was wonderful. Heaven for us. We own our own accommodation business so we were looking forward to having many long sleep ins. No noise what so ever. Construction had finished on the Cosmopolitan Hotel next door and they opened about 2 hours after we left Vegas. Shower - very good water pressure and always hot. I don't have a bad thing to say about this place. Staff were excellent and friendly. Overall our trip to Vegas can be described as an Experience - one we enjoyed immensley and having a great home base only added to this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good, no-frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: ediesquids
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights before moving on to Caesars Palace. The Jockey Club is full of nice touches and has an excellent location, center Strip. Traffic is heavier than usual since the opening of the Cosmopolitan Hotel, but you can walk everywhere from the Jockey Club so it is certainly not a deal-breaker. It is right next to the Bellagio Hotel and across the street from the Paris and Planet Hollywood, so the location is excellent. Rooms are extremely spacious and clean with kitchens and appliances. Beds are also very comfortable. They have somewhat outdated furnishings, so if you are looking for an upscale and classy hotel, then this is not the place for you. My one complaint was that there wasn’t much security at the hotel and there are no bolt locks on the room doors. One night when we came back to our room there were “porn cards” slipped under our door, so obviously anyone can walk in whenever they want. This hotel has a lot of nice touches such as free movie rentals and popcorn, friendly hotel staff, courtesy calls and movie nights. For a great value and a no-frills, clean hotel, the Jockey Club is for you.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: jesshowe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Jockey Club for our honeymoon after leaving the Flamingo. Had a wonderful time. The condo was spacious with a full kitchen. The staff was friendly and well informed. Very helpful. The location CAN'T be beat. A little annoying getting harrassed by the time share sales people constantly. Make sure you request a room on the Bellagio side or else you are just looking at a wall with the new City Center next door. Pool doesn't get much sun because of the high rises on either side of the building

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse at Jockey Club a filthy disgrace”
Reviews.Author: Davcan
Reviews.Content: Penthouse 1106 & 1108, owned by an doctor from CA, were advertised on the web as a private rental. There were videos of the two condos and everything looked in order for us to vacation with our 4 grown children. When we arrived, we were horrified at the condition of units. The couches were disgusting and every frame broken; the bed frames were all broken (one was held up by a paint can); the kitchen was absolutely gross & inadequately stocked with dishes (3 coffee cups between 2 condos); old peanuts, candy, etc. all over the floor and in the couches; no replacement trash bags or cleaning supplies; bathtubs had mold around every edge. The truth did not match the video we first viewed.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience!”
Reviews.Author: Ninjat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jockey Club with my family at the beginning of december 2010. I booked the hotel through Las Vegas Tourist Bureau. The experience starting with the booking was excellent. We had a 2 bdrm apt. with a complete kitchen and 2 bathrooms, very comfortable for my group of 7 people. We had plenty of towels, coffee and very comfy beds. Wonderful view of the Bellagio fountains. We arrived on a thursday afternoon (5pm) and the check in was complete in 5 minutes. The hotel is very quiet and very easy to get in and out not like the big hotels that can take 20 minutes to get to your room. There is no casino at the hotel but the Bellagio is next door. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price, Room”
Reviews.Author: kwtech
Reviews.Content: Found this place via website booking.com. Condo complex between new Cosmopolitan Hotel and Bellagio. Great location! Construction of Cosmopolitan next door means using temporary walkway to get from strip to condo complex - minor inconvenience. (Should be resolved now as I heard Cosmopolitan has since opened). For less than the price of a weekend night at other strip hotels, got one bedroom apartment with separate living room and kitchen (appox. 98.00 per night). The bedroom looked out on the Bellagio fountains and the Paris Hotel! In spite of being right on the strip - complex is very very quiet. No restaurant - but there is a fully stocked store in the lobby. Some of the items are on the expensive side. You play for the convenience. They're trying to sell condos, so be prepared to say NO to attend a sales presentations (you go through that no matter where you stay in Vegas). Depending on the part of the condo complex you're staying in, the walk from the lobby can be long. I'd definitely stay again. No frills, large condos, great views, pool, and you can't beat the location and price combo!

Reviews.Title: “Best spot, central to everything”
Reviews.Author: bayc
Reviews.Content: Booked in again, as we have used this hotel before - love its central area ( even if construction continues ) opposite planet hollywood and next to belliago, bus stop to out let centres right out front and close to shows and restaurants, what more could you ask for. Full kitchen including stove and dishwasher, so could cook if you wish but really why would you when your on holiday? Pillows large and so soft - even asked where they got them from, very comfy. Love the idea too that I dont have to walk thru a casino.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Spacious place, UNBEATABLE location”
Reviews.Author: Jersey_Traveller0079
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights around the thanksgiving holidays and have no complaints. We rented a 2BR condo. Though construction and ammenities are of average quality, it's a clean, well-maintaned place. It was freezing in Vegas the 3 days we stayed there, and the apartment was comfortably warm. Kitchen had all the basic pots and pans and silverware to fix a quick breakfast from grocieries purchased in the Mini mart within the hotel. Bellagio is next doors and Paris is across the street. Location of Jockey Club is unbeatable. We booked really last minute and got a really high rate for the third night of our stay - otherwise it was $80 per night for a 2BR condo, which is a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy kitchens, moldy bathrooms, Frat house furnishings,... Gross!”
Reviews.Author: impeckable1
Reviews.Content: We are renting the 3 Bedroom penthouse unit... After discovering the unit conditions while be began to unpack we were blown away and asked to move to another property. We were told the only refund would be $300.00 of the $4,000.00 paid in advance. We vacation all around the world several times a year and have never experienced anything as bad as The Jockey Club... With so many choices available in Las Vegas there is no reason to subject yourself to this misery. We have taken 20 photos of the unit which will be posted when we return home next week. David Peckham

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: billburt
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Jockey Club regularly for 10 years. Best location and price on the strip. Ideally located next to Bellagio, we have had only positive experiences here - we visit twice a year. Rooms are comfortable, large and include a kitchen in the suite - we never use it because world class dining is always in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “My Vegas trip in November”
Reviews.Author: papag1949
Reviews.Content: I would like to commend the front desk personnel and Security for there help to me when I thought I lost my license. They were very kind and helpful and professional at all times and made my stay enjoyable. I also enjoyed the owners meeting where I got to meet other owners and more information about the hotel. I did not enjoy the people outside on the main strip sidewalk who pressured us to go to there sales pitch even though I was an owner just to get us to sign up with RCI. The only reason was I was in town already and I wanted my wife to see the room before she had to leave and go back home to work. The next day I found out all I had to do was go to the front desk and ask to see a room and they would have allowed me too. The room service was great as new towels were presented each day. The room I have is a 1 and 1/2 bathroom which I found very clean and neat. The room has a nice fireplace and very roomy. The Kitchen was a little small but enough to do Breakfast and lunch easily. Did dinner on the outside. The convenience store down stairs was ok but pricey but they do have three grocery shopping shuttles during the week which is alot better. The bedroom was very nice with two queen beds and master bathroom was OK with a tub and shower combo a little tight but not bad. Location was great as you could go to Belliagos, Planet Hollywood, Ballys, Paris, Bills, Ceasears and Flamingo all within a little walking distance. I recommend the RTC.com website to find all the bus routes and times to all places you may want to visit. You can even purchase tickets online at a reasonable price for a five day pass good on any bus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent deal”
Reviews.Author: Gasoil4ever
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, a bit old compared to the others on the strip but clean and quiet. No gambling, no loud music, large rooms. I really appreciated my stay for a week at the SEMA Show. You can really rest. Rooms have a kitchen + living room you can rapidily feel home. No place to eat, but across the street you have all you need. + rooms where really unexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Experience with this property”
Reviews.Author: CoachJSin
Reviews.Content: Im used to staying at Mid-Level accommodations in Vegas. Which is to say that the Jockey Club is right on par with my expectations. Stayed 4 nights on Halloween weekend. Two Bedroom suite was very nice and clean with a view of the Bellagio Fountains, Ceasars, and Paris. I understand there are many rooms in the Jockey club that face a brick wall, although I would prefer a view, this would not be a deal breaker for me. Room was clean and neat. You won't find marble flooring, room sized bathrooms, or pillow top mattresses which was just fine because my rate didn't reflect those luxuries. Front desk was friendly and helpful. Valet was just fine. I valeted about 2 dozens times and only waited more than 10 minutes twice. The hotel itself was somewhat hard to find, but once you found it everything was smooth sailing. Location was perfect for me. Very short walk to Planet Hollywood, Bellagio, and Aria. The sidewalk in front of the Cosmopolitan was open a few days (probably to handle the halloween crowd), but I have been told that from Dec. 15th on, Jockey club members will be able to walk to all of city center from the inside....Very cool. Since the pool at the jockey club was below average because of construction netting and lack of sunlight, being able to visit the city center complex and use facilities there will be a value. I'd visit again. If you want 5 star, top of the line accommodations look elsewhere. But if you want a solid room with an even better location, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: WendyMc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days. It is my neighbor's timeshare. Not once did anyone bug us about purchasing timeshares. (Never stayed in a timeshare, but read that people were bothered by salespeople a lot that stayed here) There was a lot of construction right in front of the Jockey Club which makes it hard to find the drive, but we figured it out eventually. The noise from construction never bothered us. Our room had a view of a brick wall. It seemed like it was 8 pm at all hours of the day. Could not see the sunlight at all until we walked outside. The room was great though. Largest we ever stayed in on vacation. Service people were very nice. My daughter loved the pool because of the deep end. Even though it is outside it doesn't seem like it. Again, no sunlight and covered by mesh above. It's heated though! The Jockey Club is close to a lot. Valet service was not as bad I thought it would be either. Usually had our car to us in 20 min. or less.

Reviews.Title: “Dated & dwarfed, but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TheRobinsons2010
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bedroom apartment for the first 3 nights of our road trip and were pleased to find that we had a great view of the Bellagio fountains. The rooms were clean, spacious and fully equipped. If you are looking for a good central location, you could probably do a lot worse than the Jockey Club. I felt we got pretty good value for money. Be aware, though, that the Cosmopolitan, currently all but finished right behind the Jockey Club, is colossal and you could end up looking at it instead of the Bellagio fountains. The construction was still taking place during our stay, and the day we tried to use the Jockey Club pool, it seemed to be snowing smelly polystyrene type bits. The staff seemed mostly pleasant and helpful, although it was pretty obvious that as soon as they realised you weren't interested in the timeshare presentation element, the information about shows and getting around Vegas got decidedly dodgy - we wasted a morning following the dubious information about the open top bus that one of the girls gave us. Yes, the valet parking is slow - presumably because of the Cosmopolitan construction - but if you are prepared for that, you should be ok.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: jongrant123
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel and not only did I not sleep a wink because of the overall dirtiness of the room but my wife and I were bit by something that was lurking in the beds. NOT work the small price saving.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; parking a problem with slow mandatory valet.”
Reviews.Author: Tennismama_10
Reviews.Content: It is very true, as many have mentioned, that the mandatory, complimentary valet (due to construction around parking area) takes quite a bit of extra time. So keep this in mind if you have a business meeting, if you're participating in a sporting event, or when planning for the airport. At least an added half hour each time (which could DQ you from a tournament if you don't plan for that). Just an FYI! Everything else is fine. The location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Jstbcsime
Reviews.Content: We hadnt been to Jockey Club in several years so all this was new too us having the new Cosmo going up. We were kinda saddened thet thwy were just this little speck under a huge glass building. Everything room wise was the same, nothing to different to us. The toilet plugged up we had to call fro a plunger. The only positive thing was we had the view fortunately of the Bellagio fountains which made my 6 year old happy, she was obsessed with them day or night!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location. Best place - perfect for families with Kids”
Reviews.Author: luv_socal2
Reviews.Content: I usually don't write reviews, but felt compelled to give back to the site and specially for all the families who always feel Las Vegas is not a place for families. Just came back last night from the Jockey Club. This is place deserve a 10/10, perfect 5 ***** rating. This is the best place in Las Vegas we have stayed so far. This place is perfect for families. They have a fully equipped Kitchen. Rooms are very neat & clean. This is right on the strip. Within seconds you can see the Bellagio Fountains. It's safe as you are always with the strip crowd even coming back at 3 in the Morning. We prepared our own food for all 4 days and saved more than the amount of our hotel expenses and it was soo convenient especially with my 2 and 4 yrs. with me. This is a non-smoking facility and you will love if you care about your family. It's very elegant looking. They provide free internet and have 2 computers in the lobby ( usually you pay 7 - 15 $ per night ) free shuttle to grocery store, free movie night or some other events, towels at the pool. I didn't have to drive for all 4 days as everything is right there !!! Go out enjoy, come home, have food relax, recharge, and ready to go again!!! Staff was very friendly and we know this is the place for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Jockey Club”
Reviews.Author: Buffy24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jockey Club for one night on our way to San Diego. It is a great location, right next to the Bellagio, just a bit back from the strip. There is construction going on right now, but we weren't bothered by any noise. We had a one bedroom suite, that also had a sofabed and a full kitchen. I traveled with my husband, my 22 year old daughter and 8 year old son. While we were there, my son got sick with chills. Housekeeping brought us extra blankets to keep him warm. There is a nice pool, grills on the pool deck and a hot tub in the exercise room. We would stay here again. Parking is free, but is all valet, so plan in advance to get your car.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTING!”
Reviews.Author: kimp78
Reviews.Content: First thing the front desk does when you check in is send you over to the GeoHoliday desk for "information" on your stay. The "concierge" or so they call it, proceeds to tell you about the new City Center they are building around the jockey club. She cons you into signing up for a timeshare presentation without telling you it is a timeshare presentation. In fact here words were "they are all sold out, they don't have anything to sell you". They offer you show tickets and a free 3 night stay at another resort. Needless to say, we got suckered into the presentation but of course did not buy. All the show tickets they gave us were not well known shows and all required a purchase. They even gave us expired tickets. The 3 night stay they offered required ANOTHER timeshare presentation to be attended and you had to pay $99 up front and was not refundable if you didn't attend the presentation. I have been to other timeshare presentations and were given nice, tangible gifts in exchange for my time. All the gifts they gave us went in the trash. The place itself is clean but we couldn't even enjoy the pool because of all the construction going on around it. They had a huge net hanging high above the pool to catch all the debris falling. This cut off all the sunlight that one usually enjoys while using a pool! They don't even offer laundry bags for your dirty laundry. And it is definitely not a resort...more like an apartment for rent. Especially if you are looking to enjoy yourself in Vegas. And the front desk told us that the Mandalay Bay was in walking distance...haha...funny. It cost a $12.50 cab ride to get back to the Jockey Club...does that sound like walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Old, Old, Old”
Reviews.Author: bffchic22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here against my will with my husband and in-laws. The first night we got here my husband and I almost left to stay somewhere nicer because of how outdated and claustrophobic this place was. Nonexistent lobby, terrible service, inescapable smoky smell, and the tiniest front desk I've ever seen. The pool gets no sun at all. There are no restaurants on the premises, must walk across street to the mall. Not a bad location, but if you want to stay somewhere nice in Vegas with a great pool, beautiful views, good service, nice fitness center and modern design, this is NOT it. You will also be harassed about timeshares.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Billinjaxbeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Jockey Club for one week using our Global Connection membership. The following week we moved over to a new timeshare unit we own at the PH Towers by Westgate. We had no complaints with The Jockey Club rooms, somewhat dated but clean and in very good condition. They are updating all of the units with new furniture, flat panel tv's and probably other things. We saw them opening some new furniture and inspecting it. We liked things so well while we were staying at the PH Towers we came over to use the free internet at TJC and bought a timeshare week there over eBay. After arriving home we bought another week. So unless I sell the PH Towers which we bought resale we'll be going to Vegas twice a year (4 weeks). When it came time to print our Southwest boarding passes we again went across the street to TJC and printed them for free.

Reviews.Title: “great value but not fancy....”
Reviews.Author: pipandnigel
Reviews.Content: all our chums were staying at the Bellagio but seemed a bit steep for my budget. booked a room at the jockey club which is bang next door. major benefits including a kitchenette lounge big bed free wifi....all extra at the bellagio....Wifi $15 per day, not even a kettle in the room. The place is a little tired and nothing like the grand entrance of the Bellagio but its quiet. same with the pool, not charming but queit and with ll the bustle of the Strip its good to be able to get some peace....the apartment we booked was a private one through a wedding chapel......little chapel....GREAT deal.....this aprtment didnt have the views but hey ...life is not for looking out of windows.....

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE I HAVE EVER STAYED!”
Reviews.Author: krisandloanna
Reviews.Content: It was awesome! Huge room with everything you could need! It was a home away from home! we had the 1 bedroom 1 1/2 bath sleeps 6! the only thing that was horrible was our view! our view was a giant brick wall from the building next to us! but we just kept the curtin shut, outta sight outta mind! we traveled with 3 kids 7 and under a teenager and a senior citicin and my husband and I....would definitly stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, if outdated and in construction zone”
Reviews.Author: suttercreek
Reviews.Content: If all you are looking for in a Las Vegas Hotel on the Strip is a clean room and a bed that is centrally located, this is the place for you. Just stayed with 2 of my BFF's and it is a GREAT value, clean, comfortable. What it is NOT is marble, granite, modern Vegas glitz. I would not choose for a "romantic getaway" with my husband. It is, however, right next door to Bellagio, across the street from Planet Hollywood & Paris, near Caesars, etc, it is in the very best part of the Strip. Just make certain you score an amazing rate and you can have the budget Vegas stay! Fitness center currently closed for renovation. There is construction noise on weekdays starting pretty early. But quiet otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected”
Reviews.Author: desal
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Jockey Club before moving on to our timeshare exchange week at the Cancun Resort in Las Vegas. The rooms were clean and roomy and the furnishings and carpets were in good shape and not showing any wear and tear. There service staff was very helpful and accommodating and we were not pressured to attend a timeshare presentation. All in all, we were very happy with our stay. The best thing about the resort is its location right next door to the Bellagio. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AFFORDABLE AN COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: jbz2010
Reviews.Content: Me an my girlfriends went to vegas for their birthday an stayed at the jockeyclub suites, Everything from the room to the window was awesome, Had a nice view of the watershow, didnt even have to go outside to see just look out the window an BAMB!! every 30 min. The good thing about the hotel it had everything we needed to cook not only that but there was a shuttle to take you to go get groceries an if you wanted to make it a movie night you can rent movies in the guest services. Will be goin back in July to do it all over again for my birthday:} But will stay a little longer than 3 days 2 nights

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Riverbandit58
Reviews.Content: If all you are looking for in a Las Vegas Hotel on the Strip is a clean room and a bed that is centrally located, this is the place for you. The Jockey Club is near Ballys and the Belagio. While it does not have the amenities of the bigger, more well known hotels, this place is perfect at the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest secret on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: blondietink
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 nights at this little gem in the middle of the strip. This is a perfect place for families to stay as it is a non-gaming hotel and also non-smoking. Yes, it is right next to the new City Center and some of the rooms have a terrible view of a wall. However, we had a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen with a view of the Bellagio Fountains and Paris across the street. The valet parking was awesome and everyone was very polite, friendly, fast and efficient. Our maid service was also terrific and our room was cleaned to perfection every day. The only negatives I can think of for this hotel was a lack of electric plugs available in the bedroom for our laptop and the sofa bed could use a new/better mattress. But, our teenagers didn't mind as they were asleep the minute their heads hit the pillow. There was a huge walk-in closet in the bedroom with plenty of hangers. We were easily able to walk to the Venetian north or down to NYNY/MGM area to the south. The front desk staff was very accommodating and there was security in the building roaming the halls so we felt safe. The pool area has a net over it due to the construction next door, but it had some cute lights hanging from it so it looked neat in the evening. There is also a sauna, exercise room and hot tub open 24 hours a day. There always seemed to be someone cleaning around the hotel, whether it was the restrooms near the lobby, the elevators, or the valet area. Free wireless internet in the room. We booked our trip through Platinum Interchange and got a terrific price. The kitchen was much used and we saved on breakfast and one other meal by eating in our suite. We can't wait to go back again and will definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accommodations and at a price that was very fair”
Reviews.Author: MarcyD49
Reviews.Content: We attended the Las Vegas CES Show and were looking for cheap accommodations and found an advertisement for the Jockey Club and booked on-line. We saved $1,000.00 over going through the discounted travel sites by booking with an owner. This hotel was centrally located on the Las Vegas strip and offered all the ammeneties that we needed. The rooms were large and we were never in need of anything. The staff was very attentive to all the needs of our group. I would not hesitate to use this facility again and especially for the price. I plan on booking this facility again next year for the CES.

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Believe This Place Still Stands!”
Reviews.Author: BFRANK19652008
Reviews.Content: As you drive down Las Vegas Blvd - i.e. The Strip, nestled among the trendy all the new City Center high rises is the Jockey Club, barely seen. Getting there through the construction is a bit of a nightmare and then the sounds of the construction (still going on by the way even though a large majority of City Center is complete) are annoying and distracting. I just kept wondering "when are they going to tear down this place?" or better yet...."why is this place still here?" Jockey Club is a relic of old Las Vegas days gone by. Is that good or bad???...well, depends on your sense of style and your need for all the modern amenities. Jockey Club is definitely NOT modern. I kind of like the little guy against the big corporate fancy boys that the Jockey Club seems to be taking on.... but really, if this is your first time to Vegas - I don't think the Jockey Club is what you're expecting. The website tends to "fancy up" the location and the rooms. I think a major disappointment is in order if you think you're getting a good deal on a condo rental in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great secret little gem! SSSsssh - don't tell everyone!”
Reviews.Author: Lucky_Ange
Reviews.Content: My husband, parents and I chose this after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. We stayed in the Jockey Suites for 10 days from 19th through 29th December. We requested a Bellagio fountain view as we were there for so long - and got precisely that! It was the best view on the strip in our opinions! No better way to round off the day than having a glass of something over ice watching the fountain display. It's location - less than 2 minutes off the strip can't be beat! We could see ten casinos on the strip from our room! We stayed in a two bed, two bath condo. Overall, the accommodation was very good - perfect for our situation. There were little snagging points, but nothing that ruined our stay in any way. We found the hotel staff all very friendly, the mini-market on the ground floor was invaluable - we actually barely shopped anywhere else. Yes it wasn't cheapest, but it wasn't actually the most expensive either. We used the DVD lending service too and the free wifi. Staff in reception were helpful and friendly. We actually managed to dodge the timeshare presentations as we really weren't interested and weren't ever pestered. Our friends from Tacoma, Washington State came down and also stayed at the same condos and were happy with their accommodation also. We didn't visit the pool area or gym as it was really cold in LV at the time. We heard the story of the Jockey Club from a local whilst we were there. This place tried to sell out and move into the City Center behind, but the timeshare situation meant that they couldn't track down all the owners, so it now stays put in Vegas. It deserves to stay put too, we loved staying there. Yes the construction was a pain, but actually will clearly soon be over. I think this place is likely to fill a much needed gap of "little gem" places to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The location is excellent and the overall quality of the room is above avg...”
Reviews.Author: topssuite
Reviews.Content: The jockey club is an older hotel / timesthar property. It is currently under renovation which was not a big deal. We heard very little construction noise and we were told that the construction is going to be finished summer of 2010. The best part about the JC is the location. It is next to the Bellagio and directly across the street from Planet Hollywood. You can not get any better. Plus the bus stop that goes to Fremont Street is very close. The rooms are big, spacious suites w/ full kitchens. The rooms were very clean and overall above avg.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine but beware the timeshare presentation”
Reviews.Author: elliesmomTexas
Reviews.Content: The Jockey Club is located next to the Bellagio and a Deuce bus stop; very convenient. There is construction on-site but our room was quiet.The furniture was mismatched because they are undergoing renovations but we had everything we needed in the suite. The Club has free high speed internet in the lobbey, free DVD & game rental, free popcorn & coffee and a minimart on site for food, beverages. The staff was friendly & helpful. The down side was the timeshare presentation. They promised free tickets to three shows and $200 in gambling money. What they didn't tell us was that the "free" tickets to shows we had never heard of required a two drink minimum per person so each "free" show costs $25 per person. Not a budget buster but also not what was represented. The $200 in gambling money was actually matching funds so if we had gambled $100 we would have gotten another $100. For folks who camp in front of the nickel slots, this was totally useless. Woul I stay there again? Probably, but I'll skip the dog & pony show.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Big Rooms - Not very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Nuti2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for NYE. Location was great because we were able to watch the fireworks from Planet Hollywood and could get back to the hotel without going through the crowds. Rooms are huge, we had a one bedroom suite and the kitchen was fully equipped. In our case, we booked this hotel because they had "normal" rates for NYE (then we switched to TI). If you are staying in Derby´s Tower you will have to cross a long corridor and take stairs, so be careful if you are carrying heavy luggage. I think this hotel will be perfect for big families staying for long time without spending a lot of money. But if you are looking for a real Las Vegas experience, this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Great location--Nice amenities..Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: CocaColaTraveler
Reviews.Content: I had some reservations about this hidden treasure in the middle of the strip. However, once I arrived I was pleasantly surprised. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Not 5 Star but for four guys in Vegas, it was great. Hotel staff was nice and we did not hear the construction that was taking place on the opposite side of the building. We were in the second tower and the walk wasn't that bad as I had previously read--we also had a view of the Bellagio fountains. For the price and location, this was a steal.....would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: dmc1faith
Reviews.Content: A very nice place to stay in Vegas!! Very convenient to everything...and had an awesome view of the Bellagio, Ceaser's and Paris! Very clean and the decor was beautiful. Two bedrooms and two baths!! And all for a very reasonable price!! Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, shame about all the construction”
Reviews.Author: HelenLS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Jockey Club for a week in October 2009. We were lucky and got a suite on the 11th floor, facing The Bellagio, so we had a great view, unlike all the people on the other side of the complex. The suites are very spacious, if a little dated, and have everything you could possibly need. The location is great, and the staff are friendly and helpful (apart from the concierge guy we spoke to). Free Internet is a nice touch too, helpful if you need to check emails, check in for flights etc. The Mini market on site is reasonably priced and stocks a good selection of basics, we used it for drinks and snacks. The major problem the Jockey Club has, as others has said, is all the construction. The noise didn't really affect us, but we were very dissapointed that the pool area gets no sun at all now thanks to the massive buildings that have been built right behind it, and even on a hot Vegas day, the pool area can feel quite chilly. My In-laws were amazed when we showed them the pictures, as they remember the Jockey Club how it used to be before the construction started. The pool situation was overcome by asking at the front desk if there was another pool I could use to sunbathe. The Flamingo, about 10 minutes walk away lets non residents use their pool after 2pm, so I spent a couple of afternoons sunbathing over at their pool, not ideal, but better than the chilly Jockey Club pool!

Reviews.Title: “Lost in Construction”
Reviews.Author: MaBear01
Reviews.Content: It's a nice enough condo, but the ongoing construction makes it a nightmare. It is surrounded by the Cosmopolitan hotel under development and the behemoth Center City and its own "tile replacement" making for no light, no sun and lots of noise. It's a timeshare, so you have to do your own cooking, laundry, shopping, etc. The furnishings and furniture really need to be updated. There are no restaurants on site so you have to leave the premises to do everything. It is however, conveniently located, across the eight lane street from the Mile Mall, Planet Hollywood and the Paris and next door to the Belaggio. There is a local bus stop at the end of the walk, but because of the construction, the walkway in and out is redirected and covered. Trucks and construction workers are everywhere. We wanted to take a swim, and even though it was hot outside, it was relatively chilly in the pool because the covering draped over the top did not allow the sun to come in. The staff is very friendly and accommodating and the hospitality office has coffee, tea, bottled water and popcorn daily until 11 pm for the guests. Because it is a time-share property, be prepared to be asked to sit in on a sales presentation (for which you will be rewarded - we got tickets for George Wallace!) I suspect when all of the construction is completed, it will be a sought after property for those who like the condo/timeshare because of its location. But until that day comes, getting in and out of the Jockey Club is very inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: habib
Reviews.Content: You can not beat the location of this hotel. It does not have own casino but it is really easy to get to casino across the street at planet holywood or next door at belagio. The service is nice and simple. The hotel is very clean. The suite has kitchen and adequately equipped. I like it the most because it's very quiet as soon as you get inside. It's a total change of pace. Therefore, I can get a good rest for between round of gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: ADVENTURE09_9
Reviews.Content: Jockey Club is in the ideal location in Vegas -- directly next to the Bellagio and within walking distance of all other attractions. After reading other reviews, we asked for a room with a view and did receive one to where our window faced the fountains at the Bellagio, it was great! The actual place itself was not great. The Jockey Club is a typical timeshare to where it is roomy and spacious and "appeared" clean. The rooms are very outdated and definitely need a face lift. The tiles in the shower and the flooring are old and need to be replaced. The kitchen is old and the sink/faucet need to be replaced. The biggest disappointment was the pool. The pool area was covered and NO sunlight was able to come through. It was 100+ degrees all week and we were not able to use the pool!! At the time we were there, they were under major construction adjacent to the Jockey Club. This construction prohibited utilizing the main walkway and you had to walk under a covered "construction" walkway to gain access to the main strip. Overall, the Jockey Club is a great location and is NOT a casino -- you are able to go back at night and escape the ringing noises/smoke filled atmosphere. Definitely think the Jockey Club needs revamped and add additional amentities (shuttles, restaurant/deli, pool that is usable, etc.) if they expect to continue to attract time share holders.

Reviews.Title: “like a little apartment”
Reviews.Author: Nickafer
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel in August for my friends Bachelorette party. We had seven girls in one room and it was perfect. It is like a little apartment. It has a full kitchen 2 bed rooms, 2 full bathrooms ( a plus with seven girls ). huge closets and a living room with a pullout bed in the couch. It isn't the cleanest hotel or super pretty inside either but it isn't nasty and gross either. They are doing a lot of construction so it is kinda hard to find and the views are not very great. The pool sucks!!! it is small and the sun never even gets to it. Really bad spot for it. It is a long walk to get to your room and you have to go up 2 elevators. Everyone that works there is very helpful and it is easy to get help with what u need. If you are traveling with children or a large group and really are not into the glam and excitement of the vegas hotel then this is the place for you. A couple things that made our time bad was first of all the maid never came even once to give us fresh towels or anything. We were girls partying even a trash pick up would have been nice. On our last night we called and asked for a late check out they said sure we could check out at 12 but then in the morning we were told they didn't know what we were talking about and needed to be out by 11

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and service”
Reviews.Author: irislily
Reviews.Content: First part of the trip was for business; the second was for play. The Jockey Club was the perfect place for both. Large suite with full kitchen (range, fridge, dishwasher, microwave). Free and fast wifi. Room was clean and comfortable. Room location does make a difference, however. The first room we were assigned faced the Bellagio. Nice view, but also noisy due to the construction traffic. Asked for a quieter room. The staff quickly complied and we were assigned to the top floor. No view, but the quiet was worth the trade off. With the exception of the concierge (who seems clueless), the staff were friendly and efficient. The location is perfect, right in the center of the strip. The construction is a mild annoyance, but didn't really affect us. The Jockey Club is a great value. We'll definitely stay there the next time we're in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “the time of my life”
Reviews.Author: glenda7772003
Reviews.Content: all i can say is that if your going to stay any where it should be at the jockey club its a moment you will always charish and remember . you go jockey club g. jones

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good price”
Reviews.Author: Half8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jockey Club for two nights and we very enjoyed our stay here. The front desk staff was not very nice or helpful but the room on the other hand was great. It was huge and came with kitchen facilities, two television, living room and big cozy king size bed that was very comfortable. Both the hotel and the room was very clean everywhere you went. We did not try out the swimming pool but it was very small. The hotel offer Internet free of use and some computers that came very handy. What we did love most about this hotel was the location, just door to Bellagio hotel on the middle of the Strip. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret on the Strip!!”
Reviews.Author: grasshopper66
Reviews.Content: I almost didn't want to write this review...I was afraid more people would find out about this great hotel and they might raise the prices! I read through many of the reviews posted here and elsewhere online and was really kind of apprehensive about booking this hotel, but I waited until the last minute to join some friends for a quick weekend getaway and needed a room, so I decided to go for it... Let me tell you, it was great! I booked the same day I was to travel, and got the room for about 80 bucks a night. There is a lot of construction going on, which might make the hotel entrance hard to spot if you are trying to find it on your own, but since I took a taxi from the airport, this was not an issue for me. Check-in went smoothly, but I was not able to get one of the rooms with a view of the Bellagio. But the room itself was excellent! I have been to Vegas many times and have stayed at a few of the strip hotels, and most of the time it feels like you're paying hundreds of dollars to stay at a dressed up Best Western. The rooms in the Jockey Club are more like apartments! You get a full kitchen (dishwasher, oven, stove, full size fridge, cups/plates/cooking utensils) a living room with a sofa/loveseat, a dining area, a large bathroom, walk-in closet with iron/ironing board, a king size bed, two TVs (not flat screen), and a stereo. The sofa was also a pull out bed. There was easily enough room for 4-6 people in a room. The room was immaculate. It actually looked brand new, as if I was the first person to stay there. There was no view, but honestly, how long are you going to spend gazing out of the window or watching TV in your room when you come to Vegas? I heard NO construction noise all weekend. The hotel is RIGHT on the Strip, across from Planet Hollywood and next door to Bellagio. If I had anything negative to say, it would be really nitpicky.
