The layout of the hotel I saw mentioned in other reviews is not that much of a problem. You go up to the second floor on one elevator, go about 50 feet down a hallway, and up TEN steps to get to the other tower. No worse than trying to navigate through a casino if your ask me. It is kind of hard to catch taxis at the hotel, I found it quicker to just go to the Bellagio or PH and get in their taxi line, but the valet drivers got me a ride to the airport when I checked out in a Town Car. Nice! The pool is kind of small, if you care about that kind of thing. I didn't. I didn't bring my computer, so I don't know about internet in the rooms, but they have free computers with internet down in the lobby. There's also a store with just about anything you may have forgotten (no hard liquor though, bring your own!) the prices are the same as ou find anywhere else on the Strip, so if you want lower prices rather than convenience, better ride out to a corner store out in town. All told, this is a GREAT place to stay for the money, and I will definitely be back. If you want to impress other people with how much you paid for your hotel room, go to the Wynn or Encore. If you come to Vegas to gamble/party/eat/have fun and need a large, comfortable place to stay, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: islelvr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Las Vegas at several other time share exchange locations. The Jockey Club was not the best of those resorts but it has the best location...even with the construction next door! You do have to walk through a construction covered tunnel to get to The Strip but that is only half a normal city block. There are two towers and I was in the front tower on the 7th floor. My view was of the pool below and a concrete wall. But, I did not go to Las Vegas to look at the view from my rooms. Plenty of room in the 2 bedroom, bathrooms were fair size and kitchen had all that I needed for breakfast and snacks. There was some wear and tear on the carpets and the shears in the living room had large tears in them. Buffet at The Wynn was the best I tried with Paris second and Bellagio champagne brunch at third. I always try to go to Emeril's Fish house at MGM and it did not disappoint on this trip. PFChangs is across the Strip from the Jockey club along with Planet Hollywood casino and shops. Bellagio is next door. Paris, Bally's, Ceasar's and Monte Carlo are close walks. MGM and New York are more of a hike. The Deuce bus is the best was to cover the length of the Strip and there is a stop for this to the left of the construction walkway that you exit from the Jockey Club. Unless you plan to go off the Strip or tour more of the area (Grand Canyon, Hoover Dam, etc.), you will not need a car when you stay at the Jockey Club.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, friendly staff, GREAT location.”
Reviews.Author: shermccormick
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Jockey Club. Stayed there from May 9-May 16. It is a nice place. The rooms are clean, the air is cold and the staff were helpful. We were able to get a room with a view, which is a must. If not, you're looking at a brick wall. There is some noise in the mornings around 5-6am. But, it doesn't last long. This isn't a 5 star hotel, so if you want that go next door to the Bellagio. But, if want a smaller hotel with easy check in and check out, no lines for elevators, this is the place. You are in walking distance of millions of places to shop and eat. The Earl Grey Sandwich place at Planet Holleywood had good breakfast and lunch for about $5-$7. Not bad . There's also a lot of other good restaurants in Planet Holleywood. Bill's is a nice smaller casino to gamble at with lower limits. Main thing we didn't like at Jockey Club was timeshare presentation. We agreed but final sales person was just rude. No need for that. And, if you want a great pool, this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Special Place”
Reviews.Author: byrdman53
Reviews.Content: I wold like to thank the staff and especially like to thank Yvonne for helping make our trip so special as we saw multiple shows, including Jay Leno, CMA Awards show , The George Strait Artist of the decade show , Steve Wyrick show , KA at MGM , and renewed our wedding vows at Little Chapel OF Flowers , ( Which was a secret to my wife ). Every thing was perfect including our room. THANK YOU SO MUCH JOCKEY CLUB !!!!

Reviews.Title: “All the convenience without the casino”
Reviews.Author: TenShoes
Reviews.Content: Staying at the JC while in town for a conference. Had an exchange deal through my time-share (not the JC or Polo Towers) so the rate was quite good. Very well located on the strip next to Bellagio's, easy walk to the mid-strip area. LOTS of construction going on right now which completely occludes the entrance. The lobby is pretty bland, but has the benefit of not being smoky like the main hotels. Staff is friendly but not pushy (unlike other timeshare visits I have had). Bonuses include onsite minimart and "hospitality" suite with free movie rentals, games, and popcorn. The rooms (at least my room this visit) is very nicely appointed, 1-bed with kitchen and walk-in closet. Even with the major construction, I cannot hear a thing while in the room. No view (3rd floor, the tower goes much higher though). All-in-all a great place to stay if you can get a good deal and want to get away from the casinos (at least temporarily =). Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Mid-Strip Value”
Reviews.Author: motherof6
Reviews.Content: Pros: We had a wonderful experience at the Jockey Club. For less than $80 a night we got a one bedroom, one and a half bath condo with a full kitchen and livingroom. It was perfectly clean, and seemed to have been painted recently. Our housekeeper kept the condo immaculate for us. Cons: There is construction going on starting at about 6 in the morning and finishing up around 11 at night. We didn't notice it after awhile, but if you stay in one of the sections closer to the construction it would really be annoying. Our condo afforded absolutely no view - just the wall of the building next door, but maybe that cut down on some of the noise. And anyway, who goes to Vegas to hang out in the room? Another thing was that our room was two elevator rides, a hike, and a staircase from the lobby - quite a trek with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “sweet spot”
Reviews.Author: pharmdeena09
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious and pleasant. We were able to explore the whole las vegas experience without any hassles, as the location was prime to all las vegas fun. It was refreshing to be in a facility free of all the cigarrette smoke, which usually drowns the casino-hotels on the strip. I am looking forward to many more stays at the lovely penthouse.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location right on the strip in the middle of all the action”
Reviews.Author: twinjessica
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Jockey Club Suites everytime we go to Vegas! The best part about it is the convenient location right on the strip next to Bellagio. The Suites were clean and very well-maintained. The living space is very comfortable with the living room, dining room, kitchen, bedroom, and bathrooms. It is like a fully-furnished luxury condo with all the amenities. We prefer to always stay at the Jockey Club rather than any of the other big casino since we feel right at home there! I would highly recommend anyone who visits Vegas to stay at the Jockey Club!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ilovenewport36
Reviews.Content: This is a mixed review. We rented a unit from Las Vegas Strip Rental. The representative confirmed that we had a unit with a view (1176) and that the unit was gorgeous. Not only did it not have a view, but the bedrooms had floor to ceiling vertical blinds that were missing several sections, leaving openings that were as wide as 2 feet. The bedrooms faced a construction walkway with workers going back and forth. There was no privacy in the bedrooms to the construction workers, plus the unit needed to be updated, nothing gorgeous. Mike in Security was able to find another unit for us that had a view and was beautiful for the same rate. The location is terrific, you can walk to so many places, having your own kitchen is very handy. The free valet is convenient, but if you leave on a Sunday, call ahead for your car. We had to wait for over 20 minutes for ours. Having free internet was great, the staff was nice overall.

Reviews.Title: “Commendable”
Reviews.Author: kceesse
Reviews.Content: I booked the Jockey Club for one night during the MLK weekend. The hotel is actually quite a misfit in Las Vegas! It is located in between Belargio and a huge construction site called the City Center. When every other hotel has 1000+ room with casinos, high floor numbers and extravegent lobbies, this all-suite hotel/serviced apartment only has a few floors, a few hundred rooms/suite, no casino. Pros - Loved the location - one of the best location actually. You step out and see Balargio, Planet Hollywood, Paris and more. - Loved the large rooms - all-suites, included pull out sofa bed, good size kitchen, two TV - Loved the walk-in closet and it was quite large - Great service/staff - A hospitality lounge with free DVD rentals, coffee and tea, and popcorn all day - Very clean - Free valet parking for hotel guests - cheap prices! - Since this hotel is cater for long-stay packages also, there are a lot of features that are quite unique, like 2 weekly grocery trips, social nights/cocktail hours, etc Cons - Not the typical extravegent lobbies/furnishings, in fact lobby was quite small - A little old - No views at all on about 50% of the rooms. one of the sides faces the Balargio fountains, but the other side faces a huge brick wall that the City Center development made, so absolutely NO view at all, other than the huge concrete wall - Small pool - Long walks from lobby to the "second" wing of hotel rooms However, I do recommend the Jockey Club, given the great location, low prices, and comfortable accomodation

Reviews.Title: “Great option without all the fancy options”
Reviews.Author: Mizzzlizzzz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Jockey Club through a timeshare exchange. We stayed from Dec 26-Jan 2. The Jockey Club is a nice option on the strip. It has no casino or restaurants, but there are a ton of those on the strip anyway. We loved the location in the middle of the strip and right across from the Miracle Mile shops. After reading many reviews on The Jockey Club I called ahead and requested a room with a view of the fountains and were told it is on a first come first serve basis. Our plane was delayed a few hours and didn't arrive until 1AM. The staff was not very friendly upon arrival and were told we could not get a room with a view. We ended up with a view of a concrete wall. We had a 1 bedroom 1 bath unit. The unit was spacious and clean. Housekeeping only cleaned our room once during the entire week. They would get us fresh towels, but did not bother to change the over flowing trash can. Overall a decent place to stay (especially since ours only cost us our exchange fee) and I would stay again. As for the construction we only heard it a few days, but we were there over a holiday week. It seeemed to start about 8AM and go until maybe 8PM. Also, we saw a few shows. Hypnosis show - Mesmerized with Marc Sarvard at the V theatre at Planet Hollywood. Great show! Very funny! After seeing mesmerized and liking it so much we decided to see the dirty hypnosis, Unleashed, show at Krave at Planet Hollywood. Not near as good as the Mesmerized. It seemed like a bad knockoff of Mesmerized. Marc Sarvard puts on way better show that I would see again! Cique de Soleil - Mystere at Treasure Island. Great show. Amazed at the the things these people could do. Expensive, but worth it. I would pay the 200+ over again. Steve Wyrick Magic Show - Terrible. This guy is very cocky and his tricks are not very good. Don't waste your money! Only reason you might want to go is if you have a 5 year old, maybe he/she might be impressed with the show. Mac King Comedy/Magic Show at Harrahs. I read the show was pretty good, so I went to Harrahs to get tickets and they gave me free ones. You actually have to pay $10/ticket, but get a free alcoholic beverage with each ticket. The drinks were strong! The show was great. Very funny and good magic tricks. Would see this show again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice non-Casino option on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: SaraPA
Reviews.Content: Able to stay at this property through a timeshare exchange via my brother-in-law. I went for a conference and we are are not gamblers. It was nice to not have to stay in a casino, but still be near all the activity of the Strip. The Jockey Club is located smack-dab in the middle of the Strip. You are within walking distance of Bellagio, Planet Hollywood, Paris and maybe Bally's. Lots of good dining, gambling and sight seeing just outside your doorstep! That said, your options in the Jockey club are limited. There is a mini-mart with a limited selection--good for desperation items forgotten at home, bottle of water or postcard only, IMHO. Beyond that there is not much offered for amenities...The pool is small, but good for a dip or quiet moment as was never crowded. The front desk is a bit curt and not very helpful. I interacted with them twice, and both times seemed a little annoyed. I did not use the concierge, but they attacked us on two occasions to offer a "free dinner" and didn't seem any different than the hawkers on the street... The construction is a little annoying. Every morning we awoke to loud "back-up" beeps of construction equipment. Usually beginning around 7AM. But that was it, and the beeping was inconsistent. We asked about being moved to a different room and were told that "all rooms are loud--at least you have a view." We asked to be on the Bellagio side, and, did indeed have a great view. The rooms were standard. I was *very* impressed by the WALK-IN closet, so nice to have LOTS of room for luggage etc. TV in bedroom and living room. Pocket doors to close of bedroom from living area was nice. Stove, fridge, microwave, dishwasher and coffee maker. Full set of dishes, pots/pans etc. Must proved own food, little package of coffee provided each day. Housekeeping was good--clean towels and empty trash every day and made up bed. In closing, there was nothing spectacular about this property, but also nothing terrible compared to a typical hotel stay. But the location was *great* and nice to not be located in a casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great little spot”
Reviews.Author: janecanadian
Reviews.Content: A group of 5 friends and myself stayed at the Jockey Club Nov 5 to 10 and had a great time. I was a little worried about the construction but we really weren't bothered by it, other than it was a little difficult accessing the jockey club at times...other than that we couldn't have asked for a better place for the price we paid. The location is right in the middle of the action (literally in the middle of the new Cosmopolitan Hotel) and the two bed/two bath suite was very clean and suited our needs perfectly. The decor could use a little updating but who cares, we were only there to sleep and shower.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location”
Reviews.Author: laroch777
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Las Vegas where we stayed at the Jockey Club through timeshare exchange with Interval International. Having read some of the reviews before we left we were a bit apprehensive about what to expect. Our experience of the place couln't have been better. We had a room facing the fountains of the Bellagio which gave us a spectacular view of that part of the strip. The room was very comfortable and adequately furnished and the maid service was excellent. Your bed was made for you every day, clean towels provided every day and the place generally tidied. Check in was so efficient and the staff so courteous and friendly, and the best bit was you didn't need to walk through a sea of gaming machines and cigarette smoke to get there! The building going on around the Jockey Club is just phenomenal - almost to the point it is dwarfed by it. We were not too aware of construction noise - in fact we heard more noise from the fountains of the Bellagio which is not a complaint as we would not have changed our unit for anything. The pool was a bit of a shame and we did not use it at all. Luckily we had friends who were staying else where and we made use of their pool. Hopefully the Jockey Club can withstand all the development around it as if we were ever to go back to Las Vegas we would certainly not consider choosing anywhere else to exchange into but the Jockey Club.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandbeauty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a time share exchange week there and it was great! Our unit overlooked the Bellagio and the location great.- CVS and Walgreens nearby had a small food market in them for essentional food items. Noise from the construction next door wasn't a big problem. Right across from the Miracle Mile shops where there are several restaurants and many shops. Our unit was spacious, well furnished and kept spotless during our stay.Upon departure, when we aked the front desk for a taxi to get us to the airport, they suggested a shuttle that cost only $6 p.p. and it was there promptly at 4:30 a.m. Have only positive coments to make about the Jockey Club.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: sword79
Reviews.Content: The Jockey Club has thieves working for them. Details; It is mandatory that you use their valet service if you park on the premises. I filled my gas tank the day before to facilitate a 5 AM departure. Approximately 20 minutes into the trip I scanned my gages and noticed I was under 3/4 of a tank of gas. Because of travel requirements I could not return and wait until management arrived to solve my dilemma. Later I found items had been taken out of the console of the car as well. Upon completion of my trip I notified Jockey Club by email of my problem. To date, 3 weeks later, they have refused to communicate with me. I contacted my booking agent Hotels Com on two occasions for assistance; they as well have had no response. Recommend you find a more reliable hotel/motel in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ebrewer3
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the money! Easy walk to Bellagio and Planet Hollywood. View from room overlooking the fountains was nice. Only negative is that they do not allow late check out for overnight guest (non owners) but they will hold your luggage for you. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Mailgirl
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I booked this location through a timeshare exchange with Interval International. The week we picked was busy, so we could only get a one bedroom suite. There was a fold-out couch in the living room, so the suite was just fine for two people. We did not get one of the rooms facing the Bellagio fountains. We ended up on the sixth floor facing the Cosmopolitan construction. We never heard any construction noise loud enough to wake us up, though. The parking there is mandatory Valet parking. At night they take all the cars over to the Planet Hollywood parking garage and in the morning they bring them all back. Valet did manage to add a few very minor scratches to our brand new rental during this process, but not bad enough to be noticed by the rental company. The construction will coat your vehicle with dust, too. (I'd only worry if bringing your own vehicle with you.) This location is great! The Deuce stops right out front. Planet Hollywood is right across the street and has many shops and restaurants. The CVS is located nearby, right after the City Center Construction. All Jockey Club employees were friendly and helpful. There was free internet access available either in the rooms or by using the computers located in the lobby. There is a mini-mart near registration, but be prepared to pay more for the convenience. The bed and couch were quite firm, but the decorations are dated. You probably won't spend much time in the room, so it doesn't really matter. If you are looking for a great location, but nothing fancy, this would be your place. The furnished kitchen was good for making our own breakfast before going out for the day. (One Note: They should change the photo posted on here because this place no longer stands taller than anything around it. The pool area is covered by netting and we did not use it.)

Reviews.Title: “No frills but in the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: just2see
Reviews.Content: We secured our 2 bedroom apartment via a time share exchange. The accommodations were clean and spacious. Although an older property, it was refrurbished a year ago and was quite comfortable. Currently 3 sides of the building have construction going on. The other side faces the Bellagio, Paris and the Las Vegas strip. The staff were all cheerful and good at their jobs. The parking is limited and at times you must park across the street at Planet Hollywood (the old Alladin) and catch a free shuttle back. There is a pool, small work out room and laundry facilities are available on several floors. Very few activities are planned, but then you are in the heart of Vegas. All in all, it was a good experience even without the "glitz" Vegas is known for.

Reviews.Title: “Average lodgings but great location”
Reviews.Author: Western_Family
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed with our 2 children at the Jockey Club for 1 week over July 4th. We exchanged our timeshare through Interval International and checked in the Wednesday before July 4th. The exchange was straightforward, no issues with our check in; the luggage was up to our room within minutes and the valet parking was quick. This hotel has 2 buildings with the pool area in between. As others have said, this hotel is in the midst of a large amount of construction; 2 hotels are being built around the 2 Jockey Club buildings. One of the construction sites (for the Cosmopolitan hotel) has an office on the 2nd floor of back building, the Derby tower. As suggested in other reviews, we asked for a room facing the Bellagio hotel. But being in the back building, the main view from room 754 is of the Bellagio parking structure, so our views of the strip and the Bellagio fountains were only partial. The construction noise is prominent, for us we notice the noise not in the evenings, but the mornings. At 5:30 am every morning (except July 4th and Sunday), a truck came in and dropped off a construction dumpster and the noise began. We also noticed a lot of noise coming from our upstairs neighbor but not from other rooms on our floor. So if you are looking for a peaceful night’s sleep, this is not the hotel for you. The other effect of the construction is the pool covering; a double netting anchored with 4 or 5 very large posts (think a circus big top) and a dust of construction debris litters everything, including the pool water and pool loungers. I think the staff should do a better job of keeping the pool area cleaner and left comments on our review card at check out. The pool tiles were also filthy and the pool looked like it needed to be vacuumed more often. Pool side towels were plentiful and chilled bottled water was provided daily. The pool deck also has a pool table, ping pong table, dart board and kids sized basketball game. All the equipment was available for complementary check out on the first floor on the Ascot Tower in the hospitality room. Free popcorn, coffee and water was also available throughout the day in the hospitality room, along with a wide selection of movies (we only looked at the kids movies) and games available for use. The location of this hotel is perfectly situated on the strip and the small size made getting in and out of the hotel much easier than I would imagine guests of the mega resorts have. Valet parking is mandatory; they say due to the construction. The valets were quick and we only waited a few minutes each time to get our car. Only on July 4th when we came back to the hotel late, did we have to park across the street at the Planet Hollywood hotel parking structure (for no additional fee). A shuttle runs between the Jockey Club and the Planet Hollywood parking structure but stops at Midnight. We came to visit Las Vegas because we were visiting family over July 4th and because we live within driving distance. There is too much sexually explicit advertising for my taste and I was uncomfortable with my children in this situation, so I would not recommend Vegas a family destination (unless you were staying off the strip and did not bring your children to the strip.)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation! Stop Whining About Noise!”
Reviews.Author: FoxxyMama
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's in the middle of a construction site but you are in Vegas - it's one big construction site! We took the advice of some of the other reviews and requested a room facing the Bellagio. Well, not only was it quiet (we occassionally heard a backup signal from a truck - that was about it) but we had front row seats for the Fountain Show at the Bellagio (we just opened our windows a crack to hear the music - it was lovely). We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite. The beds were comfortable, had huge oversized pillows (which I love), fully stocked kitchen (even had those rubber things to help open stuck jars!). The pool is small and is covered in netting. We had full sun the entire time out there but there were areas of shade to hide in when it got super hot. The staff was fantastic. Very friendly and accommodating. I'd go again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away--Far, Far Away”
Reviews.Author: greg1309
Reviews.Content: For the love of God don't stay here. You will be in the middle of a gigantic construction site. You would be better off staying in a cardboard box in the middle of the Las Vegas Strip. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Disatisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: Rochela
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and to get to the room you would have to go through a maze. The room itself can use some updates. The bed was lumpy. The conceirge service was bad. I requested for a cab and they wouldn't make the call. I called the cab myself and he arrived within 15-20 mins. The only thing I can say about this hotel is that it's centrally located...but that's about it. I would NOT recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away If You Like To Sunbathe”
Reviews.Author: billbuster
Reviews.Content: Hi If you like to sunbathe this place is a definate NO NO--- you only have 2-3 hours of sunshine by the pool very early in the morning--The Jockey Club is right in the middle of a vey large construction site which is a real pity as it was such a lovely little home from home in the middle of The Las Vegas Strip. The construction is on going 23hours a day which is not good if you are a light sleep. On th upside the staff are excellent so if you don't like the sun and party all night this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Penthouse located at the center of Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: balboa775
Reviews.Content: hi Beatrice, I want to let you know we had a great time. Everyone was so nice there. The penthouse is very beautiful and comfortable, plenty of rooms, and a lot of amenities. I could not ask for a better location. It's the place to stay if you're in vegas. It's like in the center of gravity where all the action in Las Vegas. Thank you so much. Bernadette

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: lexface2003
Reviews.Content: I booked the 1 bedroom/ 1 bathroom condo timeshare at the Jockey Club through my work. It was only $75 per night and you cant beat that for the location or anything else on the strip or off. The staff was friendly, we were able to borrow movies and they had free popcorn. The condo had a fully equiped kitchen (stove, microwave, sink, coffee maker, fridge, plates, scissors, bottle openers, dish detergent, etc.) The place was really clean and although the color scheme is green, its nice, doesnt look old or worn. We stayed in a room where the maximum occupancy is 4, but there were six of us that stayed comfortably. The place is so large that we were able to put a queen size blow up mattress in the closet and sleep two people in there. The elevators are off the front desk, and entering from the back, they dont even see you as you come and go. Located right next to the Bellagio, its a prime location. The problem is that there is not adequate parking. We had to park at the mall across the street and then get shuttled over. Only one car could park in Valet. Sort of a pain. Also there is construction going on, but its supposed to be completed by December of 2008 (per the shuttle driver). We were honestly so tired, that we barely noticed the construction and it goes off and on for a couple of hours. Its truly not that bad. If you went to Vegas to sleep, you might not want to stay here. But we went to have fun and pass out. Overall, a great value. I dont know that Id pay more than $120 per night for this place though... there's not room service and the parking is a problem. Plus, who even really uses the kitchen. It depends on what you came for. If location is key, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kinderteacher4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jockey Club because our friend had a timeshare type of thing that he was able to use. The value was great! It was very large and slept 8 of us. However, it really needed to be updated. It just did not compare to the other newer hotels. Although, it was in a super location. It is next to the Bellagio. We had a great time, but I would not recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Jockey Club”
Reviews.Author: JRHCalgary
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Jockey and had a horrible experience for 4 long days and nights. At one time years ago it was probably a lovely place in a desireable location. When we booked we were told by RESORT TIME.COM that there was some nearby construction. We stopped a month before we checked in to view the premises that we would be in and found the entire building encircled by the construction of the new civic center. The only open side was toward the Belaggio and this was where numerous trucks and equipment were unloaded and stored etc. -creating lot of activity. We went to the check-in and enquired about cancelling our reservation but they told us that a large portion of our payment was not refundable and as we had paid up front online we were locked in. We asked if there were any quiet rooms and the staff told us no. Then came the shocker - the construction was going on 24/7. We were not told this by RESORT TIME.COM. Basically they misrepresented the facts. We also checked the Jockey Club wesite and there was no mention of 24/7 construction. We had no choice but to try it if we did not want to lose most of our payment. We arrived and spent 4 sleepless nights in a dark, noisey and dingy environment. The staff offered to move us but there were no quiet rooms anywhere so it did not matter. The Jockey Club should be closed until after the construction is done and maybe forever when you see what the new buildings will do to it. There will not be any sunshine anywhere and it will be like living in a cave. WE WILL NEVER STAY IN IT AGAIN. PLEASE DO NOT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE WE MADE. Jan Horejsi

Reviews.Title: “The Strip's Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: KingMJH
Reviews.Content: Five friends and I stayed in the 2-bedroom suite March 14-17. The suite had plenty of space for 6 guys; Walk-in closet, two full bathrooms, 2 double beds in one room, another double bed in the other, plus a full size sofa bed, and plenty of floor space. The room was well appointed, and the staff kept us with plenty of towels, upon request. The toilet in one bathroom did overflow, but the hotel responded to our call immediately, and took good care of it. The full size fridge and full kitchen was a plus. Had plenty of glasses, plates, flatware, etc. And housekeeping does the dishes for you, when you leave them in the sink. The location was excellent; center strip, right in between the Bellagio, and this HUGE development project called City Center, and across the street from Planet Hollywood. Construction noise was never an issue, and it is on both sides of the hotel (we faced the Bellagio side). Getting to the entrance through the hotel driveway was not an issue either. Our limo dropped off us right at the door. All in all, it was a great stay at the Jockey Club. I would definitely stay there again, and would recommend it to anyone else, in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Coolblkcpl
Reviews.Content: Worst experience as far as staying I have ever had. The staff was good but because of the amount of Construction I did not enjoy my stay. I visited from the 3/19-3/23. The staff was not really concerned with my stay after complaining about the amount of noise. No indication that the construction was going on 24 hrs a day. Hosptality person called my room and recommended "earplugs". where is the safety value in that. Overall I would give my stay a 3. Didn't even enjoy the facilities because of the Noise. One good thing was the Bell Staff and the Valets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great Time.”
Reviews.Author: SDSpartan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Jockey Club over New Year's Eve. Had a fantastic time. The room we had was very large (1 bedroom with 2 queen size beds and 1 and 1/2 bathrooms), nicely furnished. Had a dining room - the table was already set including real napkins and wine glasses. A nice kitchen which included coffemaker, toaster, full size refridge, stove/oven, dishwasher and microwave. Everything you could need (and more) was there. The beds were comfortable and had nice pillows. Only "complaint" was I found the bathrooms a bit small. We wondered why since there is a LARGE (and I mean LARGE) walk in closet. I think I've stayed in hotel rooms that were smaller! Also I found the sheets/comforters on the bed could have been nicer with an upgraded to some higher sheet/thread counts and a nice Duvet. The staff was very very helpful, friendly and effecient. We were told that there is construction going on around the JC - 3 of the sides actually - we never heard it which was great. Maybe because of the Holiday? Anyway, you cannot park on site - it is all Valet. Which was fine with us and no problems and no big waits. The best part of the JC is the awesome strip location - it is right on Las Vegas Blvd - right next to the Bellagio. We had easy and close access to the strip for the NYE celebration - what fun. You are also right across the street from the Planet Hollywood resort that has many stores and restaurants. Overall, we were very impressed with the JC and are already planning on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Keywest3ja
Reviews.Content: Rented a timeshare here for the NASCAR races. It's location is great - right on the strip next to the Bellagio - and I found the rooms (we had a two bedroom suite) clean and well laid out. The biggest drawback is the construction. Depending on where your room is located - the exception is the Bellagio side - you may be facing the construction of towers that will dwarf the Jockey Club once completed. With the construction comes some noise. Our suite faced the Bellagio side; I didn't find the noise to be a challenge, but the two light sleepers in our group found they needed earplugs to sleep (the construction is 24 hrs/day). With that said, I would stay there again and face any direction, as the location, comfort, and service level outweighed by far the inconvenience of the construction.

Reviews.Title: “CLEANEST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: the_smile
Reviews.Content: I came to experience Las Vegas after I turned 21 summer/2007. My friends and I stayed at the Jockey Club, not knowing what to expect. There was a lot of construction underway onsite during our stay that changed the swimming pool and fitness center hours to a rotten 6am-6pm. I know this had nothing to do with the quality of hotel service or anything, just bad timing. I was really looking forward to that 24 hour pool! One downside is that each day it seemed like we were missing something from our room. Stuff like expensive denim jeans and other personal items came up missing in the end. There is no one to blame, but i don't think it's a coincidence that we all were missing our pants! The lost and found staff was helpfull, but really didn't help much as there was nothing they could do. Oh well, go to Vegas, lose your trousers right? However, The Jockey Club is probably the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed at. We exhausted the facillities and I was impressed at how spotless everything was kept. The Pool, laundry room, lobby, movie room, lost and found room, elevators, restrooms, long wierd hallways that lead somewhere (?) were all so fresh and clean! THANK YOU!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Brats
Reviews.Content: This was a TIME SHARE exchange You cannot compare The Jockey Club to the Venetian,Bellagio,or Caesars. This is a wonderful location right next to the Bellagio ----Monte Carlo BE AWARE there is enormous construction work happening @ this location You cannot drive up to the entrance,because of construction But remember Bellagio is one side and Monte Carlo is on the other so they nearly have the same problem but on one side, having said that ........Reception is perfect smiling helpful faces our 1 bed suite was on the 11th floor Penthouse we had the scaffolding touching the window but we slept every morning until 10am with no problem This is perfect for more than 2 people because of the size of the suites There is everything you need full kitchen Living area, Dining area Bedroom ,TINY BATHROOM but HUGE WALK-IN Closet??? Fantastic Pillows (bought 2) We went to the Jockey Club because we needed to use our Time Share & but we were only a couple This is a perfect place for families or larger parties There is a small Mini Mart only good for pop & Chips ,Milk,ABC is opposite but just as expensive.We went to 4 Buffets Great reasonable Restaurants opposite @ Planet Hollywood PH Buffet is Great well worth a visit ----Amazing Crabs Legs Split for you ( Our rating 2nd) Bellagio Buffet was fantastic (1st) Attentive Staff,Great Atmosphere, Harrahs Buffet(3rd) it Good Staff ,Cafeteria Atmosphere it is fantastic GREAT BEEF you can get a coupon price from the Ticket Office @ MGM or Hawain Market it will cost you $16 instead of $24-----Amazing Desserts *** Rio Buffet (4th Enourmous Buffet, Huge to many stations, again you can get a coupon same place--------No complaints Staff not very attentive venue pretty dated

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Jockey Club”
Reviews.Author: honeybeartoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week and loved the place. Was our first time to stay there and was concerned about the noise, but it was not a problem. We stayed on 4th floor of Derby Tower. There was some noise occasionally but nothing that would keep you awake. Room was clean and updated. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Personal, comprehensive review of the Penthouse suite @the Jockey Club”
Reviews.Author: tt083072
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends & I stayed @the Jockey Club for Veteran's Day weekend (Nov. 9-12) and had the MOST FABULOUS time!!! We booked a 2 bdrm/2 bath penthouse suite thru lasvegasrental.org, and for 5 girls, there was plenty of room for everyone. The things I liked: 1. CLEANLINESS - It was clean and the furniture/decor seemed updated. Even the bathrooms looked like they were recently remodeled. 2. THE VIEW - We had a direct view of the Bellagio water show everyday and everynight. From the master bedroom, since it was a corner unit with all windows, we had both a view of the Bellagio water show as well as the Vegas strip. We truly felt like "high rollers" w/out the empty pockets! 3. PRIVACY - There is a one-time cleaning fee, and you don't get the daily maid service like you would in the hotels; but I thought that was better since we were only there for 3 nights. We could leave our personal, valuable belongings exposed w/out worry that there would be strangers going through our rooms. 6. AMENITIES - The kitchen was fully stocked from dishwashing liquid, plateware/silverware, wine bottle opener, to extra plastic bags. The bathroom was fully stocked w/more than enough towels and Bath & Body soaps, lotions, shampoos & conditioners. We had 5 girls who each took showers everyday and went through a new towel each time, yet there were still new, unused towels leftover by the time we checked out. 6. PARKING - Free valet parking all day everyday. Not to mention, the valet guys were all very professional, sincere, and quick to get your car. The service was 5 star!!! 7. LOCATION - Right off the strip, next to Bellagio, across from the mall... everything you need is within walking distance... what more could 5 girls ask for? Problems... I didn't really see any problems that were intolerable. I do understand the other reviews and their complaints about the noise & construction, and it's true that there is some huge billion $ project being built around the hotel, but there's construction everywhere in Vegas right about now. It did look like a war zone around the hotel as you pull into the front lobby, but don't be so quick to judge. During the 4 days we stayed there (Fri-Mon), I was never bothered by the noise or construction. Not to say that I didn't hear anything, I did! But the noise was not anything so big that turning on the volume of the TV or CD couldn't fix. In fact, every night I slept with one window in the livingroom open, and had no issues falling asleep or staying asleep. Granted, we partied every night we were there, but... isn't that WHY you would go to Vegas in the first place??? Perhaps most of the complaints are coming from those who stayed in rooms that were not on the Bellagio side of the building. I do believe there was more construction going on at the opposite side of where we stayed. We also stayed in a penthouse suite on the 11th floor, which I believe is their top most floor, so the location was well above and farther away from the construction noise. All in all, ABSOLUTELY I would stay there again, but I would ONLY book a penthouse suite on the Bellagio side since my experience was positive with them. I would suggest that if you plan to stay here, ask whoever you are booking through to be honest with you about the situation with the construction. Ask them which floor you'll be on, which side of the building is your room, and whether there are any cranes and construction obstructing your view. If you can book the penthouse on the 11th floor, that's going to be your best bet :)

Reviews.Title: “Don't rule out the Jockey Club!”
Reviews.Author: LUVSTOGO
Reviews.Content: I feel the need to add my two cents worth on the Jockey Club. I stayed at the Jockey Club Oct 26 through 29, 2007 (we were three retired ladies, all with extensive travel experience). Given a number of reviews, we were somewhat concerned about the construction issue, and while in the throes of decision making, I spoke directly to a lady at the JC and staff at the Las Vegas Tourist Bureau. The people I spoke to were quite open about the issue and the potential for noise, but also pointed out that individual experiences have apparently been quite different, with some happy customers and some unhappy. Because our priorities were location, convenience (having kitchen facilites so we could breakfast in), and space (three in a room, and not wanting to be tripping over one another), we decided to take a chance (we were going to Vegas, after all!). We booked through the LVTB. We were in Room 1018, right beside the elevator, and facing the construction and the Monte Carlo Hotel. Rooms on the north side, where we had hoped to be, face the fountains at Bellagio. While our view was not impressive ( a number of buildings going up, and I counted over forty porta-potties, which was pretty exciting!), never once were we bothered by noise. Heavy equipment was operating below us, cranes were moving stuff, and men were laying steel below and to the right of our room. We heard the occasional banging (once that I remember) and a few beeps, but honestly, nothing bothersome.There was no work except at ground level from late Saturday pm until Monday morning. Having said all of this, it was not difficult to see that if we had been in a different room, at a different time, the noise could have been a real issue. The suite itself was spacious (large bedroom with two queen beds, double walk-in closet and full bath off bedroom, another closet and half bath off hallway, large livingroom with queen hide-a-bed, dining set, and fully equipped kitchen. It was not luxurious, but had been recently refurbished, and was clean and comfortable. Beds were great, pillows were awesome, hide-a-bed was OK. Housekeeping was OK (we didn't require much); we had lots of towels, etc.; coffee and tea were supplied. Front desk staff were pleasant and helpful, and our one and only wake-up call came right on time. Location was perfect - right beside Bellagio, across from Planet Hollywood, close to the street, with a bus stop right in front (we used the Deuce bus every day). Several times one or the other of us returned to the JC alone late at night, and felt safe doing so (lots of foot traffic, decent lighting, always staff at the side entrance, etc). The little market on the ground floor was pricey, but had more variety than the ABC store in the mall across the street (where prices were similar), and suited our needs. There was no safe in the suite, but they have bank style safety deposit boxes at the front desk -- accessible 24 hours, and very secure. Luggage storage (checkout was at 11:00, but we had a late flight) was also convenient and secure. All in all, our experience with the JC was great. Our gamble on accomodations paid off - unlike the slot machines!

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay There Again-With Earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: rock2u
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying there. I'd stay there again in a second Be prepared though, the Jockey Club has almost nothing you'd want in a Vegas hotel. However, it has a great location and the rooms are big and well-supplied and it's cheap and available in a pinch. If you are with your wife or a fussy friend- they will complain about the construction and dumpy hallways. But when you get to your room it's a pleasant, 1972decorated apartment setting. If you want to sleep- BRING EARPLUGS.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck.”
Reviews.Author: klmsdsu
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and as mentioned in the previous posts the construction SUCKS! We arrived at 1 am to the sound of jack hammering and bull dozers and it went on all day and night. The hotel has sold every inch of property all the way around it and the construction is supposed to take 2-3 years from what we were told. Not sure if they stop for the weekend, but it did seem to be somewhat quieter during the weekend hours.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of a building site”
Reviews.Author: philpics
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of 9 in 2, two bedroom appartments. Very well furnished, big, with every extra for a comfortable stay ( and self catering). We asked for a view of the 'strip' and got a view of the building site with the constant 'beep beep' of vehicles reversing 24/7. Did the job for one night, but recommend you avoid it whilst construction is in progress.

Reviews.Title: “Surrounded by construction!”
Reviews.Author: Traveljunkie123
Reviews.Content: We had our family reunion this year in Vegas and based on a previous stay at The Jockey Club decided to stay here again. You can't beat the location, right on the Strip next to The Bellagio and across from Planet Hollywood (formerlly The Aladdin) and in the past it's been a great place to stay, BUT...where once there was a parking lot and an empty lot is now being transformed into a new resort and casino. The Jockey Club is literally surrounded by the new resort and the construction proves it! The good: Location, valet parking is offered for guests as there is no longer parking on-site, staff are very helpful (and probably a bit embarrassed by all the activity surrounding the hotel), no nonsense nice place to stay while in Vegas. The bad: You are surrounded by construction! We stayed in room 608, a two bedroom/two bath, and could have reached out the master bedroom window and high-fived the construction workers. Yes, they really were that close. Construction (jack hammers, welding, etc.) starts at 6am on all days except Sunday. Over this past weekend (Oct 20-21) they were pouring cement 24/7. Granted, when we meet in Vegas it's to have fun and not relax in our room but after a night of fun and rolling in at all hours, being jolted awake at 6am was not ideal. The pool is heated and, based on past experiences, is a nice place to spend a few hours. Now a large tarp covers the pool area to prevent any construction materials from falling into it or on you! Eak! I chose not to swim this time around... All in all...if you're heading to Vegas to party round the clock and you just need a place to crash before you head out the next day, then this might be ok for you. If you're heading to Vegas to play a bit and relax a bit and want to spend some time in your room, then I wouldn't recommend staying here until the construction is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Stay”
Reviews.Author: Horse25
Reviews.Content: Jockey Club Penthouse (#1176). Construction on all night long. Renter lied about the level of construction activity. I was expecting some construction, not to be surrounded by it. No one in our group was able to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “What a bargain for the location!”
Reviews.Author: Vegasfan26
Reviews.Content: Although the construction noise was a bit of a pain, who is supposed to sleep in Vegas anyhow? Staying at Jockey Club just a very short distance from Bellagio was great. A condo instead of a Bellagio hotel room for 25% of the price. I'll take the noise. When the Cosmospolitian is finished on the other side, their rooms will probably be more than Bellagio. I'lll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Horrible Place......For Insomniacs only”
Reviews.Author: RoadrunnersNB
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed with relatives who have time share, at the Jockey Club… I can only say it was a very horrible experience… Upon arrival, you couldn’t check in until 4:00 pm… (at least they stored our luggage until then)…. The walk between elevators to get to your rooms was long and physically challenging… the carpet on the stairs was worn and revealed old carpet underneath. The pool area was completely covered with netting, in case of fallen debris from the construction next door… Unfortunately that did nothing for the small partials of white debris falling from the top of the building site into the pool area… Needless to say we didn’t use the pool.. The rooms were clean and the bed felt comfortable… If you could sleep… The construction next door was 24-7...All day and All night…….Jack hammers, Cement trucks and other loud construction equipment was continuous… We even made several attempts to sleep on the pull out sofa bed, close the doors to the main bedroom… However, if you were able to get a few hours of asleep.. you were continuosly waken with sudden loud noises over and over…We were tired all day and all night….No other accommodations were available and we couldn’t wait to leave. We have visited Las Vegas on numerous occasions and stayed at many locations…this was the worse lodging accommodations we have ever had… Our family who had the timeshare was so embarrassed that they continuously apologized for our location….and the horrible noises, lack of sleep…according to them they will never stay at the Jockey Club again…. Do yourself a favor…. Stay anywhere else than the Jockey club, you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Love where is located- Hate the location”
Reviews.Author: olgalee
Reviews.Content: The location, next to Bellagio is great and having an apartment not just a room is very nice. However all around is a big construction site. The noise is starting at 6 AM and is very noticeable. The taxies are not stopping for pick up at the hotel/condo and you need to walk 5-10min to the next hotel to pick one up (or wait forever on the street). The staff is not very accommodating. The unit we stay was OK. Our friends have an old 2 bedroom unit with stained carpet. One day somebody from the staff tried to use the paging system for some announcement and the noise was on for 15 minutes. No apology for the misuse. The Ascot tower we stayed in is under renovation so on top of walking outside in construction zone you also need to go a long way through inside construction, since the main entrance to Ascot Tower is closed. We did not experience the awful inside noise that some others complained because at 6AM some bathroom units were in renovation. We were waiting for our luggage that were stored for 20 minutes (no apology) and we were told to get them ourselves from storage with no communication to the guy in charge- so we wasted other 5 min trying to get approvals. Good thinks we left with plenty of time for the airport. Maybe when all the construction will be completed (1 or 2 years) it will be a nice place. I will recommend for now for people that are not disturbed by noise, dust and luck of service.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: Timesharetraveler_7
Reviews.Content: We booked the Jock Club through a Time Share excange thinking it would be a good deal (we had two other friends with us and usually get nice accommodations via the Time Share. Well, this place is the absolute pits! An old hotel that's been partially converted to time share, it faces the Bellagio's parking lot on one side and 24 hour/day construction on the other -- complete with round the clock pile driving! The mattresses on the beds are shot. And forget the kitchen -- unless you have a car there is no place nearby to get food -- other than the minimart in the hotel -- which charges an arm and a leg -- a small container of instant coffee is $8. It can also be a long walk from parts of the building to the other wing. In short, this was by far the worst place we ever stayed in Las Vegas or anywhere (we've been to Las Vegas a half-dozen times before). It was an embarrassment to have invited friends along to stay with us in this "time share". Would never do this again! Do yourself a favor and stay in one of the regular casino hotels. It may cost a little more, but you'll be close to the action and in a nice place. This place should not be even listed in the time share exchnage program! (Oh yea -- an don't plan on checking in early. They will not give you anything before 4:00pm!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic stay.”
Reviews.Author: arttoreality
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend and a few friends. The penthouse was great. Great location. Was worried about construction, but it wasn't bothersome at all.

Reviews.Title: “Noise in the extreme even with earplugs”
Reviews.Author: pounamu
Reviews.Content: Funnily enough I booked this hotel because as a non-gaming hotel I thought it would be quieter. Not at all. It was so loud there it was like being on the building site. We asked if we could change rooms but were told that because we'd booked through Expedia the only rooms available were on the noisy side of the building. We'd paid so we would have had to go somewhere else and pay again and we had driven a long way. The heavy construction equipment was very close and kept going in the evening and started again at 5am. It was so noisy we couldn't use the bedroom and slept on the fold-out couch and used earplugs. The staff and rooms were nice but because of the noise a very unenjoyable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location but lots of construction!”
Reviews.Author: michelleleea2
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Las Vegas....and we are already planning the next! We got the Jockey Club through an exchange with our timeshare. It was the only resort available at the time we could go. We were told that there would be some construction going on...and boy they were right. The suite we had was not on the Bellagio side, so the view from our room looked a bit like "Ground Zero". We stayed on a labor day weekend so we didnt hear any of the constuction going on for the first few days. On the 4th day, the day we left, we did hear construction starting at 4 in the morning...which didnt bother us much because of the time change (7am New York time) we were pretty much awake. Hubby was able to sleep in a bit longer, though, before we had to be up for an 8am transfer to the airport. Because of its location I would definately recommend the Jockey Club. It is centrally located. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Even though the suite was dated, it was very clean and adequate. If you come to Vegas and live it up as we did...You won't be bothered by construction because you will be too tired for it to matter.

Reviews.Title: “It's a building site!”
Reviews.Author: Ceeceelia
Reviews.Content: It may have been an ideally situated place once upon a time but it's literally in the middle of a building site now. I know work has to be carried out but this is horrendous. There's a 9 billion dollar construction being built which will take until 2009 to complete and the Jockey Club is slap bang in the middle of it all. We had a room facing the Bellagio but couldn't see it for cranes. They start up at 4am and for 3 nights we put up with the most unbelievable noise from a mechanical hammer outside the window (& we were on the 9th floor). I was feeling ill from lack of sleep so my husband requested a move. We were given a room in the main tower (there are 2 towers, Ascot & Derby) which was better but the hammer moved along the building and we heard it again from 6am. We spent the last 3 nights sleeping on the sofa bed with cotton wool in our ears so that we could close the doors on the bedroom and try to get some peace. The pool? It's covered by 2 nets to prevent anything falling from the site and everything's covered in a layer of dust. The corridors inside are being decorated too. I have to say the rooms are fine, well equipped and comfotable but I went for location and wish I'd stayed elsewhere. The car park fills up so if you don't get back before then you have to park in Planet Hollywood across the road and there's a shuttle back.........very inconvenient. We used the Bellagio car park a couple of times and walked back. We have had timeshare for 20 years but we couldn't find anywhere available do booked this as a rental but I'm glad we hadn't used a week for this. It's a shame though, it's hardly their fault that this is happening around them but it's not what you need on holiday is it?.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Us”
Reviews.Author: jwin7831
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze, no huge lines like at the casinos. Condo was CLEAN. Furniture adequate--King bed seemed new-firm and comfortable. Loved the double doors dividing bedroom and living room/kitchen area. Had absolutely everything we needed. Construction around area was ongoing though we had absolutely no trouble with noise. Front doors of the hotel were closed off and had to enter through the back. Walk to the strip was really short, however, at night it would make you hesitant to walk alone. I didn't see any type of security. Cabs would drop you off, but not pick you up at the hotel due to the construction. Jockey Club did provide a shuttle (no waiting-just hop in) that took you across the street to Planet Hollywood where you could catch a cab. All in all it was a very good experience and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but find somewhere else !!”
Reviews.Author: AnyVenue
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, fabulous place, the bit they don't tell you is the construction work going on all around you. Don't get me wrong the rooms are great, sofa, kitchen all amenities including dishwasher except laundry, that's downstairs, walk in wardrobe huge space and from our room a view of the Bellagio fountains. Sadly also a view of a core driller machine right outside the hotel. The neighbours are building something huge and surrounding the premises on all sides. One whole wing of the premises look out onto a multi level car park possibly only 20ft away at eye level, on all levels! and the core driller was in action from 0400 am. Many think this disruption is a deliberate attempt to upset Jockey club residents, destroying business, many guests were voting with their feet, me, I was there for only 3 nights ear plugs worked, any longer & we would have walked too. Sorry but I think its a gem thats not long for this world and perhaps somewhere else, perhaps not so good on amenities, but better for sleep would be better suited for restful stay, oh & pool is V poor, unless you like construction noise, dirty water & a glimpse of the sun between buildings....good luck.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ScottCalgary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jockey Club in early July and found that yes there is a lot of construction going on around the hotel. I had phoned ahead and asked for a room on the Bellagio side and that request was granted. We heard very minimal noise in our room. We had a two bedroom apartment on the ninth floor and it was clean and large enough for five. The kitchen was great for breakfasts. The location can not be beat as you are in the center of all the action on the strip. The bus stop is just outside the door and valet parking was available at the hotel, but be careful as some nights the parking became full. We enjoyed our stay and would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “was staying at hotel next to it”
Reviews.Author: bones0314
Reviews.Content: sorry to inform you all who are stopping at or near to the jockey club but there is a hell of a lot of construction happening here at least 3 sides of the hotel has construction going on around it (new condos being built ) starts early still there in late evening

Reviews.Title: “A Refuge in the middle of Sin City”
Reviews.Author: JMcLauchlin
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Really loved Las Vegas and all of its excitement, but when I needed to take a break, the Jockey Club offered an outstanding refuge. Jockey Club has a friendly staff, great location at a reasonable price. No gambling at the Jockey Club. You can check out movies, visit the pool, Sauna or the exercise room. (free of charge) If it is gambling and excitement that you love, you are right in the center of everything. I would recommend it. In fact, we plan to return to Vegas next Summer and my wife said it has to be the Jockey Club. Some construction was taking place as it is everywhere in Vegas. We were on the opposite side so we were not bothered by the sounds. We could lie in our beds and watch the waters of the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: davism24
Reviews.Content: I own a timeshare weeks and got to finally take one of my weeks in Las Vegas and I'm so glad I stayed at the Jockey Club although their were some negative comments about the place I was a bit leary and since I booked a year in advanced demanded the best room available. I was placed on the penthouse floor with a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains daily and nightly. I absolutely loved it. The suite was clean and great! Nice size closet and TV/dvd in both rooms plus library to borrow dvds along with conciere for shows and tours. The location is perfect. Jockey Club should not give up their location for nothing in the world. It centrally located on the strip next to bellagio and the new grand mgm center mall (currently being built so yes ask for earplugs if you don't want to be awaken too early in the morning) Yes, but no big deal your in Vegas and not in the room that much anyway. When there it is not that annoying atleast not on Northside of building. I was told all rooms are the same throughout the resort. I loved that I could exercise or swim or chill in the hot tub at anytime. Location is everything - This resort is across from Paris and Alladin. If you own a timeshare it may not have the private jacuzzi tub, you may be use to but this place is as nice as any other resort and definitely worth it since you are on the strip. Most others are off the strip somewhere that most people who wants to be in the action of it all can't immediately join. When you see people say that it back off the strip by half a block that's pretty normal for most hotels on the strip. I choose to go in one direction on one side of the street one day and the opposite direction on one side of the street on the next day. So it was great that I didn't tire myself out by walking the whole strip on one side. it really is in the middle of the strip, but take the charlie to Stratosphere and downtown. it also has a store right inside club along with shuttle bus to real grocery store twice a week. If other family attends, they can enjoy the separate living room sleeper sofa and full kitchen and dining area. I look forward to staying in the future. Special Thanks to front desk manager very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, otherwise get what you pay for.....”
Reviews.Author: BigLebow
Reviews.Content: I found the Jockey Club on vrbo.com. We stayed here April 18th - 21st for a wedding that was held at the Belagio. We had six people comfortably in a Penthouse suite and paid an average of $62 per night. Given what we paid, the accomodations were fine. The location is great as we were back and forth to the Belagio quite a bit. It's Vegas so you're never in your room anyway and the option of cooking in was nice and probably saved us $120 at least one night. We were on the construction side for Center city or City center or whatever it's called but it was never really an issue. Generally, we rolled in at 4 or 5 a.m. All in all, the cheapest part of my trip by far. If you don't drop the $ on lodging you'll drop it elsewhere and personally, I'd rather drop it elsewhere. But if you're looking for a high end room, suggest looking elsewhere or be more discriminate about which unit you get (ie ask if it's been updated lately)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: 1travelerfornow
Reviews.Content: We own a timeshare in California and needed to exchange our week for one in Las Vegas, Nevada. Although I had read some rather disturbing comments regarding the Jockey Club, we decided to stay there because the location was near Bally's where our child was attending a dance competition. Our experience was "great". From the time we arrived until the day we left, everyone was very helpfull. Especially the men who provided valet service! They were very courteous.......even when we requested our car several times during the course of one day! We are used to staying in bungalo units and not hotel rooms, so I was rather skeptical of staying in a hotel setting. We were assigned to a 2 bedroom on the 10th floor. The rooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable. We needed handicap amenities which were promptly provided. The view was great. We enjoyed the water fountain show of the Bellagio every evening without having to go outside. Although there is construction going on next door, we were not disturbed by it. I guess that was because we had requested rooms away from the construction site. All in all, our experience was enjoyable and I would not hesitate to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Jockey Club- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BodynSoul
Reviews.Content: We booked a penthouse suite in the second tower over Memorial Day weekend. The pool was a little small and has no life guard, it is surrounded by a child proof fence (not very attractive to the eye). Next to the pool is a small, but useful gym with some cardio equipment, a few machines, and dumbells. There was also a decent sized jacuzzi. The rooms were clean and spacious. In the hall, the drop ceiling gives the place a cheap look, but nothing that would affect my decision to stay again. The suite came with a fully equipped kitchen. There was no construction noise over the weekend, but it is definitely still in construction. It is a nice place to stay for someone who is not looking to party at the pool. The best thing about the hotel is that is in the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay at the Jockey Club”
Reviews.Author: travelerArkansas
Reviews.Content: I traded timeshare for stay at the Jockey Club. The stay was April 9th 2007. I was warned about the construction and the noise but chose to stay there anyway because of the location. The stay was very nice we had no problems with the construction noise. We were on the 10th floor in the Derby Tower. I was traveling with my 21 year old granddaughter and her friend. I would stay there again if I go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at the Jockey Club”
Reviews.Author: anskyone
Reviews.Content: I found the location great, but that was about all. There is 24/7 consturction for the neighboring Cosmopolitan Hotel next door going on likely until 2009. Our room was ghost-booked on Expedia via the Las Vegas Tourism Bureau, so when on the first night there was continual light and construction noise the front desk could do nothing. The front desk relayed that they tell everyone who books direct about the construction, but I had no notification of such. The rooms on the Bellagio side might be ok, however our room was a cheesy 70's style room, and not one of the upgraded ones that might be nicer. There was even duct tape holding the corner of the rug, only dial-up internet access and the list goes on. The Las Vegas Tourism Bureau did not have any other rooms available so we were stuck with this nightmare. We got only a few hours of sleep every night. Whatever you do is if you stay here, go in eyes wide open!!!

Reviews.Title: “jockey”
Reviews.Author: BettyL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jockey club the week of March 25, 2007 through a timeshare. I was a bit skeptical about this place based on the reviews of all the construction happening. There are two towers which are the Ascot Tower (closer to Las Vegas Blvd.) and the Derby Tower which is west of the Ascot Tower. They are connected by a hallway on the 2nd floor. You check in on the first floor and if you have a room in the Derby tower you have to take an elevator to go to the second floor and then walk through the hallway. Along the hallway in the second floor you cross the pool and fitness area on the west side. The only problem is if you have children in strollers as I did, it was not good going up the stairs after you pass the pool area to go to the elevators on the Derby tower. A few days before (knowing there was noise), I called and requested a room in the upper floor to avoid the noise. To my surprise Yvonne placed us in the Derby tower Room 952 facing the Bellagio side. I thought we're lucky to have a nice view and hopefully no noise! Wrong! Around 8:30 pm. (the time my two boys ages 2 and 1 were already asleep) construction workers started the construction in the parking lot area. It was OK but at times rather loud even on the 9th floor. Then the next morning around 10 o'clock they started working on the condo next door. They took everything out (kitchen cabinets, rug...) and that was noisy so we just left for the day. I guess this place is owned by private owners as well so they were doing some upgrading. Location was great! You can just walk down the strip. It was nice to have a kitchen area. They have valet parking only. They have DSL service on the first floor of every tower. You can visit the hospitality room and have some free popcorn, coffee, two free movie rentals and board games to check out. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I have no complaints besides the noise factor. I guess it's unavoidable!?@ They are doing construction on the North side (parking lot), South Side (whole new hotel I think it's Trump Towers) and across at the Aladdin. Overall, it was great even with the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great, Not Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Tweetypie96
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Jockey Club (March 30-April 4) with 4 girlfriends - our annual "Ladies Trip To The Desert". We have previously stayed at other timeshares off the strip, as well as the Stratosphere, and this year decided to be a little "closer" to the action and hustle of the Las Vegas Strip. But it sits back off the street and has a narrow driveway leading up to it. Even the signage is difficult to see from the strip and is easy to miss. There is a fenced sidewalk for those walking, I guess so you don't walk on the driveway and run the risk of getting run over. There is a shuttle bus, and I do not know if it goes anywhere besides the Aladdin. Every time we asked for a ride, we were told the bus only goes to the Aladdin (which is across the street, and under construction itselft to become a Planet Hollywood). The Jockey consists of 2 buildings connected by a center passageway. They have a pool, exercise room, hot tub, and even free computers (when checking email is a must). We stayed in the 2nd building farthest from the street, and although on the 8th floor, it was difficult to see the Bellagio water show that others have commented on. Parking is valet only, and the valet post is at the first building - meaning you have to get out and walk up a hill to the 2nd building. Not so great when in heels and your feet are throbing! Overall, the room was decent. For 5 women, we were each able to carve out a little space for luggage and things. We did venture to a Super Wal-Mart to purchase food for cooking - gotta save money whenever possible. We are not big on staying in a room all day, as we like to hang out, gamble, and shop (not in that order), so overall we were pleased with the overall appearance of the room. We did read from previous posts that there was construction on one side, so we were sure to ask for a room on the Bellagio side. What we were not informed of is that there is construction going on within the hotel, and they were renovating the room directly above us. Not a problem, except they started working at 7:30 in the morning. This occured twice, and although we complained, nothing was done. I am sure they were not sold out, so why they would give us a room below one that is under construction is beyond me. It literally sounded like the ceiling was going to cave in on top of us - that's how loud they were. We were miserable and pissed - not a good combination for 5 women trying to vacation. We like the kitchen aspect and are looking to stay at another time share property on the strip for next year that also has a kitchen, but will not be staying at the Jockey again.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, but won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: empirenine
Reviews.Content: I'll start with my demographics. I'm 25, drive an Audi, and I am self-employed. I live in San Diego. My stay at Jockey Club was for a bachelor party. The bachelorette party stayed at Signature at MGM, which is what I base my opinion of Jockey Club on. AREA: To start, Jockey club is about 100 yards off the strip, directly south of Bellagio. The drive way into the place is hard to deal with. 2 cab drivers told us they didn't know if they could get there, and 2 others told us they didn't even know where it was. One driver offered to drop us at Bellagio, which is about a 300 yard walk to Jockey Club. HOTEL/LOBBY: The lobby is in one tower and our room was in another. Navigating from the lobby to our room was challenging even with a map. Valet service was decent, and I found nothing wrong with my car after a weekend. ROOM: The room was acceptably large, had an old fridge, stove, cupboards, etc. There were a few holes in the carpet and some stains, but not too bad. There was an L shaped couch in the living area, which was large enough to sleep 2 if necessary. The room was completely free of smoke smell which was probably the most appealing part of it. It also had a huge walk-in closet which could come in handy for a longer stay, or for sleeping another 2 people (I'm talking to the college party people). Our room on the 9th floor was one that looked over the Bellagio fountains, but there are trees blocking most of the show from that vantage point. The fountains actually reached higher than our room at some points, which was pretty cool. Otherwise, the view was nothing special. BATHROOM: The shower had very little pressure and a slightly grimmy tub. The non-slip strips were coming unglued, but thats not a biggie. OVERALL ==================== PROS: Big room, big closet, large couch. Nice to have a fridge. Would be good for college party people with large groups (there were even extra blankets and pillows in the closet). Comfy couch for sleeping (not sure if it was pull out). CONS: Akwardly located and positioned, lobby is miles from some rooms. Small TV. A/C was loud. Not even CLOSE to as nice as Signature at MGM. CONCLUSION: If you are considering staying at Jockey Club, really, look into Signature at MGM first. We could have stayed at either place for the same price (about $200 a night), but we chose wrong. I will likely stay at Signature every time I visit Vegas...its that nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: KittyJul
Reviews.Content: I exchanged my timeshare to stay at the Jockey Club. I was not disapointed in any way. The one bedrooms are huge and clean. The staff is helpful and quick with any request and you can't beat the location. I will stay there again! Juliana - Miami FL

Reviews.Title: “No Problems Here, Plus a Real Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Maihridh
Reviews.Content: After reading all the caveats, I was nervous about booking the Jockey Club. But the prices or the availability of rooms right in the heart of the strip led me to take the chance. I certainly was glad I did! The company was running a special of $216 for Saturday, Sunday, and Monday nights--TOTAL!!! Now folks, that was going to be the cost of one night at the neighbors, if you could get the days you wanted. Yes, there is construction going on right next door, and our view looking down was a very interesting major hole the size of my little home town. We were on the sixth floor facing the construction. To our surprise, though, the construction was closed for the weekend. They started up late Sunday evening, but the noise was minimal. I am a light sleeper and it certainly didn't bother me. With a little white noise from the air conditioner, I slept like a baby. And the view? Well, at night laying in the bed, our view was that gorgeous Vegas neon! MGM Grand green, Polo Towers purple, and all the reds and yellows down on the street. It was beautiful! True, the entrance to the Jockey Club is not all fancied up right now. But the walkway to the entrance from the street is easy to find, fenced off from the drive, clean, and very, very well lit at night. There is a shuttle stop right at the end of the walk.
