True, the regular units are not over-large. We had a king-size bed with double doors to close it off from the living room/kitchen, unit 624 in the Ascot tower. The furnishings were all clean and very well-maintained. The carpet was quite clean and not at all worn. The kitchen had everything you expect, and the lovely dining area was set and ready for a meal. We like very much to fix our own coffee and a little breakfast, and to have snacks or light meals in the room instead of having to eat out every time we get a little hungry. This was perfect. Granted, the unit wasn't huge, but it certainly suited our needs. If you had a couple of kids with you, sleeping on the sleeper sofa, I think there would still be enough space that it would be okay--two TV's, games and movies available in the hospitality room, and so on. A nice service the JC offers is a shuttle from there across the street to the Aladdin taxi station. Instead of calling a taxi when we went to dinner/show, we took the shuttle and got a taxi from there. Same for the airport, only we took an airport shuttle from there instead of a taxi. Now, the Aladdin is just across the street, but believe me, you don't want to be wagging your luggage through 4 or 6 lanes of traffic, :-). We were always able to get the shuttle within a few minutes, and the folks working that area were very helpful. Yes, we could have called a taxi to come to the JC, but it would have taken at least 30 minutes, and it was really easy to take the shuttle across the street. The mini-mart downstairs was just that--a mini-mart. The prices were higher than you would find in a regular grocery, but come on, what do you expect? If you are staying a week, there is a grocery shuttle. Everything we bought was current, and Lupe at the check-out was a font of information. The bed was scrumptious! I have stayed in some very high-end places that didn't have a bed half a comfy. And it must be nearly new. If you have to have a casino within a minute of your room, this is not the place for you. The closest good-ole-boy casino is the Barbary Coast on the corner of the block. Of course the Bellagio is right next door, but it isn't one of those quickie drop a few coins in the slots kind of place. (By the way, the Barbary Coast has $5 craps tables during the daytime.) Real Plus: Non-smoking building; fantastic pillow-top bed and nice linens; lots of towels; walk-in closet; very helpful and friendly staff; computer/printer access; public areas clean and well-maintained; fast elevators; no casino to schlep your bags through; very private feeling; good central climate control system; responsive house-keeping staff; did I mention NON-SMOKING building; spang dab in the middle of the strip, right next to the Bellagio. Real Minus: I've got to say it, the bathroom vanity is just too small; no view from the living room, only the bedroom; I can't think of any others. Would I stay there again--in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great view!”
Reviews.Author: constantadventure
Reviews.Content: We were skeptical because of some of the reviews, but we had a 1 bedroom unit on the 9th floor with a great view of the Bellagio fountains and the rest of the Vegas strip and the mountains on that side of the hotel. From our room, we almost never heard construction, and if we did it didn't bother us much, and we had an excellent stay! The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was clean and comfortable. From our room, we could watch the fountain ballet, and if we opened the window, we could hear the music as well! The pool was warm and open 24 hours as was the fitness area. The Jockey Club was in a great location near everything including the bus that got us to attractions it wasn't near. It was 1 block to Walgreens and CVS, so we didn't buy anything in the mini-mart in the building (which had higher prices). It was also only a couple of blocks to the places with half price show tickets - Half Price Tickets and Tickets2nite. We would definitely stay at the Jockey Club again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - no hassle checkout”
Reviews.Author: The_Shark
Reviews.Content: We phoned 2 days before we arrived and made sure to tell them we were arriving late. We got there with one minor problem - we had to wait a long time for a cab at the airport because it was close to midnight on a Sunday. There were no problems for check-in. We were hoping for a suite on the Bellagio side, but we were facing the construction. We did make our reservations 6 months ahead of time so that was disappointing. We did have a baby with us so we knew we would be up a lot anyways. The construction wasn't as bad as people here make it out to be. We were on the 6th floor. There was only 2 times during the whole week where we could hear the noise of trucks backing up. The price was great, we were in Vegas for a week. We were there the week of CES. We had a hotel for less than $100 a night for a suite with 2 TVs, a fridge, and a king size bed. The location is unmatched - we would get to the Bellagio or the Aladdin in 5 minutes. We watched the fountains a few times. The computers downstairs were a bonus, I would have spent $20 for the week on using them anywhere else. The last day we weren't leaving until midnight. So, we asked for a place to store luggage or something we could stay in during the day. The staff were great and set us up with a nice bachelor suite for the day, it was needed because of our baby. Overall, the place was nice. We would go back there. The outside construction should be done by next year I would think. Once they are working on the inside of the place next door it should be great. The price can't be beat during the week of CES.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Simplyjudy
Reviews.Content: If you are trading a 5 star timeshare for a week at the Jockey Club beware. This is just a hotel room with a kitchen and bedroom...what I would consider a Jr Suite at most hotels. We traded a Westgate 3 bedroom for a 1 bedroom (they claimed it was all they had). Although the hotel claims it is non smoking the smell of smoke is all over. They do construction 21 hours a day right outside your bedroom window. Taxi's refuse to come there We ran out of toilet paper and had to call 3 times to get more

Reviews.Title: “maybe in 2009?”
Reviews.Author: sundance321
Reviews.Content: I would advise people to stay away from Jockey Club until 2009 when the construction is supposed to be over, that is IF you want to sleep or hear each other speak. We were there for New years from Friday- Wednesday morning. Good thing the construction workers had New years eve off and we could catch a few winks. The beds are bouncing off the floor with all the Jack-hammering ,drilling, trucks, lights, and banging right below the building. The taxi cab situation there is really sad because no one wants to go there. We used the Bus or walked to Bellagio for a cab. The mini store is kind of dirty with way overpriced, old merchadise. The rooms are "ok" . Alittle outdated ...certainly not a beautiful place. The staff seemed nice. Did not take any photos of the place....who would want to?

Reviews.Title: “DON'T BOTHER”
Reviews.Author: mommy41
Reviews.Content: If you want a quiet room in Vegas, do not use the Jockey Club. We booked the room and were never told about the construction. When we arrived in Vegas and told the cab driver where we wanted to go, he informed us that we would NEVER get a cab to go to the Jockey Club due to limited access because of construction. He finally took us there. We were given a decent room; however, there is construction going on all around the hotel 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. A sign at the front desk informed us that we could request complimentary earplugs! We tried it, and gave up. We ended up moving to the Tropicana, and were not given a refund. The Jockey Club is set back quite a ways off the strip and if you want a cab, you'll be walking to the Bellagio or the Alladin. Do not ruin your vacation, stay far away from the Jockey Club!

Reviews.Title: “Incomparable view and super comfortable suite!”
Reviews.Author: lambs2
Reviews.Content: We are timeshare owners with Interval International Exchange and we traded our beachfront Florida unit for a week, November 7-14, 2006, at the Las Vegas Jockey Club. We knew to request a one bedroom suite on the Bellagio side and had to wait a few extra hours to move in, but - my-oh-my - we had a view from the 10th floor that was AMAZING!! We could watch the Bellagio fountain shows, and even hear the music, as often as we wanted! We also could see the Eiffel Tower at the Paris Hotel from our comfy king-sized bed each night! The full kitchen was equipped with everything you could possibly want and there was a dining table already set when we arrived!There were two large TV's, 2 DVD players, a nice stereo system, great climate control, a nice bathroom with tub/shower and everything was kept in spotless condition. Maid service was available every day. We were so very comfortable and enjoyed every minute of our week's stay! We could walk to just about everything on the strip (and we did!) We even walked one morning down to the famous 'Welcome to Las Vegas' sign south of the Mandalay Bay Resort. Or we could catch the bus at a stop right at the entrance to the Jockey Club. The staff was very friendly and helpful and we were not bothered by the construction noise from the massive mega-projects - Cosmopolitan and City center - being built to the south and west as we were in the front (Ascot) tower facing north and on the second to highest floor. We loved our oasis from the hustle and bustle on the Vegas strip and would highly recommend a stay at the Jockey Club. In fact, we liked it SO MUCH that we are currently negotiating to purchase a week of timeshare from a private owner. This is DEEDED property right in the heart of the Las Vegas strip on Las Vegas Blvd. Sounds great to us!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: pinchydog
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to the Jockey Club to meet a business associate, and spend a little time in the big city. The Jockey Club is not a Hotel/Casino, but a timeshare that has some rooms available to rent for non-timeshare owners, too. We were not aware at first, but after standing behind another guest at check in, we realized there are about 30 or so units in the Jockey Club that are separately owned and rented by the Tourist Bureau which are not a part of the Jockey Club Timeshare Condos. From what I heard from another guest, these rooms should not be your first choice, and are giving the Jockey Club Timeshare Condos a bad rap. These 30 or so units that aren’t a part of the timeshare condos are not furnished as well as the timeshare condos, are not kept up to date as far as mattresses, are not as clean, and the curtains in these rooms are also ripped. Now, when it comes to the Jockey Club Timeshare Condos they were fabulous, and even though that guest checking in was for the 30 or so units operated by the Tourist Bureau, the Jockey Club Timeshare Condos staff handled that guest with concern and integrity just like one of their guests checking into a timeshare condo. There is construction going on inside and outside of the Jockey Club, but from what I could tell, there is also construction going on all over Las Vegas. The great thing about this construction is, when it’s finished, I heard from other guests the Jockey Club Timeshare Condos will have a luxury hotel and casino right next door (opposite side of the Bellagio which is on the other side of the Jockey Club) where Jockey Club guests can access this new hotel from the Jockey Club. The noise from the construction wasn’t too bad. The fact that we had a very roomy condo with a full kitchen, stocked with utensils, pots pans, a living room, DVD player, separate bedroom with a comfortable mattress, a great view of the Strip, made it well worth it. Plus, the room was spotless and the cleaning crew was one of the best in cleaning our room every day. My kids had a great time at the pool, and I looked at the weight/workout room, and think I even lost a pound or two. We were right on the Strip, within walking distance to all the great casinos, and the Fountain Show at the Bellagio right next door was a huge hit. I would imagine if we had a room on that side, we could’ve watched it from the couch. Breakfast across the street at Paris was awesome. All in all, we would go back in a heartbeat, and enjoyed ourselves very much. The location of this resort is exceptional. If you’re going to stay in Vegas, this is the best of both worlds. You get a condominium right there in the middle of the strip, and can get to your favorite casino with no trouble or time. When the construction is finished, the new Casino and shops, right next door, will be where we spend the day, and the Jockey Club Timeshare Condos, not the 30 Tourist Bureau Condos, will be where we spend the nights.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelerToo
Reviews.Content: After reading all the horror stories about bad units and noise, I was very worried about our week (Nov 5-12) at the Jockey Club. Well, nothing could be more opposite. My wife and I had a great stay. The one bedroom, one bath condo on the 10th floor of the Derby building was excellent. Now I must say that I requested, having read the reviews, the Bellagio side of the Jockey Club, and got it. We could see the fountains every half hour. The unit was clean, modern, equipped with 2 25 inch tv's, 2 dvd players, stereo, and free dvd's (2 a night from their library downstairs). The kitchen was all that was needed and more, since we never used the stove or oven. But the coffee maker, fridge, microwave and toaster were well used. The table was set for two on arrival. The bedroom had a kingsized bed with comfortable mattress, walk in closet, and immaculate bathroom. I read that the elevators were slow, not the case. There was daily maid service, and clean towels each day. The staff were friendly and helpful. Now I must add that while I was checking in there were two ladies who said their 2 bedroom was unacceptable (they were told they were the Expedia rooms), but later on I met them again and they said they were moved to a unit that they were happy with. The construction is ongoing, they were just starting to pour concrete on one part and still digging on another side. I was told by a regular that a month ago it was noisier. But from this point on, it shouldn't be too noisy even on the other side of the buildings. The construction is on the side where the parking used to be. But the valet service was terrific, prompt, friendly and courteous, like being at one of the large Vegas hotels. I've been to Vegas at least 10 times in the last 15 years, and this is the most construction that I can recall. Everyone is expanding. It's amazing how it seems to never stop. But don't get me wrong, it doesn't hinder the action. I would definitely go to the Jockey Club again. It beats staying in a hotel room, and is centrally located, steps away from the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Great if on Bellagio side, Really Bad if on construction side”
Reviews.Author: traveler_wanttobe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for a week through time share exchange. We also had our 1 year old boy and had relatives stay over for a few days. First two days, our two-bedroom suite (5 th or 6th) was facing the construction. I am used to sleeping in the moving car and other noises but this experience confirmed that I am not immune to noise. I could not go to sleep the entire night. My pregnant wife and our one year old were worst off. On the second day, I told the front desk of the noise/sleep situation, and on third day got another two-bedroom facing Bellagio closer to the Strip. After the room change, everything was great, I did not hear any construction noise. All the inconvenice with valet and construction road was small issues compared to being close to Bellagio and other experiences. Very often I took my boy to Bellagio to play with water fountains in minature garden section (do not remember the name). When our relatives showed up to stay for a few days, they thought the place was quiet and very convenient. Stay on Bellagio side!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Ever Go There!”
Reviews.Author: kapas2000
Reviews.Content: When we booked the rooms in the resort the expedia website said that there was a construction work going on, but it was scheduled to finish 2 weeks before our arrival time, so we booked. Big mistake! A HUGE construction noise was continous throughout the entire night right under our window, we had a very hard time getting sleep at all. The "view" was the construction which was obviously going on for a while and not even close to the finish. When we complained was told that since we booked through expedia there is nothing the hotel can do for us, saying "we cant mess with expedia's rooms". We did not get an other room. So, at least we figured out why the good price... The room was dirty, the mattress cheap and uncomfortable. The pillows bulky and very overused. We have asked for a non-smoking room and was assured that we are getting one, but the entire room reeked of smoking, the mattress was the worst. When we complained we got the standard, sorry, nothing we can do... The bathroom was old and VERY small, the bathtub ugly and missing the plug, so we had to plug it with a towel to have our daughter take a bath after cleaning it ourself... The blinds did not cover the windows, there is no curtain, so the room was very well lit all night adding to the misery of the construction... This resort is old, smells bed, the stuff is unprofessional, unhelpful and unfriendly. The pool is small and uninviting. The inside is old and ugly and we had to go thrugh a long hallway and several elevators to get to our rooms because of the construction. All in all, this hotel is the worst nightmare of someone who wants a relaxing, fun vacation. Do not ever go there. Better off finding a middle priced hotel off the strip - it can not get worst than this one, trust me...

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: miaposh
Reviews.Content: This hotel could quite possibly be the worst hotel I have EVER stayed in! It is filthy and old, the staff are rude and unprofessional. First of all our rooms keys never worked, we were told we could call security each and every time we wanted to get back into our room so they could open the door for us. Most of the blinds on the window in the bedroom were broken allowing (to our horror,) the brightest light you've ever seen at 2:00 in the morning from the construction going on right outside our window. We were then told what every traveler likes to hear at 2am, there's nothing we can do. They are what they like to call a hotel in a hotel. That means that they have no resposibilty to you as the guest what's so ever and your left thinking then who does? After complaining alot to get another room, it was even more filthy and old and (to our horror,) under that window at 4:30am they were picking up the trash and delivering hotel goods. The carpet was so old that the tack strip nails poked our feet as we walked through the room. I almost fell in the shower when the support bar on the shower wall fell off in my hands. Then when we tryed to leave the valet lost our car keys. Save yourself alot of aggravation and NEVER EVER think of staying in this hotel, that should have been torned down with the Glass Pool Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: worldwidecoach
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Jockey Club for a week with two friends of ours at the end of August. We were constantly in and out of the hotel, using the valet, talking to the staff, listening to other guests, etc., so we felt that we really got to see all sides of the hotel. Our room was kept extremely clean and organized by housekeeping (we had a great view of the Bellagio). We never saw any bugs or anything that you would find unsettling anywhere on the property, day or night. The hotel staff kept the place extremely clean with vacuuming, polishing, etc., every day. Yes there was construction going on, but that was during the day. The hotel had computer stations in the lobby available for guests, as well as wireless internet. All in all it was a clean hotel, with a nice decor, and a very helpful and attentive staff. We look forward to coming back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: rotmeister
Reviews.Content: We too were concerned about the construction. The staff was very conscience of the construction and placed us in a place where we never heard a sound! We chose to go on the free grocery run and stocked up so we could eat breakfast and lunch in our room! The rooms were lovely and well appointed. As stated in previous review the pook area was the place where the construction noise was at its worst. Had been told that they did not have wireless but if you ventured to the second floor corridor or closer to the lobby you were able to pick up wireless and surf at your leasure! Loved it, would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “inside its ok”
Reviews.Author: dy222
Reviews.Content: We had read the trip advisor reviews about the Jockey Club before we went and were very concerned about the reported building work going on. We had decided before we got there that if it lived up to its reports we would check out and pay to go in one of the strip hotels. However, when we arrived we asked to be put on the side of the hotel away from the noise. We ended up with a huge suite overlooking the Bellagio on the 9th floor. We went to bed late and got up early. We had ear plugs ready anyway, asmy husband is a snorer! so I can honestly say in the week we were there we weren't affected by noise in our room. It was a different matter by the pool. Luckily it wasn't a sunbathing holiday for us and we had little time for pool relaxation, but the time we did sit by the pool was an experience not one to be repeated. If you have an Ipod and can listen to some music you will be ok, the pool is clean and refreshing and there are comfotable beds to lie on, mostly empty because of the noise. Overcrowding wouldn't ever be a problem here! The suite was exceptional, if we wanted to we could have cooked a 3 course dinner for ourselves every night. The kitchen was very well equipped. The dining room table already set when we arrived. It was so welcoming. We had clean towels and maid service every day as we wanted. You can leave a Do not disturb sign out if you don't want the housekeeper coming in. The comfort in the room was like home, lovely plump sofa, big TV in bedroom and lounge, sound system, although we didn't have time to bother. The bed was so big and comfy, good pillows, alarm clock, walk in wadrobe, fab bathroom with new soaps, shampoos, conditioner everday. A wonderful view over the Bellagio fountains and the Eiffel Tower at Hotel Paris. The staff were friendly, as were the other guests. Everyone seemed determined to respect everyone elses space, maybe because of the chaos outside! the bellhops and valets were great guys especially. If you want a taxi you need to walk around to the Bellagio, takes 3 mins to get there. There is a little shop in the club, adequate for essentials. Although if you hire a car and plan to drive out of town anywhere I'd advise getting a decent map from somewhere else other than the shop on sight. The club is in a great position for walking to most of the strip hotels. Circus Circus was a little too far in the heat, but we walked regularly down to the Venetian and Mirage. 15-20 min walk. On the other side we walked to Mandalay Bay, Luxor and that group. Again no more than 15-20 min brisk walk. If possible, I'd advise walking, as a foreigner you get so much atmosphere from being on the street. Its crowded( in August ) and noisy, but people were polite and queued and we loved the sights and smells. Some hotels even pump fragrance out ! Back to the Jockey Club, if you can forget the outside, interior corridors and make sure you get a room facing the Bellagio then its a perfect place to stay. Comfort, clean, space and good service. We'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: ropec
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were clean and comfortable the 24 hour construction was hell. Thank God we didn't bring our children with us, they wouldn't have slept at all. The constant jackhammering surrounded us wherever we went. The noise was in our unit, the pool, the gym and the sauna. We just couldn't escape it. The worst of the noise was only put on hold between 1:00a.m. and 6:00a.m. I don't think any other hotel on the strip would subject their guests to this type of noise and inconvenience. As a result I would never revisit The Jockey Club again. It would be worth spending an extra hundred dollars per night to stay at the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Bad”
Reviews.Author: Creon143
Reviews.Content: This place was ghetto. The clientel were scary and the constant construction was HORRIBLE. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Construction everywhere”
Reviews.Author: tigs_2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and gave it a great review. Our experience this time was not so great. We had construction right outside of our window and we asked for four days to get moved to a room facing north (no construction) and we finally got moved on our last night there. Great view (Bellagio fountains, Paris, etc.) but we awoke at 7:30 a.m. to construction right above our suite!! Sounded like jack hammers on the floor directly above our bed! The front desk was jaded from all the complaints, but there was one person, Blanca, who was sympathetic and was the one who moved us to the other room. She must not have known about the construction right above our suite. When we checked out early, the front desk seemed surprised. This place is a good place to stay because of its location, and the rooms are clean and the staff is nice, but due to construction projected for the next few years, we probably won't stay there again for a long while. If you don't mind the constant sound of construction, by all means stay there. If you value your sleep, avoid it for a few years.

Reviews.Title: “A good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for 4 days from May 19-22 2006. It was for a bachelorette party. I didn't do the organizing for this trip, so I wasn't too sure what we were getting into. We got to Vegas around 4pm and took a limo to the Jockey Club. It looks like a very small hotel, compared to the rest of the hotels on the strip. Front desk staff were okay, but could have been a little nicer. The lobby area was basic, but I was expecting that. Once we got up to our room, it was huge! Wasn't expecting a full kitchen, a full living room, 2 tv's and 2 big beds. We were very pleasantly surprised with all of that. Went into a friends room and the Alladdin and it was so much smaller than ours...and I'm sure they paid a lot more. We were on the 10th floor (I think that was the top) and our view was of the Monte Carlo and the big construction site that is going on between the Jockey Club and the Monte Carlo. The construction didn't really bother us as we weren't in the room very often. We went down to the pool area one morning to catch some sun.....however the hotel was covering all of the sun from pool area, so we didn't want to lay in the shade. Went for a walk down the strip insread. This was my first time in Vegas and next time I would stay at a bigger hotel.....not that there was anything wrong with this one, I would just prefer something a little more luxurious. Jockey Club is great if you are on a budget and just want somewhere to stay in Vegas. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great palce to stay.Even though it was a lot of construction happening, it was still the best place to stay at a fantastic price and close to the strip. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What an incredible place to stay, best location on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Jockey Club in one of their towers and we absolutely loved it. Our two bedroom suite was so nice and large. We had an amazing time, and we had lots of family visit us from other hotels on the strip, and they said that our hotel had the nicest feels and the best room. We had beautiful art in our suite, great beds, and great cleaning service. I read about other people complaining about construction and although it´s there, construction is everywhere you look in Las Vegas and we thought that it was cool to see it being built in front of our eyes. So no complaints about the construction from us, we enjoyed it. We enjoyed our luxury suite and what the Jockey Club had to offer. We´ll definitely be back in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about this place.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay through Expedia. Couldn't beat the price, and the place was nextdoor to the Bellagio where my daughter was staying and getting married. The place was pretty much empty. Understandable as I'm sure the massive construction project going on to the south drives alot of folks away. Rented a car after arriving at the airport. Nearly impossible to find the hotel at night as the sign on top from the south was not lit. Nor was the small sign out front lit. Found the place only by the grace of God and step by step directions provided by my daughter via cell phone. Approach from the north going south and turn after the lakes of Bellagio. Drive slow and live with the honks and you'll find the little,hidden drive to the back of the place where you will drop your car off to a valet. There is no parking lot. Valet service is free and cars are parked at the Aladin. You enter the place through a makeshift rear entrance as the original enttrance on the southside is a construction zone. Our booking, though made weeks in advance found us with a room on the fith floor and facing the construction project. These guy work 24 hours! They also do not disconnect the back-up alarms on the construction equipment at night. So we had our rest punctuated throughout the night by the constant din of beep beep beep beep beep beep beep beep beep beep....you get the point. The midnight shift is made up of a small crew of welders. The whole crew arrives and fires up the big stuff at 5:30 AM. Why oh why could the staff not place guests on the southern side of the complex? It was entertaining though when at another construction site next door across the road broke out the TNT to make digging easier. I could feel the spirit of dead mobsters who may have kept rooms here to enjoy their second lives away from home with their "other women". Dig the seventies? You'll be right in your element in your room. Where'd they park my Gremlin? This place needs an update! STAT! The pool was acceptable. The spa was interesting when some Mexicans in their underwear joined us. We left, never to venture back. Felt like I was sitting in their washing machine. Also the all the crane booms "parked" around the second story outdoor pool was less then desirable to look at. On the plus side, the complimentary free computers in the lobby were sweet. Very fast connections and convieniance. I've paid up to $9.00 for 15 minutes use at other places. The little store next to the front desk offers enough products to make dining a little more affordable during your stay. The valet service was prompt,friendly and considerate. We felt safe and secure during our three day stay. Overall a more interesting experience then a horrible one. The big plus the Jo offered was price and close location to my daughter at the Bellagio. Our next visit to LV will find us staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “18 Hour Construction”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're sensitive to noise don't book the Jockey Club. There's 18 hour construction next to the Jockey which will not completed for several years. The Jockey Club is also going through internal renovation. Such a shame - location is great (next to the Bellagio) and the rooms are nice.

Reviews.Title: “The Jockey Club - Great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: renfield1969
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there 5/2 - 5/9, and we loved our room. It was on the 10th floor and had a direct view of the Bellagio fountains. The room was very clean, and when we arrived the table had even been set. This is a timeshare suite, so comes with a fridge, stove and coffeemaker, with a small store downstairs to buy basic food items. The JC also arranges for a free shuttle to a local grocery store, in case you want to cook a lot of your meals in the room. The pool is small by LV standards, but was never crowded, and the gym and hot tub were both of a decent size. The hospitality suite downstairs was a crowning touch, as it had complimentary coffee (if you didn't feel like making your own, I guess), and boardgames and DVDs you could borrow for free. The location is absolutely perfect and I would really recommend this hotel for families. There was a lot of construction going on, but there is construction going on everywhere in LV. Once, we were woken up by a dumpster being loaded at six in the morning, but we were enjoying everything else so much that we just didn't care and went back to sleep. There was also a near-snafu with our reservation, as we called ahead to let them know we'd be checking in three days after our original date (but we had the room for eight days anyway), however our reservation still got placed with the "no-shows". I probably should have demanded a new confirmation number instead of a "no problem sir", but if that's the type of room I get for being a "no-show" then I might use that strategy every time!

Reviews.Title: “Jockey Club---Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: eric1946bige
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week,had a one bedroom suite on south side where the construction is taking place,the only sound I could here was when trucks backed up beep--beep and it was not that often . The suite was VERY NICE and VERY CLEAN and ALL THE STAFF VERY HELPFULL.This suite was a timeshare. The location was on the strip, could not be any better then that, close to the action. 100% SATISFIED Halifax N.S. Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good value - We Recommend the Jockey Club”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in a two-bed, 1.5 bath on the south side (facing the construction site) and had a very enjoyable stay. The Staff was friendly and responsive, although with the construction, there was some confusion when the time came to deliver the car (valet only at the Jockey Club). The area on the north side to which the cars are delivered, combined with intermittent construction traffic on the narrow access road cause some jams when getting cars and trying to exit the hotel. The location is excellent, as other reviewers have noted. The only possible downside might be that the rooms are a bit dated, but we didn't think that to be a significant issue. The rooms were clean and the place was well-kept up. There was smoking on our floor, so that could be annoying but we noticed only in the hallway, not in the room. Our room was very clean and well-lit; it could sleep eight with 3 full-size (queen?) beds and a roll-away. We'd heard horror stories from other reviewers about bad service and rooms and the noise with the construction. We couldn't identify with any of those complaints, really. From a value standpoint, at least with prices being what they were during spring break, The Jockey Club blew away everything else we looked at - no question. We had an enjoyable stay and would recommend the Jockey Club.

Reviews.Title: “Great on location, short on class”
Reviews.Author: Rmarc
Reviews.Content: If classy Las Vegas is what you are looking for, take a pass on the Jockey Club. But if you are looking for a great location, with clean, comfortable suites, this might be the place for you. The construction noise and dust are a huge negative, so beg to be put on the north side, preferably in the East tower. Grant at the front desk moved us on checkin to the north side, where we had a great view of Paris, and glimpses of the fountain when it was in its full glory. The unit itself was quite nice- not dated as some prior reviews have indicated. We did a trade through II for $129 for the week and felt that we got quite the bargin- left more money for Video Poker! The parking lot is totally destroyed at this point, and you have to go off property to catch a cab unless you call one for pickup. No DSL ports in the units- they have two computers in the lobby. They need to get safes in the rooms, although we had no problem with our hidden money. This property is eventually going to be totally surrounded by high rises. They are doing alot of remodeling, so it looks like they intend to be there as long as they can.

Reviews.Title: “great great great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a stay at the jockey club for a week. (FEB 10-17). When we pulled up I was thinking "Oh-my gosh what did I get my self into". We got in andcheck in was great! Be nice itsure does help. Then right to our room. We were on the 5th floor ,and not in the derby side. Wow I feltlike I was at home. Nice kitchen, living room , eating area, bedroom and bathroom. Theserooms are not brand new but I didn't think they weredated. Right out our window we could watch the water show from the bellagio. If your room is lower, i'm not sure you could see it. Anyway there was free poopcorn and dvd's(why do you need this if your in vegas, well I'll tell you . One week in vegas is way too much) I believe that is time share will not be here long It is too small and will be torn down in a few years. Construction is right next door. It isn't easy even getting in the door. Biggest thing Remember this is a condo NOT a resort. No big frills . Keep an open mind. Have a great time

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The interior room was lovely and spacious with a great view of the strip. The outside is plain and the millions walking past it probably have no idea what they are missing in their rooms. The staff was very friendly but not bothersome. This condo resort is older in age but you wouldn't know it from the well maintained condition inside. Our very comfortable visit was end of January 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Worried for Nothing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was really worried that I was in for a nightmare when I booked a week at the Jockey Club and then discovered this website with some really bad reviews of this hotel . I even booked another hotel just in case. I was pleasantly surprised. The 2 bedroom I stayed in was a little bit dated in decor but was immaculately clean, in excellent condition and spacious. Staff were fine until I asked if they had a room with the prime Bellagio Fountain view to which they replied we cannot reserve specific rooms and I would get whatever was available which of course was the parking lot/construction site view. I was told that all rooms were renovated and there were no differences. I did see 1 room that appeared quite worn and furnished quite differently when the maid left the door open as she was cleaing it. I believe I was in a timeshare exchange room so best to specify this when you book....if you can. All in all a fantastic location, good value for the price but lacking the glitz of other Vegas resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Place”
Reviews.Author: Eskimo_eh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Jockey Club from october 16-23. I was on the second floor in front of the out door pool. I paid $99.00 US exchange rate for 1 week. I had a 1 bed room every thing was in working order, but the AC had 2 settings freezing or off. The place could have used a new sofa and chair and maybe new carpet, they were clean but needs to be replaced. The location is great you have to walk through the parking lot to get to the hotel but its well lit. On the side of the building i was in you could here the garbage truck empting the bins about every second morning about 6 am that was annonying especially when you got to bed about 3 or 4 am. New hotel or condo will be going up soon in the parking lot, and the Boardwalk hotel a 2 min walk will be closing January 9, 2006 so there will be alot of construction in the area. But for the money i can't complain to much.

Reviews.Title: “construction site”
Reviews.Author: traveller_asia_us
Reviews.Content: i stayed at #1176 in derby building...penthouse level (---) the site forgot to mention that jocke club is on a construction site, the new cosmoploitan casino is being built there..in the car park of the jockey club the airconditioning unit was set to artic conditions and so noisy, took several calls to maintenance to get it fixed...furnishings and fittings dont look like they have been updated since the building was erected...so if you want noise from construction site, go to jockey club!!

Reviews.Title: “Warning! Bad outweighs the good …be very careful if you are staying at the Jo”
Reviews.Author: brerrabbit
Reviews.Content: Please read this review and the ones from Sept. 7 and October 9, 2005. Everything that was said in these 2 other reviews is correct. My husband and I stayed at the Jockey Club the nights of Sept. 15 and 16. We had made our reservations through the Las Vegas Visitors Bureau, speaking to a very pleasant woman who assured me that it was a nice facility. Well, let me itemize the good and the bad. Good: 1) Location. Right next to the Bellagio, across from the Aladdin and Paris on the mid-strip. You could not ask for a more convenient location. 2) View. Fantastic. We had room 928, which was on the north side of the Ascot tower, facing the Bellagio. We could see the beautiful Bellagio fountain show from all the rooms, and had a great view of the Eiffel Tower at the Paris casino. 3) Shampoos and soaps. 4) Clean. 5) Free parking. Bad: 1) Furnishings. Mattresses were thin and cheap to begin with, and very old to boot. You would roll to the center of all three queen -size beds and could feel the springs poking out in several places. We asked for a change of rooms due to the mattresses, but were told that it was not possible. The sheets and blankets were thin, cheap and rough (but clean). The cleanliness of the bedspread was very questionable (cheap polyester – felt kind of greasy). The remaining furniture was very worn and outdated. The carpet in this room was clean but the cheap plastic plants were very dusty. A couple of chairs had broken arms. 2) Bathrooms. Bathroom was clean, but fixtures were corroded and heavy with lime deposits. Water pressure was very poor. 3) Kitchen cabinets. They were just rough-cut plywood door fronts, with a thin coat of paint. Fixtures were really old. I am glad we were not there long enough to have to rely on the cooking facilities. I saw no roaches. I do think the cleaning staff did as good of a job as they could with the old and outdated appliances, furniture and bathroom facilities and fixtures. 4) Parking lot. Although the parking was free, it was a very dark area, full of pot holes and construction, and a little scary to walk through at night. When we got there late on a Thursday evening, the front desk had no record of our reservation. I did have a confirmation number, and after the clerk called the Las Vegas Visitors Bureau the LVVB faxed a copy of our reservation over and the clerk (I think her name was Hanna) gave us a two-bedroom unit for the one-bedroom price, which we had reserved. Hanna was very nice, but we never saw her again during our stay. The clerk at the front desk on Friday morning was not very helpful or nice. I would have hated to see the original unit, if the two-bedroom one was an upgrade! All in all, do not stay here if you are looking for a nice, relaxing place to stay on your Las Vegas vacation. Or, try to rent a unit from the timeshare company. DO NOT make a reservation through the Visitors Bureau! But if your back can stand an awful mattress and box springs and all you need is a place to crash for a night on your way through Las Vegas this might be the place for you. I have attached a scan of the Jockey Club layout. Also attached are a couple of photos of the view from room 928 (the view and location were the Jockey Club’s best features). The room was so depressing that I didn’t take any photos of it.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty 1 star hotel - the truth about the Jockey Club”
Reviews.Author: PuppyDog343
Reviews.Content: Warning: the good reviews you see about the Jockey Club are from people who stayed in the time share suites. The Jockey Club is a strange hotel. One wing of the hotel is owned by a time share company and they keep the hotel up to a 2 to 2 1/2 star level. The other wing is owned by the Las Vegas Vistors Bureau this is where the problems begin. I have stayed in hundreds of hotels in my life and this is the worst one by far!!! The carpet was horribly stained, the mattresses were broken, there was mold growing in the tub, there were chunks broken off of furniture. We went downstairs and demanded another room and were given one that was no better. They advertise themselves as a 3 star hotel when they shouldn't even qualify for a 1 star. Las Vegas Visitors Bureau side of the Jockey Club is barely habitable. Be very, very careful when you book this hotel. Make sure that you ask who actually owns the hotel suite you will stay in. If its the Visitors Bureau - don't do it! I believe that if you book directly off the internet at Expedia, Travelocity, etc... it is always a Las Vegas Visitors Bureau suite, so buyer beware online. I can't warn you enough! Don't stay here if you want a good trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be beat”
Reviews.Author: emailman1
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for $89 for the week with a timeshare. The price obviously cannot be beat for a week. The location was excellent. The pool was a little small, but we enjoyed it. The 1 bedroom was very spacious for me and my wife and 2 of our friends. Checkin was fast, maid service was good. As others have mentioned, it was nice and quiet there due to no casino, and that came in handy as we were going to sleep around 4 or 5 in the morning. They are going to build the Cosmopolitan right around the JC, and I am happy about it, because I will stay there next time I go to LV. I do not know what the prices for the "hotel" rental part of the JC, but if you can trade to the JC, I recommend it. The only bad thing was I did not win this trip. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A sweet surprise! Great room, great views, perfect Strip locale & free parking!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant suprise - for the price, it was a wonderful, nicely decorated condo with full service kitchen and very comfortable. The staff were friendly and it felt homey and welcoming. The free parking and easy in and out access to the Strip was a major plus as was the closeness to convenience stores (to stock the kitchen!), economical restaurants and some of the best sights to see on the Strip. I plan to visit again in October 2005 and the Jockey Club is my number one choice of accommodation. It may be the best kept secet in Las Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Las Vegas on July 1- July 4th and stayed at the Jockey Club with 16 other friends. We rented 3 condos. There was plenty of room for all of us with their 2 beds, and pull out couch. We liked the spot because it was great location for all of us for walking distance. We would stay there again. JC- Grand Junction, CO

Reviews.Title: “A+ service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our week at the Jockey Club was excellent. I am not used to having daily maid service with a time share program. Being there in the heat of the summer meant that the 3 of us were sometimes taking two showers a day. The cleaning service kept up with clean towels daily and plenty of them. They also arrange for a full cleaning mid-week, free of charge. The front desk was extrememly helpful. They provided us with a taxi service from the front door to the airport - which was much appreciated. Even though you can walk around to the Bellagio and get a ride from there, we spared ourselves the heat and stayed in the A/C until our ride arrived. You'll be a little taken back with the fact that the facility is located in a parking lot when everyone else has filled their available space with greenery. But don't let that stop you from booking a reservation. Really, really a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “High marks for Jockey Club”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived for Memorial Day weekend. Big, clean room. Great views. Contrary to some other opinions, I found the staff very helpful and responsive. They had cribs and high chairs already in the room (no charge) when we arrived. Our request for two rooms together and facing Bellagio was honored even though that was not guaranteed at the time of our reservation. Excellent location and just steps from the strip. Getting a cab was a little difficult, but the short walk to the Bellagio taxi stand was not much of a problem. The pool is very ordinary and if you need a nice pool I suggest you look elsewhere. Otherwise, if you want an affordable, large, clean room in the middle of it all, the Jockey Club is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite stay at the Jockey Club on April 13-19th, 2005”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I staid at the Jockey Club this past April in a beautiful penthouse suite and loved it. It was spacious and my family and I had an amazing time and spent a geat reuninon together. I would say that the penthouse I staid in, was better than any hotel on the strip. The bldg. is older than the others on the strip, but has all the great and clean amenities I would want when traveling. My suite was beautifully furnished and it allowed me a lot of flexibility and freedom. Anyways I would gladly come 3x-4x a year and stay at the beautiful penthouse suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jockey Club on the 28th of April for an entire week. I would recommend this place to anyone. The views were great and we were walking distance to everything. The rooms were very nice and the place was very clean. Housekeeping was available everyday with fresh towels, soap and shampoo. We did not have a rental car to go to the grocery store but the Jockey Club does run a shuttle service on Tuesdays that runs to the grocery store and back to the hotel. I can honestly say that I had no complaints about the place except that if you bring 6 people the only shower is in the master bedroom. It would be great if there was a shower in the half bath so that the people in bedroom do not get disturbed. The hotel also supplied free coffee, popcorn and internet use.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the strip...”
Reviews.Author: Trupes
Reviews.Content: The Jockey Club is located in an ideal location on the "Strip". We had a comfortable and clean one bedroom unit on the 5th. floor which overlooked the beautiful Bellagio Hotel and its fountain. Our unit was in the Ascot Tower. Staff were very accomodating, helpful and friendly. There are no gambling traps in The Jockey Club which is such a pleasant and welcoming relief after a day on the Strip. If you are in the market for an acre of land on the Strip it is going for $22 million an acre!! We highly recommend MYSTERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good value at a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Enable
Reviews.Content: I won a week in a one bedroom apartment at the Jockey Club for the week of November 10 through 17 through SkyAuction. Since my winning bid was $7 (plus taxes and fees), it was a real steal. Although it is a timeshare, I never was bothered to submit to a pitch. It is an older, but fairly well maintained property. It goes back to the 1970s, when Frank Sinatra and the "Rat Pack" frequented there. My apartment was on the eighth floor on south side of the far building, facing a large parking lot, with the Monte Carlo in the distance. The view from the other side of the building is the Bellagio, which is next door, and across Las Vegas Blvd. was the entrance to Desert Passage at the Alladin. First, my complaints. Like the casino hotels on the Strip, there is a hike from the Strip to the lobby, and another hike to my room. I was locked out of my room near midnight one evening (the card key was changed), but the maintenance man was very conscientious in helping me out and refused a tip. Tour and shuttle buses tend to stop at the Jockey Club last, in part because there is no immediate crossover of Las Vegas Blvd. The cable connection for the TV in the living room was not secure, so I wound up using the second TV in the bedroom (fortunately, there were a couple of chairs and a small table in the bedroom). However, compensating for this, is that I doubt that one can get a one bedroom suite (or perhaps two bedrooms) in such a prime location at a lower price. There is a convenience store in the lobby which is better stocked than nearby stores such as Walgreen's, CVS, and one in the Desert Passage. Near the lobby, there are two free computers with high-speed internet connections for time-share owners and their guests. If you are not planning to prepare all your meals in your well stocked kitchen, my suggestion would be to go to the nearby Paris Casino, which has several good (French-style) restaurants at moderate prices. The MGM-Grand has purchased the nearby Boardwalk Casino and has plans to tear it down and build one continuous resort and urban community between the Bellagio and the Monte Carlo. If the Jockey Club remains in place, it will become even more desirable. If the Jockey Cub doesn't survive this development, you don't have much time to enjoy this bit of Las Vegas history at a moderate price.

HotelInfo.Name: Jockey Club
HotelInfo.Address: 3700 Las Vegas Boulevard South, Las Vegas, NV 89109
